reviews.author: Vedang Shevade
reviews.description:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Mamagoto, and I must say, it was an extraordinary experience. Specializing in Korean cuisine, Mamagoto offers an array of delectable dishes that left my taste buds wanting more.

We started our meal with the Veg Pan Fried Bao and the Veg Crystal Dimdims. Both dishes were beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The bao was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, while the dimdims were delicate and savory, each bite a delight.

The Sushi Platter was a work of art. The fresh, high-quality ingredients were evident in every piece, and the variety ensured there was something for everyone to enjoy. The Spicy Ramen Bowl was another highlight, with its rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles. The spice level was just right, adding a kick without overwhelming the palate.

For the main course, we opted for the Bangkok Spicy Bowl with sticky rice. The bowl was a vibrant mix of fresh vegetables, tender tofu, and a sauce that was both spicy and tangy, perfectly complemented by the sticky rice. It was a true explosion of flavors that transported us straight to the bustling streets of Bangkok.

Beyond the incredible food, the service at Mamagoto was exceptional. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and went out of their way to ensure we had a memorable dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant was also top-notch – chic, comfortable, and inviting, making it the perfect spot for both casual outings and special occasions.

In summary, Mamagoto is a must-visit for anyone who appreciates high-quality Korean cuisine and exceptional service. I can't wait to return and explore more of their diverse and mouthwatering menu.

reviews.author: Mandar Bhosale
reviews.description:
**Mamagoto: A Culinary Adventure**

🌟🌟🌟🌟☆ (4 out of 5 stars)

*Location*: Pune, Maharashtra, India

**Ambiance**:
Mamagoto's cozy and vibrant atmosphere sets the stage for a delightful dining experience. The graffiti-style art and manga-inspired murals add a playful touch.

**Small Plates**:
- *Mussorrie Mall Spring Roll*: Crispy and flavorful, a great start to the meal.
- *Crispy Lotus Stem*: A unique and addictive appetizer.

**Main Course**:
- *Three Pepper Bomb*: A fiery explosion of flavors—perfect for spice lovers.
- *Stir-Fried With Burnt Garlic*: Comforting and aromatic.

**Rice And Noodles**:
- *Fried Rice*: Light and fluffy, with a medley of veggies.
- *Hakka Noodles*: Wok-tossed perfection.
- *Steamed Rice*: Simple and satisfying.

**Dessert**:
- *Coconut & Palm Sugar Flavoured ice-cream *: A sweet finale that transports you to tropical shores.

**Service**:
Attentive staff ensured a pleasant dining experience.

**Improvement Areas**:
While the menu is impressive, a few more vegetarian options would be appreciated.

**Overall**:
Mama Gatho offers a flavorful journey through Asian cuisine. Whether you're a spice enthusiast or a dessert lover, there's something for everyone. 🍽️✨

---

Remember, taste is subjective, so explore the menu and discover your favorites! 😊

reviews.author: Bhanushalivijay
reviews.description:
Scanned multiple restaurants today for a good dining experience and we landed here... Glad we dined at this place, the choice was perfect....

Good ambience, Great staff and scrumptious food...

Vikas served us and he hosted us very well...Silent but solid !!

Had a good variety of items to eat and all of this were good.... We ordered Bau, Dimaum, Sushi, Thai Curry, and Lotus stem.. Each item scored well except the Lotus stem. the staff, however took the feedback very positively and worked to compensate and make the overall experience great....

We leave completely delighted and satisfied, with a promise to come back soon...

reviews.author: Aishwarya Shenolikar
reviews.description:
Visited Mamagoto at The Pavillion Mall. Had very high expectations because of the reviews and menu.

Beverages:
The Mocktails and non-alcoholic beverages options were terrible. The combinations in each beverage did not aound6at all pleasing.

Food:
While there is an extensive menu, there are limited vegetarian options. And the ones that are available have an excess of spices or mushrooms and all of it was told to us as something that will not be tasty.

Crispy Lotus Stem 3/5
Spicy Ramen Bowl 4/5
Stir Fried Vegetables with Almonds 3/5
Soggy Thai Fried Rice 2/5

Desserts:
Again, very limited options for desserts so didn't have any.

Service:
We asked recommendations from the woman at the front desk who did a shoddy job of it by basically not recommending anything. Her explanation was not helpful and since there was a limited menu, we had to stick to very basic items. Needed to ask to clear the table and clean it multiple times.

Vibes:
Vibes were 5/5 with pretty decor, lovely aesthetics and tolerable volume of music.

reviews.description: Very very slow service, portions size is very less , attitude of the server was wrong...don't know why they didn't gave any attention to us may be they don't like our face ... overpriced as shit...

Staff is not attentive at all. very poor service. waited 15 mins but no 1 even bothered to give water, menu card, cutlery. had to call 3 times to get their attention. their was no cutlery on table, no paper napkins, no table napkins.

finally when 1 waiter arrived, we asked if this is the way they are going to provide a service then please let us know in the beginning itself, so that we can leave before placing any order.

After that the service was better. Still didn't get any paper napkins, or table cloth napkins till the end. had to ask 3 people for chopsticks then they provided.

food is good, no complaints. but service staff needs a whole lot of improvement.

Good thing is atleast they waived the service charges after asking them to do so.

reviews.author: Tushar Mhatre
reviews.description:
# Mamagoto
We accidentally stumbled upon this place while searching for places to eat on google maps.
Water getting to know that it was located in the Pavillion mall, we expected it to be on the higher side of the budget and sure it was.
The staff was very friendly, no complaints whatsoever in that regards.
The food was good as well.
I wanted to eat Ramen for so long and to find that on the menu here, made me very happy.
I’ve eaten ramen only a couple of times before but out of all those, i found the Ramen here as the best. “Mama’s spicy Ramen bowl” was the name of the dish. And we shared it between two of us. They provided it in two bowls.
The other things we ordered was Aunty’s platter (non-vegetarian), which was good as well.
My default go to,wherever i go, “the virgin mojito” was good as well.￼
Overall, it was a good experience.

reviews.author: Sparsh
reviews.description:
I had an exceptional dining experience at the Mamagoto. The dimsums were a standout – I opted for the dimsum basket, which offered a delightful variety of five different dimsums. Each one was a palate-pleasing delight, and I couldn't get enough of them.

Their approach to serving ramen was unique and customer-centric. They asked if I'd prefer it in two separate servings, which added a touch of personalization to the experience.

The restaurant's ambiance was top-notch, providing a fantastic backdrop for a memorable meal. The lovely music in the background only enhanced the overall atmosphere.

In every second I spent there, I enjoyed the flavors, the service, and the atmosphere. It's a place that clearly values the customer's dining experience.

reviews.author: Piyush Phalak
reviews.description: This was the second time I had ordered from the restaurant. The taste is okay okay. It's mixed of Indo Chinese and actual Chinese, so kind of a hit and miss if you are expecting either. There are limited options in gravy and no options for combo (rice/noodles + gravy). Previously ha ordered some of the actual Chinese items, but they were not so good, so stocked to traditional fried rice and hakka noodles, which turned out as above. The quantity is so that it will be just enough of you are a normal portion person leave a bit to desire. The packaging is great and environment friendly. The food preparation usually takes time, so hopefully that means that the food is freshly prepared.

reviews.description: Taste

reviews.author: S Dharap
reviews.description:
Mamagato exceeded our expectations with its amazing ambiance, prompt service, and outstanding food.

The restaurant's cozy interior and elegant decor set the perfect mood for a relaxed evening. Despite a small staff, the service was top-notch, ensuring our dishes arrived hot and on time. The wild mushroom and cream cheese dimsums, avocado sushi rolls, and shrimp pan-fried noodles were all bursting with flavors that delighted our palates.

Overall, Mamagato provided us with a fantastic dining experience that left us thoroughly satisfied.

reviews.author: Vivek Chandra
reviews.description: Very nice food, courteous staff and beautiful cutleries. Special shout out to Vikas for suggesting us some delicacies which we actually cherished.

reviews.author: Ankita Dharmadhikari
reviews.description: authentic chinese food. service was fast, the delegate Vikas was friendly and suggested superb choices.

reviews.author: Vivek
reviews.description:
just finished dining here. the food is amazing, the ambience, especially the paintings hanging from the ceilings.

had the tossed crispy Lotus stems. perfectly balanced

the wild mushroom edmame dimsums are a delight, one of the best dimsums I have had.

the mamagoto avocado kapa maki sushi was great as well and so was crystal chicken dimsum


However the highlight was the mocktails prepared by Devendra. we had the Bangok red eye and The rabbit. both were so great, unlike any mocktail. absolutely no sugar added, naturally refreshing. the rabbit because of the kaffir lime hint was especially good.

reviews.author: Nerkarajinkya@gmail.com
reviews.description: This is so amazing ! Pure Japanese vibe at this place great Japanese uptown ambience  , everyone from the crew was so attentive and then we were served the crackers twice till the sushi arrived ! Tried salmon sushi it's good, ask for all the sauces as the sushi comes with only one that's mostly light soy sauce and also tried a veg asparagus sushi it's good comes with cream inside a sushi ! Had a kiwi mocktail to go with . Everything was full of flavours . This is a must try even if you have never had Japanese food. Special thanks to Kameshwar who helped us throughout and even gave us a carry bag for carrying the water bottle !

reviews.author: Meenu Goel
reviews.description:
When one of the best Asian restaurants in the city launches a new menu, is is the perfect occasion to plan an outing!

Soft pillowy baos, exquisite tacos like never before, melt-in-the-mouth perfect dimsums and a plethora of sushi options to choose from…

Mamagoto recently launched an all new bao-taco-dimsums-sushi menu that is unique and yet true to its Asian roots.

With several veg and non-veg options to choose from, I personally loved how the variety is a fine balance of familiar & unique offerings alike.

We tried the:
Veg Pan Fried Bao
Goat Cheese Tacos
Wild Mushroom, Edamame, Cream Cheese & Truffle Oil Dimsums
Asparagus Tempura & Cream Cheese Uramaki

Strawberry and Thyme sangria and Mango Mule were our choices of mocktails that made for the perfect accompaniment!

Like me, if you absolutely love Asian food, add Mamagoto to your list of things to do asap!

reviews.author: Priya K
reviews.description:
MAMAGOTO has been my favourite go to place when it came to Asian food. And the new additions to their menu are an icing on the cake to the already fantastic food.
They have recently added Sushi , Baos & Tacos to their menu which are a must try , absolutely delicious.

I tried the crab Uramaki sushi - highlight of this dish it is topped with caviar. Do I need to say more, it’s the best sushi you can try.
Along with it , we ordered the non veg Dimsums basket - this included Gyazo , Pok Choi, street style chicken along with shrimp bamboo shoot and roasted duck Dimsums. A complete delight in one basket.
Another dish I absolutely recommend are the Pork belly baos - tender boas stuffed with juicy pork that’s sweet & spicy and a delight for the tastebuds.

Visiting soon, to try more amazing dishes from the new additions to the menu.

reviews.author: Shweta S
reviews.description:
My friend and I decided to go to Mamagoto for lunch. We are big fans of Asian food and Mamagoto didn't disappoint.

Food- We ordered vegetarian food starting with Tom yum soup ( good portion size ), Tempura Asparagus sushi ( good, but too much Cream cheese), crystal dimsum ( good), Hot Spicy Rice ( tangy, spicy and good). Overall the food was delicious.

Service- The host as well as the servers were friendly and attentive. The menu card did say that the restaurant charges 5% voluntary service charge and I thought that was reasonable and was happy to pay it.
The only thing that irked me was that the server started cleaning the table while I was eating. He was clearing the dishes and pots that were empty and every time he did that I had to stop eating and make way for him. Also the conversation between me and my friend would pause.

Apart from this negligible instance, mamagoto is a must try.

reviews.author: Zebaa Shaikh
reviews.description:
You gonna love this place. The interior is really cute and colourful. Place is situated inside the Pavilion mall. It has indoor and outdoor seating setup. Has a lovely bar too.

They serve asian food along with some freshly made sushis, small plates, dimsums, and my favourite asian bowls.

Menu is wide and curated mindfully. Chef is really talented and knows how to impress someone by making the best dish.

I absolutely loved their assorted dimsums which had chicken, prawns, fish and duck too.

Nippon brocolli and date salad was something which i never had before, how brocolli and dates can go together perfectly, still wondering 🤔

Floating market soup was the most comfortable thing this rainy season.

They have trained staff and people are humble, we were served by SURYA, he is sweet and hardworking. Cheers to Surya.

At the end i ordered coconut flavoured banana fritters with vanilla ice cream, the best dessert you can try.

reviews.author: Prakash Prabhakar
reviews.description:
I am probably the first one giving a negative comment on the dining experience here. And i sincerely hope I be the last one too. So this wasn't my first time here and i keep visiting mamagoto for the love of their cuisine. However what they did today was beyond my imagination. I ordered 2 items, a dimsum and a broth and specifically mentioned to the staff taking orders (Hulji Patil) to bring broth later as i wanted it hot. Then it took them some good 20-25 mins and they still didn't serve anything. On questioning one of the other staffs responded 'Apka pura hi order 5 min me aa jaega'. I immediately called Hulji and asked why are they bringing it together? He started covering up saying 'No apka dimsum hi pehle aega'. I however knew they have already prepared the broth too otherwise that staff wouldn't have mentioned so. I clearly said I won't pay for broth if you bring it together and it goes cold by the time I finish dimsum. As very much expected, they brought the broth immediately after serving dimsums and i refused to accept that. I also said I won't accept it even if you take it back only to reheat and bring back.They kept repeating 'No hum fresh bana denge' which was hard for me to believe and i responded 'ghanta fresh banaoge ap'. In some time they brought two bowls of broth to my table to prove they have actually prepared again. Till here I was still fine. But then this another staff Sandesh Pawar steps in and i ask on a weekday with not much of crowd you people do this much ghapla!! He gets agitated and responds 'humare yaha koi ghapla nhi hota madam na hi ghanta milta hai...sirf broth milta hai ' Here I lost all patience, i did not respond to it immediately but when they came back asking if I am liking the broth I said that doesn't matter now after the response one of their staff has dared to provide. I clearly said i will mention all this in Zomato review. To which they suddenly changed tunes like 'apne bhi to Aisa Aisa bola tha '. Then comes their chef from kitchen to apologise. They also offered a free dessert which I denied and i clearly said 'review to likhaega hi'. Then they didn't include the dimsums in bill which took them longer and caused all this pain. I still clearly mentioned i would definitely write a review mentioning everything. They did apologize later saying stuffs like chefs inside do not really wait on preparing any order as there are movie goers who come to the mall etc.
Long story cut short.... food was good.... service very pathetic.

reviews.author: Vaibhav
reviews.description:
You get mesmerised as soon as you step into the restaurant - the interiors, aesthetics, and vibe everything is on-point. They have worked on all the details that surely impress you with the big picture of a lady smoking a pipe, the wall of Chinese cat dolls, and the roof made with all beautiful paintings creating a perfect vibe for an amazing experience. Their seating is also well spaced and very comfortable.
The service at Mamagoto is just fantastic. Mr. Surya attended us during the visit and gave the best service possible well-spoken, well-versed with the entire menu, and always on toes to serve us the best. We were thoroughly impressed with him and the entire team.

Now let us take a look and their culinary offerings
As soon as you settle down they serve a bowl full of rice crackers and sauce. This is a good gesture as you don't have to stay hungry while ordering your food.
We started with a Soup
Bhupi's Comfort Soup for the Corporate Soul
I read the name and I knew it I'm having this one, the name itself is so interesting and chef Bhupi has done justice. The light broth with vegetables and chicken was super yummy and as the name suggests it was comforting.

Then we moved to starters.
Sushi
Soft Shell Crab Uramaki
Absolutely fantastic roll. Super fresh and high quality ingredients hand rolled with love. It was a real pleasure eating this Uramaki. If you are a sushi lover then this one is a must try.

Dim Sum
Roasted Duck & Shitake Pot Stickers
Think layered dim sums filled with flavorful duck and mushrooms were pan tossed to crisp. Meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked which enhanced the experience.

Spicy Prawns Sui Mai
This was a soul warming dish. Four delicate and delicious dim sums served in a lovey sauce. The sauce was similar to tom kha with very thin consistency. This one another must try here.

Mains:
Kolkata Spicy Noodles
Ooohh la la! Perfect Chindian (Chinese + Indian) dish. We all know journey of Chinese cuisine in India began at Kolkata and this dish is a perfect representation of that journey. Mind you, this is spicy and that was my favorite part.

Mamagoto means Play with the food and here thy have played with food, they are not authentic Asian but Asian inspired pan-Asian cuisine. Our entire experience was fantastic, from start to end everything was more than expected. Thank you so much team Mamagoto.

reviews.description: Had one of the best dining experiences here. Right strong the interior decor to the menu, everything was a perfect blend. Grateful to Rameshwar and Sandesh for helping us curate our dinner and for the lovely service. A must visit if you’re looking for a place/menu out of the ordinary.

reviews.author: Chinmayi Reviews
reviews.description:
Have a date night?
Looking for Asian cuisine?
Done with shopping at the mall and looking for a nice and cosy place for a family meal?

Look no further!!! Head to @mamagotofunasian located at 2nd floor of Pavillion mall for a scrumptious meal.

What have I tried?

Lavender and coconut lemonade
Mango mule

Both were quite refreshing and tasty.

Rainbow sushi
Ebi tempura uramaki
🍤🍣
Rainbow sushi was colorful looking and filled with smoked salmon. Topped with thinly sliced avocado, salmon, tuna and wasabi mayo. Ebi tempura uramaki was filled with crispy prawns with cucumber and topped with crispy tempura.

Bacon wrapped prawns
Chicken and water chestnut salad
🥓🍤🍗🥗
Salad was lovely. Flavors bursting through each bite. Very moist chicken chunks soaked in beautiful dressing. Bacon wrapped prawns too were really nice which were served along with bacon jam (yumyumm). A bit on the sweeter side overall but I loved it :)

Chicken laksa
Fiery Thai shrimp fried rice with Asian green chilli chicken
🍝🍛
Laksa tribute is must try. Very coconuty and creamy laksa curry topped with fried condiments and boiled egg.

Coconut flavored banana fritters with ice cream
Baked cheesecake
🍰🍧
Frankly baked cheesecake wasn't too impressive. It was very dryish and the crust too was bit thick and hard.
Banana fritters on the other hand were quite good. Personally I would prefer bit ripen banana, this one was bit on a raw side.

All in all a good meal. And good service.

Am I going back??
Ohh yesss :)

@tastings_we_do
reviews.description:
An amazing place to have some authentic asian food. Loved the ambiance, so colourful, so peaceful. Have had the best meals recently. The staff is sooo kind, explains everything and special mention to our main help Mr. Surya for being soo helpful and polite. We ordered some of their classics and also the bestsellers:
Tom yum soup - It being a classic Thai soup, was hot yet tangy. A really really good soup !
Nippon Broccoli and Date salad - This definately goes in my favourites list. What a delicious salad it was.
Aunty's Platter - One of its kind, this platter was soo soo good, included : Mussoorie roll, gyozas, lotus stem, basil cups.
The Mocktails were soo refreshing one of it being made with watermelon and the other has mint and muskmelon. Great taste!
Also had a baked blueberry cheesecake and it was yummm, super soft super tender. Had an amazing cheesecake after a very long time.
All together my experience was really good. And the food was delicious!
Highly recommending this place !

reviews.author: Tanvi Kadam
reviews.description:
It was a good experience at Mamagoto.
1. The ambience is very well designed and clean.
2. The staff is co-operative and suggests you good food and service is kind too.
3. Coming to the food, I had berry smoothie but it was a bit tangy. They hav limited options in mocktails butin a way it's good so there is not much confusion :p We had the spicy tuna uramaki and it was yumm. Worth the price. Their crispy Lotus stem is a nice appetizer (simple munchy) and we had 1990 chili chicken which was good and not that spicy as indicated on the menu.

All in all a good place with great food and great service. Do try it 😃

reviews.author: Anantha Krishnan
reviews.description: The food was very delicious, ambience was cozy and waiter Mr. Surya served us very well. Had a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Jay Shah
reviews.description:
I had seen mamagoto 2 years ago while id visited the mall to watch a movie.

The cuisine is pan asian , authentic asian . Truly the menu does justice to the cuisine. The items we ordered were on point with authentic flavours.

We tried the chinese pepper soup and it was just right for this weather. Nicely sliced shitake mushrooms , the umami smell of the mushrooms along with the tofu was good. The sauces used just blended well with the pepper . Sure did help take my cold away

Moving on to the starters , first we had the 1990s chilly chicken. It was good - not too spicy . The portion was right but there was too much aditional vegetables going on - maybe that can be reduced - because after eating most of it i had enough left for one more portion of this plate.

We ordered the duck and shitake mushrooms potstickers. They were wow. Juicy sweet duck topped with their chilly sauce was bang on

By this time i was alredy full so for mains we tried their new item - sticky rice. This was a bowl of warm hug. Perfectly sorched rice with a chicken broth (thicker) , hot and soulful in the end.

The quantity of every item was just about right for two people.

Our meal was served with a smile and it was as hearty as the staff and their politeness.

The 4 star is for all this.

Now the billing - our total bill without service charge and gst was 2484 . Which is acceptable because in general it does cost that much in any authentic pan Asian restaurant.

No service charge - we were informed by the staff that they levy a 10% sc - which i think is a little overboard. It is just a suggestion if you can reduce it to acceptable rates like 5% the crowd might agree to it also because again like i said their service was fast and really good.

Overall i has a very good 1st experience and i think ive found my to go place in that area

reviews.author: Sayali Thatte
reviews.description: Mamagoto is the Perfect place to satisfy cravings for Asian cuisine, after a tiring shopping trip in Pavilion mall. We ordered Old school chicken gyozas, cream cheese and mushroom dim sums and also the four mushroom dim sums. Each dim sum basket was delectable and well made. We also had the pink ice tea, which was well balanced. The staff is courteous and attentive. Special thanks to Mr Surya for his attention to detail and overall service.

reviews.author: Adarsh Elamplavil
reviews.description:
One of the more interesting dining experiences I've had so far!

Upon arrival at the place at ~10pm, we ordered the assorted dimsums basket, California roll, chamomile teapot and lemongrass ice tea to get the ball rolling;
Every dish ordered so far tasted gorgeous and fresh, and the order was fulfilled in a very respectable time. The lemongrass ice tea however, wasn't upto the high standards set by the other dishes. Huge shoutout to chef vasanti for the sushi!

By the time we were done eating all of this, it was already past 11pm and we placed the final order for the night, which consisted of crispy rice and banofee pie. Rameshwar hosted us wonderfully, letting us know about the status of our food every now and then, considering the order was placed just as they started to close the kitchen. We were served our final dishes at 11:45pm.

We were the only ones in the restaurant, and the experience was surreal.

A minor setback to the otherwise wonderful experience was that the banofee pie we ordered had been cancelled due to quality concerns (they refused to serve it because it was molten). This was honestly a good move from the mamagoto team because they cared a lot about the quality of food coming out of the kitchen.

We were offered complementary coconut and palm sugar ice cream as a cherry on top of what was an amazing experience overall. I'd recommend you to definitely check this place out!

reviews.author: Dhanashreemeets
reviews.description: I love this place and have always been visiting  since it has opened it's branch in Pune. I am  glad it's back after 2years of lockdown. The dim sums are my all time favourite. Do try their pad thai noodles and sushi 🍣 . The staff is courteous and also suggested many dishes . We were attended by  Mr. Rameshwar and service was quick.  Thank you for serving us 🤠 and the amazing food ❤️

reviews.author: Supriya Chaubal
reviews.description:
Recently visited this place for Father’s Day shopping. Mamagoto is known for serving amazing Asian food Thai, Japanese, Chinese and the menu has popular street foods.

We started with a few coolers
Passion Fruit & Orange Cooler
Melon Punch
Which arrived with rice crackers!

Starters
Street style chicken momos
Prawn and celery Dim sum
Both had a thin coating and so flavourful. These are perfect starters I n the rains!
California sushi with crab sticks
Avocado Maki
Both have a contemporary Mama’s contemporary twist. Loved the freshness and taste.


Mains
Prawn & Crab meat with Edamame came nestled in yellow curry. The curry was to die for. Simply won us all over.
Mama’s Goreng with chicken satay with mama’s fusion twists. Mildly flavourful satay.
Mama’s Chicken Ramen Bowl a wholesome bowl of goodness. Loved it
Veg Hakka Noodles were also good.

Desserts
Banofee Pie
Mama’s Chocolate Cake
Caramel Sponge Cake with vanilla ice cream

Their signature Caramel sponge cake with the salty caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream is a must have.


Everything served is eye catching and tastes is fabulous. An amazing fine dining experience with interiors, service and food having a warm Asian touch. Full marks to service.
Will definitely recommend you try out this place



Follow me@supriyachaubal11 for latest updates in your city
*******************************

reviews.author: Komal Adhav
reviews.description:
Had Visited Pavillion mall for some Father’s day shopping .
Thought of trying out Pan Asian food at Mamagotos
Surprisingly the name had changed to Papagotos, on asking came to know that it’s just for a week for Father’s Day
It’s a beautifully decorated Asian themed restaurant with a lot of detailing done. There are so many frames, curios and the wallpaper too has chinese and japanese elements on it.
The Bar has Stools with Panda print
Cant miss the Wall with their Iconic Boss lady
After we were comfortably seated , ordered a few starters and mocktails.
They gave a summer special mocktails menu as well
The food is Undoubtedly delicious and an amalgamation of pan asian cuisine with a modern twist hence they say it isn’t Authentic cuisine but Fun Asian dining

Great Service .

We tried :
Drinks :

Wasabi Mary: For those who love Bloody mary , with an added wasabi twist in the tomato juice based drink.

Lavender and coconut lemonade : Very unique, highly recommended

Cranberry & Kaffir lime punch: was quite refreshing, cranberry juice with kaffir lime punch

Kiwi and Mint Collins: Was like a kiwi mojito

Mama’s Melon Punch: Fresh muskmelon juice served in a scooped out muskmelon




Food :

Thai Chicken & Water Chestnut salad: Very delicious , slightly sweet .. Water chestnuts were crunchy and chicken went very well with that . Generous amount of roasted peanuts as well

Hong kong style chicken : Boneless chicken pieces fried and tossed in a mix of dessicated coconut, chillies etc .. Was good but quite dry

1990’s chilli chicken : Classic chilli chicken the way I love it

Teriyaki skewers, Chicken : Chicken pieces on skewers marinated in light soy sauce based marinade. Served with Wasabi mayonnaise

Nigiri Sushi , Salmon : The first time I tried Nigiri sushi . Loved it . More of salmon do it tasted better than regular sushi

Prawn & Crab meat with Edamame dumplings : Their signature dish , dumplings were in a coconut milk based thick gravy with edamame . Must try

Mama’s Hot spicy fried rice : Regular fried rice . Was ok , there a lot of better things to try here so can skip this.

Desserts:
Caramel sponge cake : Absolutely Heavenly! Mawa cake topped with a caramel toffee sauce served with vanilla Ice cream

Banofee pie : Layers of Cookie crumbs, banana & whipped cream. I preferred the other desserts.

Coconut Flavoured Banana Fritters with Vanilla Ice Cream : Was a unique combination, it’s nice

reviews.author: DrAnupam Potdar
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is absolutely the prettiest and most characterful Asian Restaurant I've ever seen. I've been here before a long time ago and unfortunately wasn't super impressed but I visited again recently and I have to say they've redeemed themselves.

Maki Platter - Really amazing sushi. Chicken, Prawn Tempura and California roll. 4 pieces each. So you get some crunchy, some fishy and some prawn ones. I had this last time too, but at that time the sushi was not fresh and flavours were off. But this time it was great.

Mama's Spicy Ramen Bowl - Oh man!! Hot, spicy ridiculously flavourful broth! Soft noodles, but still retaining a satisfying bite with loads of vegetables, boiled and chicken. Such a heart warming and cozy bowl. And it's huge! (I wish they had a pork version!)

Jasmine Tea - Had a whole warming pot of light refreshing Jasmine tea! The mild flavour is just so good, I finished the whole pot alone!

reviews.author: Esheeta Sanyal
reviews.description: Visited mamagoto with my parents. We liked the food here. Really liked the tom yum soup. special mention of Raju who was very warm and also helped us select the right dishes suited to my parents tastes :)

reviews.description: This place has good ambience and sufficient seating capacity. We had ordered chicken clear soup, the taste was great and the portion size was large. Then we ordered dumplings which were equally delicious. The disappointment came with the main course as the fried rice and the 90's chilli chicken had really small portions as compared to their prices. One dish was only enough for one person. Since we were still hungry, we decided to order dessert which had a good portion but was very pricy. Overall damage 2.2k+ for 2 people and partially satisfied. The service is fast and responsive. There is a service charge as well.

reviews.description:
Yesterday night went there with family. It's in pavilion mall sb road. We ordered the below dishes.

Street style spicy chicken dumplings

Crispy tofu
Chiangmai train station noodle.

Overall i liked the state, quality and quantity as well. Prices are little on higher side.

reviews.author: Kapil Desai
reviews.description:
When there is a sudden desire to relish oriental cuisine , the only  place that pops into my head is Mamagoto!
I will definitely fall short of words and I wish I could explain how beautifully they have set up the ambience. Breathtakingly beautiful! It will definitely teleport you to the far east ! ;)
Taking about food and the reason why I love mamagoto is due to the authenticity in the feast , the courteous staff and the prompt service!
It all started with some lip smacking rice crackers served with dips and a soothing berry in a hurry mocktail.

Post this we grabbed our chopsticks for relishing the palatable dimsum platter.
The assorted platter had midblowing dimsum variants (2 pieces each ) as under -
Prawns Enoki
Prawns and celery 
Chicken Gyoza
Chicken Pak choy
Street style spicy chicken dimsums

So good and tasteful that we ordered for another platter as well!

This was followed by a delectably mouthwatering oriental buffet comprising of

Veg hakka Noodles
Garlic fried rice
Veg manchurian
Stir fried tofu with green bean
Chilli Garlic vegetable
Chicken in black bean sauce
Sichuan chicken
Roast lamb in chilli oyster

To end the meal they had decadent pastries for my sweet tooth.

Mamagoto is definitely a must visit for experiencing the far east extravangza!
Its totally worth it. ;)

reviews.description:
The place is perfect to go with name mamagoto fun Asian cuisine..as there a real fun over this place.
The food served is a Japanese cuisine with a pretty ambiance of Japan theme .it's been very cozy place to have over . We had a dumpling platter of different types of non veg dumplings which were jst yummm ...the staff here has a prompt service with a very polite attitude

reviews.author: Saurabh Krishan Gulab
reviews.description:
Recently visited this outlet to try something pan Asian food. Accordingly, we ordered Mama’s spicy ramen noodles, Crispy Lotus Stems, Honey Chicken & Sticky Rice Bowl. To me every item was good in taste and was not spicy( except for Spicy Ramen Noodles). The sticky bowl was blessed with yummy and soft tofu which made it really good in taste.
I ordered Very Berry Shake to taste, although it was that great but okay to try.
For the desserts we had coconut ice cream, Chocolate Brownie and caramel cake. The desserts were extremely good, specially the coconut ice cream.
My overall experience was okay but would recommend people to try such food for at least once.

reviews.author: Aditya V Gujar
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is located in The Pavilion Mall and serves some amazing dumpling, ramen and Asian dishes.

This restaurant has a really vibrant and colourful ambience you'll ever see.
There are beautiful paintings which are hanged in the middle and various drawings of Asian culture are depicted on the walls.

We started our meal by having their Chicken baos and Yellow corn Thai curry.

The Baos were really fresh and soft and the chicken was flavourful! A sweet and spicy sauce on the baos would have done wonders to it.

The yellow corn Thai curry had lots of corn and it was served along with white coloured bread.

In mains, we had their meal in a bowl!

The Chiang Mai Train station noodles veg which was similar to how suey but it was on a sweeter side. I really liked the broth as it was coconut.😊

We also tried their Mama's spicy Ramen bowl which had spicy broth, buttered corn kernels and blanched spinach. 😍

The third one was the Teriyaki meal in a bowl which consisted of sticky rice, tofu, wok tossed Veggies, ginger, onions and garlic! If you are a tofu lover then this is a must-try dish!

Do visit this place if you want to have authentic Asian food! I'm sure you'll love this place!

reviews.author: Kirti Kanitkar
reviews.description: Amazing food and had a wonderful time. The tomyum soup, crystal dumplings and pan fried noodles everything was tasting super delicious. The staff was courteous and awesome service!!!!! Loved it and it’s a must visit place!

reviews.description: Ambience is good as well as the staff are courteous. Coming to food , all the items were good to taste and quanity was also sufficient . Overall , a good experience although if you visit GONG balewadi you are certain to give MAMAGOTO 4 instead of 5 as Former one is next level.

reviews.author: Pune Food Blogger
reviews.description:
Had recently been to Mamagoto which is located in The Pavillion Mall

Mamagoto has introduced a new concept of Small Plates in their menu and I had recently been there to try it out

They have introduced a lot of dishes in their small plates menu like Wok Tossed Lotus Stems, Mushroom and Veg Bao, Sweet Corn in Thai Yellow Curry, Chicken Kra Pow Style, Sliced Ginger Chicken, Lemon Grass and much more

The things which we tried were :

Wok Tossed Lotus Stems : These were really crispy and really loved it. I usually don't try anything veg when outside but was glad that I tried this

Chicken Kra Pow : This was a bit on the spicier side and the quantity was pretty good. The Chicken was made in Basil sauce and would recommend you to try it

Sliced Ginger Chicken : This was a bit on the sweeter side. The quantity again was pretty good. The sliced Ginger Chicken was served with oyster sauce and sesame seeds and the quantity would be enough for two people

Lemon Grass Chicken with shredded wonton : The shredded wontons were really crispy and they went really well with the lemon grass chicken and overall I really liked the combination

In Summary liked the concept of the small plates and liked the food here as well. Would recommend all of you to try out the Chicken Kra Pow as that was my favorite among the dishes I tried there

reviews.description:
I recently visited this authentic Asian fusion cuisine place.
They have their unique Asian lunch buffet.
They have complimentary starters.
They have both chicken and vegetarian dumplings thats steamed to perfection.
They have an array of starters in fish , chicken and vegetables also vegan options.
For mains they have chicken,lamb and fish options not to mention an array of gravies that goes perfectly with noodles and rice.
Alot of soup stations and live noodles counter that counts for all those delicious calories.
They have complimentary desserts alot of Chinese fried noodles served with peanuts and ice cream.
Just head here if you love Chinese and wanna have a burst of flavours and varieties.
The best part of this buffet is the affordability as you get a whole lot of items for a really really pocket friendly price.
That's why it's an instant hit among the crowd.
Xoxo
Follow doctorelvishvixen on Instagram for more details!

reviews.author: Avinash Gopal
reviews.description: Nice place, with nice Thai food. Had a good time here and as it is located in a mall it was quite happening.

reviews.author: Spoon Fork
reviews.description: Wow Ambience Lunch buffet spread soup,dumplings, starter, main course and desserts with choices at @600AI for veg and 650 for non veg

reviews.author: Vishal Bagdi
reviews.description:
The decor of the venue is awe-inspiring! It is absolutely mind blowing. The service is great and the food is just beautiful, tasty and mouth-watering!
Had a great time!

reviews.author: Sabiha Ansari
reviews.description:
I visiting this place first time they ambience was very good they hanging lights and colourful nicely decor walls😍😍....
The server was very helpful and listened all my requirements .... I am order to dumpling platter ani maki roll....they tasty was awesome.... If you are Asian lovers then you must be visit this place....

pageno_233.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_233.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Saachi Gupta
reviews.description:
Recently I visited mamagoto and tried their newly introduced buffet which starts at ₹600 veg and ₹650 for non veg ( all inclusive) it's a Chinese buffet
The buffet includes - a soup, dumplings , 8 starters (4 veg and 4 non-veg) , main course curries (4 veg and 4 non-veg) and rice and noodles .
I skipped the soup and directly started with starters - all the starters were good crispy chicken, water chestnut in chilli sauce and tangy mushroom were my favourites in particular.
Their dumplings will leave you wanting more 😋.

The main course was good it was a huge affair and I didn't try all the curries.
Overall it's a good deal to fetch after a tiring day at the mall. In the desserts Banana split was my favourite .

Follow slaydoublecheese for more updates .

reviews.author: Arindam Roychowdhury
reviews.description: This was our first visit. We loved the ambiance. We ordered fish finger and chicken Hakka noodles . Fish finger was absolute delight. Loved it . Also ordered two cocktails. They were interesting. Anyway. This was worthwhile experience. We would like to try more dishes. So will be keep coming back .

reviews.author: Bhaskar
reviews.description: Usually a fan of mamagoto but this time it went wrong. The Hawkers noodles were horrible. Super sweet, spicy on the wrong side. On the hindsight thyme Martini was brilliant and the dumplings were a winner.

pageno_234.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_234.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Roman  Sagner
reviews.description:
Suuuuuupeeeeer!
Service the best, buffet excellent, we were full, sangria tasty, experienced staff, we will vist again___________________\_\\

reviews.author: Sonia Raje Vaidya
reviews.description:
Was there to enjoy some good delicacies and hospitality with my Husband. Here is what i observed

SOUP 1* : Manchow - was neither Hot nor luke warm in the pot. It turned off the mood in the first place.

STARTERS 1.5* : All heavily deep fried. Meat was tougher and hard. Meat pieces seemed dried and not tasty or saucy after being fried on high temperature it seems for long.
One of the starters was served after 40 mins of waiting and complaining to the manager.

MAIN COURSE 1*-
The rice did not seem asian or chinese in flavor and lacked the taste.

Fish gravy pot did not have fish pieces. Informed the concerned and I was promised a service on table which was forgotten and I was kept waiting until i gave up

Tofu was tough and cold in the pot. THe Greens had turned pale and dark. Seemed like it was prepared long ago.

Majority of maon course pots needed replinishment and food was not available in the buffet except tasteless Rice and some noodles, tougher Tofu and a Black bean chicken average gravy.

DESSERTS - 3*
Honey Noodles and ice cream. This was upto the mark. As though this was all that the restaurant had left to offer any good. :-(

This review is not meant for recieving an apology from the restsurant manager now as its too late after informing them.regarding low grade service.

This is for others to think about better options elsewhere

reviews.author: Anuya Sadadekar
reviews.description: I love these chain...awesome Asian food.. this outlet is I side a mall and it quiet small but get quality of food and the service is same..its par excellence.. I repeated what I always have and my fac prawns dumplings...yummy for mains I have spicy chicken rice bowl which was quiet nice . I have a lot left to try on their menu so I'll surely visit again.

reviews.author: Abhedya Khatiwala
reviews.description: Relaxing ambience and courteous staff! Mr. Surya was very kind and attentive to our needs. The menu here is very thoughtful with various palates mixed together to provide a unique dish. Quantity also is sufficient. Overall a great place to chill and have some good quality food!

pageno_235.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_235.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Amy's World
reviews.description: I don't know where to start from but lets start with my favorite thing- the sushi....i just was overwhelmed finally to find a sushi place in Pune...and that too veg....the taste was superb, portion size was good, presentation was epic and time taken to get the thing was very less. This brought a smile on our faces. They started with some munchies, which were tasteful but were soggy by the time they hit the table so I am not very happy about it, as they looked yummy. But the Sushi made my day!! Super delicious!!! Followed by a wholesome bowl of ramen which filled stomach of two. Want to visit back soon!

reviews.author: Indrakshi
reviews.description:
Quiet ambience, makes for a great upscale evening out.
The sushi is to die for!
My top recommendation would be the California maki (in nonveg/seafood) and the asparagus tempura (veg).
Any of the rice or noodle bowls are easily large enough to comprise a meal in themselves. Top among these are the teriyaki chicken and rice bowl, the Laksa tribute noodles bowl and the sticky basil fried rice bowl.
Another notable mention are the signature cocktails.
I recommend to try From Mama With Love. Gingery and punchy.
Mamagoto is definitely one of my absolute favourites in Pune

reviews.author: Priyanka Khalate
reviews.description:
•Mamagoto one of the asian food restaurant in pune.Tried Japanese food here.

•They have lovely ambience .firstly they'll greet you and theres complementary rice papads snack.we tried first time dumplings but not a fan and tomyum soup,pan fried schezwan noodles ,fresh lime soda.

•If you are a lover of sushi this place is exactly for you.

•first time i tried this kinda food .
Service 4/5
Ambience 5/5
Food 3.5/5
But overall average rating 4/5

•Follow us on instagram for more updates in pune@punefoodcompany @sassysoul10

reviews.author: Bendangsunep Pongen
reviews.description: I tried spicy dumpling and Mamagoto goreng and that the was the best dumpling I've tried in a while, definitely worth trying and if you happen to visit there I suggest you should given it a try. Amazing and friendly staff and I did not regret the suggestion offered by the hostess. Totally worth every dime I spent. Great place with beautiful ambience, looking forward to visit again.

reviews.author: Arpit Ojha
reviews.description:
Chinese is one of my favourite cuisines, atleast this is what I thought before going to Mamagoto. I don't hold this opinion anymore.

I read about Mamagoto in the net. It is a fusion South Asian restaurant. The term fusion I understand referred to fusion of Chinese, Thai and Singaporean tastes with Indian spices. But, I was mistaken. The food items served in Mamagoto are more of a fusion between Indo-chinese tastes with each other leaving Indian taste somewhat out of the room. Mind you, the term Indo-China is a misnomer.

The items that I ordered have a peculiar aftertaste. I think it is the oils. Mamagoto maybe does not use neutral oils. I did not hate any of the dishes. They were decent. Food was hygienically prepared and presented beautifully. The reason I wrote that I don't love Chinese anymore is the realisation - I love desi Chinese. The desi flavour was missing in Mamagoto. But, it is not their fault. Anyone having a flare for authentic South East Asian food must visit this place.

Enough with the food. Let us talk about better things. Ambiance was great. Enough space to move around and comfortable seats. I did not pay much attention to the music as there was significant amount of chatter. But, all in all it was good.

Service was prompt and cordial. Staff is nice, non-intrusive and polite. They look at small things and help customers with it. This is great.

I have given 4 stars just because of the missing desi part. The place will not disappoint if you care to pay a visit.

pageno_236.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_236.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Sameer Jathar
reviews.description: Awesome place for oriental food in Pavillion mall on second floor. There are many choices available in oriental food. Soup, starters, main course are very taste and offering wide variety of options. Ambience is nice and mocktails are also good. Cost wise it is bit premium but lovely place for foodies.

reviews.author: Jenifer Chongloi
reviews.description:
We friends decided for party destination at pavilion mall many options we found on 2nd floor I chose mamagoto Asian food,very well designed place
Ordered for 🍉 watermelon caipiroska pitcher
Must try their designed starter platters dumplings, aunty, maki we had dumplings ,staff was very helpful

Will definitely visit again to try more

reviews.author: Nitin Jadhav
reviews.description:
We went here for dinner last Saturday.  We tried Chinese Sour & pepper soup, Auntys platter, Soggy Thai Basil fried rice, Yangchow Champions Fried rice.
I like Auntys platter and Soggy Thai basil rice.

Must try Auntys platter, you will get 13 pieces, you can choose that from the choice.  
We choose Veg tofu satay skewers, veg gyaza, corn fitter and  Chicken satay, basil chicken cups, chicken gyaza.
Food was super tasty and authentic. The place was clean, comfortable seating. The ambience was simple but looks good. Staff was polite & well trained, Though the service was slow, and the food was great.  Must try place for south-east Asian food.

reviews.author: Abhi
reviews.description: Had a delicious starter chicken Basil cup and Rock shrimp tempura and tried mamagoto goreng & end up with carammel sponge cake as per servers recommendation 5 star for everything

reviews.author: Abhishek Hinge
reviews.description:
Had a great 5 star experience after a long time. Located on the 2nd floor of the pavilion ma, this place offers Asian Food. We tried Japanese, Thai and Chinese. Dumplings were just awesome, and the Sushi was mouthwatering. Finished it off with my a time favourite Chicken Fried Rice..

Great place. Food is but pricey though..

pageno_237.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_237.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Satya Prakash Sharma
reviews.description: I went to mamgoto first time with my friend we have to start chicken starter bbq chicken breast is was delicious 😋 there is many type dumpling We enjoyed a lot and service was excellent 👍

reviews.author: Aditi
reviews.description: We enjoyed excellent service and freshly prepared, delicious dishes. The crispy babycorn mushroom was superb, and the chicken noodles rounded off our lunch nicely. Prompt service, and the ambience was also very lit! The starter complimentary snack was also very fresh and was very neatly served. All in all a big thumbs up and will surely visit this place again! 👍

reviews.author: Sschivate
reviews.description: I would not recommend the weekday buffet here.  All the starters are deep fried, and main course did not have any stand-out items. The noodles and fried rice were one of the worst I have ever tasted. Please stick with the a la carte items.

reviews.author: Indraneel More
reviews.description:
I had been to Mamagoto for a team lunch and liked the ambience. We ordered the non veg buffet for all of us in which they were serving 4 non veg starters. Do note that if you opt for a non veg buffet, you will NOT be served any veg starters. They started serving the starters, however, were very slow in serving them and were serving only 2 starters and we had to repeatedly ask them to serve the remaining 2 starters. Also once they serve you a starter they won't get it again until ask them to and on asking repeatedly the serving staff had frowning expressions on their face. The staff seemed to have absolutely no intention of providing their customers a good customer experience.

The food tasted just ordinary, and the overall lack of good customer experience spoiled the lunch.

reviews.author: Minal Kadam
reviews.description:
Ambience; - Good, Food - Delicious (until u get a cockroach in your plate that is!!!) And thus Hygiene -
BAD

Their reasoning - Pathetic
Reason 1. The cockroach has legs and everything in tact so we think it must have come from somewhere...(they thought the cockroach walked into the plate and just died in the plate while eating their rice)

Reason 2 - Could have fallen from the pan in which the rice was made. But we take ut.ost care of hygiene and follow all the standards!

Seriously!!! A BIG NO!!!!

pageno_238.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

reviews.author: Salil Pradhan
reviews.description: Nice place to have asian food. Priced fairly. Food is also really good and tasty. Their homemade chocolate cake is just awesome!! Only negative thing i'd like to mention is that I saw few cockroaches crawling on the walls.

reviews.author: Lovina Raymond
reviews.description: Great food. I loved their Spicy Bangkok bowl. Service could be better. It took the server a while to hand me the “food for one person” special menu.

reviews.author: Akshata Sawant
reviews.description:
Me and my friends wanted to have something asian, and specifically noodles so we gave this place a try.
The food was definitely great!
The best part was the space of the restaurant.
And they gave us chopsticks to eat as an optional thing and we tried eating with it, was fun!

reviews.author: Sunayana Bhatia
reviews.description: Asian food is one of my favourites, and I’ve surprisingly never given Mamagoto a try in Mumbai and hence decided to give the Pavillion outlet in Pune a shot. The staff was warm and the service was top notch. I ordered the cucumber avacado Maki rolls and the dumpling platter. The dumpling platter had some good flavours, but it didn’t fall in the ‘out of this world, exceptional’ category. However, decent food if you’re looking for a good Asian dining experience.

reviews.author: Kedar Pande
reviews.description:
This place is quite attractive and pleasant.
Ambience is one thing that can catch your
attention.
It is japanese cuisine restaurant.
The food is average.
They serve drinks as well.
The restaurant is quite exquisite hence a bit
expensive.
Overall a reviving place.

pageno_239.name: Mamagoto

address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_239.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Jordan Faleiro
reviews.description:
Loved the place Mamagoto . Feel like ur in Japan with the ambidience. It's cool and cozy.
What to say about the food I had
Ramen Bowl Chicken 😘 mouth watering I loved it
Next
Laksa chicken tasty blend of flavours 😊. Next
Aunty platter Non-Veg for staters grate suggestion by the manager . Next
Basil cup chicken nice.
Mixed with the decision to which I like the most.
Surely visit this place again with my friends.

reviews.author: Manish Sane
reviews.description:
Nice place in Paving mall.
Tasty Japanese and Asian cuisines.
Had tasty Sushi rolls, Chicken wok and potato crispy.
Service was good.
Enjoyed thoroughly

reviews.author: Soniya Gandhi
reviews.description:
Ambience - 4.5
Service - 5
Food - 5

Staff is very polite and helpful. Quality of food is very nice.

We ordered:
Tum Yum soup
Dumplings
fried noodles
Schezwan sauce

They take little longer to prepared the food but its worth the wait. They have nice music and ambience.

After our lunch was over, we were given complementary desert as well.

reviews.author: Aqsa Iqbal
reviews.description:
A very good place to eat asian cuisine and enjoy with family after shopping .
Food was great, impressive menu, service is excellent too.
Will definitely go back again
It was a lovely experience overall 😊

reviews.author: Prabhu Hiremath
reviews.description: Not the best of service or quality of food  as compared to similar restaurants in town. pint of domestic beer is 349+ taxes. Please change what is mentioned here on Zomato as 199. Not worth the value for money

pageno_240.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_240.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Farah Shabnam
reviews.description:
Excellent Staff.
I went with my friend and ordered dimsums
A ramen bowl.
Food was over cooked and the ramen broth was oily.
Taste was good. Dumplings and noodles when over cooked gives a soggy taste which is not desirable.
I told the same to the staff and they agreed to change the food.
Thanks for the hospitality and acknowledgement.

reviews.author: Ipshita Roy
reviews.description:
Nice place to have something Asian, when you are at the Pavilion mall. They have a nice Menu which tries to cover different types of Asian cuisine. To be honest, I felt there were too many types of dumplings. Could have been better if there were few more options for the mains instead. Food was good, nothing extraordinary. Although, everything had an authentic touch to it, which is appreciable. The ambience is nice for a place on a mall.

To sum up, one must visit this place to try their authentic Asian delicacies. But if you are looking for a Indian version of rice and noodles, this is not a place for you.
So I would definetly recommend this place for people who don't have an aversion to trying something different.

reviews.author: Amruta Nimbalkar
reviews.description: Visited this place for lunch.. great asian cuisine.. gud ambience.. great food.. service very slow.. food is great... recommend nonveg platter and crispy lotus stem👍🏻

reviews.author: Parul Khatav
reviews.description: This is a restaurant in Pavilion mall.. Interesting looking place! Great service! The complimentary rice crispies (similar to maharatrian kurdai) was a nice. The sticker on the lemon soda glass madeit so cute! very authentic preparation. We had “wan chai midnight chicken” and “spicy bali bi noodles”. Disclaimer - when they say spicy, they mean it! overall, a good experience!

reviews.author: Sk
reviews.description: We had being there on a weekend and the restaurant was bussy . Even thou we had booked thru zomato in advance the table was not available on arrival and we had to wait . Again ther was major confusion with the manager nd issues in seating. Service was extremely slow . Food was good and tasty. Selection was also nice . And a lot of variety.

pageno_241.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_241.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Sunil Kamat
reviews.description: Good Soup, Yummy Non veg Dimsum platter, and Sushis (California Roll and Katsu Chicken). Rice Bowls were cool as well - Bangkok Style and Udon Noodles. Overall a little on the higher side on the money part.

reviews.author: Deep
reviews.description:
Honey chilly potato was the best I ever had! After that we ordered a Chilli Chicken starter (played it safe in order to not mess up) I’d say “well played” !
Went ahead and ordered for a Tofu preparation and Hakka noodles - OMG! Was it Tofu or butter? Freaking melts in your mouth!! It was so good we ordered some more! Then I ordered a really unique drink for myself regardless of my friend’s opinions - Lavender Coconut Water Lemonade and bouy was it amazing!! It was soooo refreshing I can’t even begin to explain you guys! I recommend this drink to everyone who loves coconut water. After we were done and were waiting for our cheque, the waiter came up to us with a huge surprise - 3 layered Dark chocolate cake. WHAAAT! We were almost at a food coma by then!
I wonder if they give you free cake each time you visit ;)

reviews.author: Ayan Ganguly
reviews.description:
A very good place to eat and enjoy. This is great family restaurant. We visited this Sunday with our 8 months old baby. The staffs are really very gentle and helpful. My little baby was a bit excited and was trying to climb here and there not letting us eating the food. One of the awesome guy from the restaurant helped him with slices of apple to keep him calm. Apple is everyday love for our bay. So it worked like magic. 
The food and environment is really good. We would like to visit with our friends again.

reviews.author: Simran Keshri
reviews.description: Proper Pan Asian restaurant whit a great variety of food. We had ordered a non-vegetarian platter which included prawns, mutton and chicken dumplings. Food was great. And the ambience too. A little costly but considering the quality of food and the look and feel of the place would definitely recommend going here. Overall a great experience.

reviews.author: Shanoli Mathew
reviews.description: Good, flavoursome Asian food ! Being an Asian food lover, this is one of my favourite places to go to. I’ve tried their Spicy Bangkok Bowl and their Fiery Thai Shrimp Rice with Asian Green Chilli Chicken Ribbons and I was pleasantly surprised by the burst of flavours both the dishes had! Looking forward to trying more of their oriental cuisine.

pageno_242.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_242.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Megha
reviews.description: Best pan Asian food ever in all of pune .. suzushan comes very close through. But I love their Tom yum. Best ever. And other dim sums and sushi are best too. Since it’s opened at pavilion mall I have visited it like 10 times. The best. Thank you for bringing Thailand and other Asian countries in Pune.

reviews.author: AMB
reviews.description:
Super ambiance. Super food. Super service.
Always love being here.
Different menu, slightly on the higher side but a decent place to hang out after tin loads of shopping!!

reviews.author: Shivani Deshmukh
reviews.description: If you’re an Asian food lover and looking for a good option to eat in Pune, Mamagoto is the place, lovely food and great ambience and the service is excellent :)

reviews.author: Janhavi NangrePatil
reviews.description: The food was very very good. Customer service was also up to the mark. Will definitely go back again and again. It was a lovely experience overall.

reviews.author: Monica Sultane
reviews.description:
Well.. a Saturday lunch at this place sounds good.....
A must visit place when you want to give your taste buds the Asian taste.....
We tired a wide range of dishes- (most of names I cannot recollect as we ordered them according to individual choices n then shared them.....)
The must try dishes according to me were the rock shrimp tempura, rainbow chicken dumpling and the java grilled fish....
The rock shrimp dumplings were beer batter fried shrimps with an awesome sauce to go with...
Rainbow chicken dumplings were the chicken stuffed dumpling with the exact amount of spices and a soya, honey n vinegar sauce....
The java grilled fish was the best of the lot, it was wrapped in a banana leaf - grilled/cooked to perfection with the awesome tangy spicy taste...
The food served was damn good... It was spicy but dint feel like one... Soo stay cautious....
Overall ratings...
Ambience -4/5 (Perfect Asian theme with good old vibes)
Service -3.5/5 (towards the end it turn damn slow, we had to wait for like good 20-25mins for our bowl of rice ..)
Taste - 4/5
Price -3.5/5
The quality as well as portion size is good with respect to price point of view....

pageno_243.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_243.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Chhandak Bandyopadhyay
reviews.description:
I quite like the Mamagoto in Hyderabad, so while this one is pretty far from my place in Pune I thought to give it a try. It didn't disappoint.

We had a dimsums platter and a sushi platter. The staff were very cooperative and customised our platter to our liking.
Coming to the taste, they were all good but nothing exceptional. The chicken dimsums were slightly lacking in flavor and can improve. The prawn ones were quite good. Structure and presentation wise the dimsums did well.
The sushi also was good but were no match to many other premium Asian restaurants in Pune. Both structure as well as flavor can be improved.

Although I'm probably being too hard on these guys. It remains a lovely Asian place to visit. Cheers!

reviews.author: Justin R
reviews.description:
Ambiance 3.5/5
Food 4.5/5
Drinks(Alcoholic) 4.5/5
Staff 5/5

The entire experience of the Mamagoto was delightful. I would recommend the Green Apple Sangria (Red Wine) as it was delicious. The food was amazing, the sushi platter is a must try for all Sushi lovers. The staff attitude was the star of the evening..very warm, welcoming and attentive. This place is a must visit. #sushi #japanese #chinese

@Lydia Fernandes

reviews.author: Geeta.anandani
reviews.description:
Give your Asian taste buds a treat...
By far the best Asian food, pretty impressive menu
Ambience: Amazing
Food: Amazing
Service: Very prompt
The portion size is good and ample for 2 persons
Must Try: Sticky rice with mango
Lavender and coconut water lemonade

reviews.author: Ketki Kanitkar
reviews.description:
I went with high expectations but it was a total disappointment. We had booked table via Zomato for 1.30 pm. Upon reaching we came to know restaurant did not note down the booking and we were on waiting list. They told us waiting time will be 15 minutes. We got the table at 2.15 pm. We seated in their outer area which has 8 tables in total.
Service staff was clueless. Menu cards were presented immediately but we had to ask for water glass, cutlery and napkins. Service staff informed to us that as kitchen is busy it will take 20 minutes minimum,this was fine with us.
Rest of the guests were complaining about the delay in service and most of them were waiting for a really long time. few of them cancelled their orders.
Luckily we were served in 20 minutes but food was average.
chicken Karagee was decent.
Basil Veg cups were served with lettuce leaves drenched in water. we were told this is the way we serve it and it's DIY cups. We were not at all happy to see lots of water in our plate and when you bite in to cup it was all watery. we returned the dish and luckily the dish was not charged to us.
Veg Pad thai noodles were average with 2 pieces of broccoli. Portion size is less for 2 people.
If you want your customers to pay 500 Rs per dish then give quality products with good quantity.
Overall it was poor experience of dining at Mamagoto.

reviews.author: Neeraj Mishra
reviews.description: This is my first visit to mamagoto and it is so beautiful and seating is very comfortable. The staffs are nice and service is good. Sushi and Dumpling were absolutely tasty and flavoured.

pageno_244.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_244.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Gautam Srinivasan
reviews.description:
This resto has been in my radar for quite a while so finally got a chance and had lunch buffet 2 weeks back ...
Loved the ambience....staff were prompt n courteous
The starters were quite nice ...didn't find too much taste difference in the main course ( non veg ) curries ...
In all a good experience and would definitely visit again ...

reviews.author: Mridula Dixit
reviews.description: An Asian buffet is a welcome change! Attentive service. Excellent flavoured soups. You may have to wait for the starters because they do not make it in bulk but prepare them as per requirement. The non veg has an assortment of fish,chicken and lamb. Fortunately, mildly flavoured.. not like the Indian Chinese.. tadka maar ke! Noodles were only 1 type. The desserts.. for a change were not your run of the mill buffet fare... well made option of banana split or honey fried noodles and icecream. The raw papaya salad was yumm..

reviews.author: Swapnali Upadhye
reviews.description: This place has an amazing space design. I recommend this only if you love authentic Asian food. They serve love with each plate that you order ❤️

reviews.author: Vaishali Patil
reviews.description: These guys are very stingy with their vegetables. I had ordered veg Hakka noodles and veg fried rice, noodle bowl on two separate occasions and all I could see was noodles/rice and hardly any vegetables in their veg dishes. Taste was ok but no veggies. I would not recommend for vegetarians who would like to eat vegetables.

reviews.author: Bakul Tanksale-Gapchup
reviews.description:
We'd been waiting for a long time to try this place
Finally went for lunch one of the days opting for the buffet
Buffets usually mean quick service and turnaround.
It took us 2.5 hours for just 2 of us to get all the courses
Each requiring multiple follow ups and reminders
Not to mention the buffet kept running out of items owing to the small serving bowls requiring large wait time at the buffet queue as well

pageno_245.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_245.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Rahul East
reviews.description:
First time mamagoto the ambience was great loved their seating, the wall painting, the lights.

Food we had veg n Non veg Buffet

It had soups which pretty nicely made and good

Starters were really awesome in panner,momos, fish finger, chicken and mutton nuggets.

Main course was just average as rice was not hot and fresh as I would prefer.

Dessert was the best and my favorite at this place.

Should visit and staff also fine in their work.

reviews.author: Ravishankar Iyer
reviews.description:
Had recently gone with a couple of relatives.

We had a schizophrenic experience there. The food was great, the drinks a major disappointment.

We went with the waiter's recommendations on food and they were mostly very good.

With drinks here are my complaints:
1. Beer is outrageously expensive, with hardly any variety. (The server too took a minute to spot the beers in the alcohol menu). It's as if they're discouraging beer lovers from coming (I'm definitely not at these prices!).
2. We ordered a sangria pitcher and it took AGES to come. Our starters were already there and we had to stop eating to wait for the pitcher. As if to confirm that it was not a one time occurrence, when we repeated the pitcher, it was again really late.
3. What's more the second (and third) pitcher we ordered were much more diluted than the first.
Clearly we liked the drink, but timely service and consistent taste is also important.

Overall really disappointed.

reviews.author: Richa Jain
reviews.description:
Mamgoto is an amazing place for people who do not want to have regular good. Serving asian cusine at in its best form and taste. Totally delighted by the overwhelming staff and serene ambience. Some dishes we ordered were spicey but staff was courteous enough to modify it as per your taste. We ordered Chinese sour and pepper soup (super yummm...), crispy lotus stem (Starter for munching) and spicy bankok bowl ( exotic veggies with rice).
Must go for people who visit pavillion mall.

reviews.author: Dr Aviral Shah
reviews.description: Been here once. Nicr ambience and polite waiting staff. Food is good with impressive quantity. Drinks are too overpriced i believe and dessert was okay. But would still score the place a 4.5 and visit back to try other dishes!!

reviews.author: Shantanu
reviews.description:
Tom yup soup and some spicy noodles

Noodles was awazing, special mention to mixer. Great chutneys with food.. It is mesmerized Thailand for some time.

Soup was OK, we wiil try other soup and dishes.

pageno_246.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_246.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Rohan Mallya
reviews.description: Been to this restaurant quite a few times and have never been disappointed. This truly is competition for Mainland China. The last time I was here on 5th April for my birthday. I reached late, it was a week day and buffet was available. It was so sweet of them to extend their buffet timings for me. I loved their buffet and their service. The lady at the counter is very polite and sweet. I was also given a small cake from their side. Guys if you love south east Asian cuisine then this place is a must visit. Keep up the great work guys. Thanks a lot.😀

reviews.author: Neha Lande
reviews.description:
I have visited this place do many times and i just love the food . I am a vegetarian i have tried few dishes there .. i have absolutely loved those dishes
Few things i had tried were their noodles , dim-sums, something with lettuce caps and thai green curry rice .. it was really very good.
Hope the taste Remains consistent.

reviews.author: Nandini
reviews.description: We recently visited Mamgoto for team lunch (buffet) and experience was terrible. Summary - tasteless food, non-veg served to vegetarians, delayed service. We expected manager to say sorry and compensate, but none happened. When asked for compensation, he somehow agreed to give discount ! Will never recommend it to anyone.

reviews.author: Bhavida Ramakrishnan
reviews.description:
Food - 3.5/5; quantity- 4/5; service - 4/5; ambience - 5/5; paisa wasool - 👍 (Only if you don’t mind spending on expensive food)

First of all, the ambience is awesome. It’s like a mini palace. The cuisine is Asian and I personally found it average, but my friends loved it. We were welcomed with a complimentary starter which is a bowl of white chips and some sauce. We ordered for chicken chilli, chicken momos, lotus stem chips and shrimp rice bowl. I loved the lotus stem chips and the shrimp bowl since they were unique and indeed tasty.

We also ordered a kiwi mocktail which was made from fresh kiwis which was impressive (mostly restruant’s use kiwi crush/artificial flavours). The quantity is pretty good, we ordered 3 starters for the four of us (all girls) and we were full. We couldn’t finish the main course so we parcelled it.

reviews.author: Mugdha Nirmal
reviews.description:
#MixedReview #Mamagoto #PavillionMallFoodScene

We friends are usually looking for a centralized place to meet up in PMC at evening hours. F C road is not a good option always. With restaurants coming up at Pavilion mall on S B road, the scene felt a bit sorted. 

Among the several restaurants we picked up Mamagoto here based on zomato ratings. Coming to the food n mocktails - 

The menu was little confusing with indo chinese fusion so we asked them for recommendations for sraters. 

~Placed order for the starters and drinks. 

Virgin mojito and Kiwi mint Collins were refreshing and were served within few minutes of placing order #ChilledTemptations

~Rainbow chicken dumplings were served steaming hot, perfect filling, no loose cover and juicy mouthful. #TotallyRecommended #DoTry

 ~Chilly chicken was the usual taste, little on the sweeter side for our liking, but overall a good dish. #CanTry

~Spicy Bangkok rice bowl was our pick. Little sticky rice topped with chicken gravy. Chicken was neither chunks not kheema consistency. This was a total let down as it was very salty and sweet. They did not charged us for this after we complained about the dish being overly salty. 

~Chocolate pastry was soft, fresh and delicious with melted chocolate sauce in the layers. This was complimentary from the restaurant #Recommended 

Overall nice food but service was very slow even though place was not that crowded. Might drop in for the dumplings again 😊

Happy eating !

pageno_247.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_247.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Nazneen Sheikh
reviews.description:
Mamagoto never disappoints you. On a lazy Sunday afternoon with my girls it was a perfect place to visit. Not forgetting my love for Asian and oriental cuisine.

I have attached the food we ate along with it’s details so it’s easy for other readers as well.

We had a kiwi mock tail as per the suggestion of the staff and to our delight we were surprised that it was not made of syrup but kiwi fruit ( which was a surprise and good change)

Ambience- 4/5
Food 3.5/5
Staff 4/5
Service 4/5

Overall had a lovely time!!

reviews.author: Rhea Mathews
reviews.description:
We had the spicy ramen bowl and the spicy Bangkok bowl
I had a orange and passion sangria
They gave us a complimentary caramel cake which is their signature
All in all excellent

reviews.author: Nadia Da Silva
reviews.description:
VIMP info for all you ppl looking out for a place to eat & enjoy a nice drink as well.. This place has a 'bar'. Zomato has no mention of it anywhere due to which I was about to stop by TGIF for a few drinks before heading for dinner..

Anyway..
Got a table booking done through zomato.. Which was quite & easy, however we were running late so I called up the restaurant. The hostess was polite and accommodating.

We reached the restaurant and we're greated by the hostess who got us seated.. We ordered our drinks are as well as our starters with the help of our host.. As the menu at restaurant was not very descriptive as compared to the menu on zomato.

We enjoyed
