#non veg dupling platter - everything on the platter was yum.. It's better to share the platter than have individual items. I wish I was given the option to swap the lamb roll with pok choi with something else.. Did not fancy it much.

#aunty's veg platter -
loved the corn fritter. The rest of the items were decent.

#smoky BBQ pork belly bowl -
super yum.. Enjoyed every bit of it. The sticky rice was a tag bit sweet though.

#teriyaki meal bowl -
the discretion does mention that the dish would be 'slightly' sweet.. We clearly have different definition of the word 'slightly'. We could not eat the dish at all.

#American style Chunky Caramel Cake with vanilla ice cream and toffee sauce (which was brilliant). Unfortunately they did not have sticky rice with mango (especially when we are in the mango season) but the cake made up for it.

We downed 2 pitchers of mojitos amoung 3 of us.. Which I feel were not mixed well as 1 of us got a watered down drink.. One ice. And one (the happiest of the 3) coz he had most of the Alcohol.

I loved the ambiance of this place and the service which was friendly & prompt.

reviews.author: Nick Padekar
reviews.description:
This is in my list, when I came in pune. I had visited this restaurant in Delhi with my friends in saket. But it wasn't crowd as saket were, don't know why. I was amazed with interior and food quality was equally good. We are 2 and served by Kim. She is pretty, and good options she gave to us. We tried a starter plater. I forget the name but it was so yummy. 😋😋😋
We had order fiery thai shrimp on recommendation of Kim. It was so good. I forget to click the photos of them, as we were hungry.

reviews.author: Dr. Kaushal Maru
reviews.description:
We had an amazing dinner at mamagoto.
The service was excellent , and Raju our waiter was very friendly and ever helpful
We ordered the spicy Bangkok bowl and the mama's spicy ramen bowl, both of which were stellar choices.
Subtle flavours, and the right amount of umame made it our favourites of the night.
I also had the orange and passion fruit sangria which was not too strong and just right.
The staff was very sweet and gave us a complimentary dessert which was their signature caramel cake
I couldn't have been happier with my experience at mamagoto, and always they live up to their name
Thank you Mamagoto for the wonderful dinner, it was much loved.

pageno_248.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_248.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Mahek Ramchandani
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is one of the few fine-dine restaurants in Pune which has authentic Asian food. The ambience is very vibrant, cute and colorful. The starter Lotus Stem with a tangy sauce was yummy. The Som Tam (raw papaya salad) had a perfect tangy flavor to it. The crispy mushroom maki was also made well. The moctails kiwi Mint collins and the watermelon beach were both really good. The black bean sauce and the spicy bambi noodles served as mains were both upto the mark. Over all the food was super tasty.
The service is here extremely prompt and the waiters are extremely generous. A special mention to Sandesh and Vaibhav who were really kind and genuine. Thank you so much for this wonderful experience.
All the Asian food lovers you got to try this restaurant soon. ⭐

reviews.author: Gaurav Tamotia
reviews.description: Been to a few mamagoto’s in the past in Bangalore and New Delhi and always found them a good experience. However this one was a bit of a disappointment. Next door to the hotel where I was staying, I went across for a lunch. Small place in the mall in a series of restaurants lined up next to one another. First up, an establishment that pushes expensive 750 bucks pints always pisses me off (no beers except corona and hoegaarden). Then of the 4 appetisers we had, two of them tasted the same and one of them had no salt. The service is ok but then we were the only table occupied, so it can’t be that hard. Definitely not as good as I expected.

reviews.author: PS :I Love Food
reviews.description: Authentic cuisine, distinctive taste! We had the Soggy Thai Basil Fried Rice (chicken), Mama’s Spicy Ramen Bowl (veg), Street style spicy chicken dumplings. Would definitely comeback for the menu.

reviews.author: Meenal Nimgaonkar
reviews.description:
We got to know of this restaurant through Zomato when we were looking for dining option in Pavilion mall. We made table reservations on phone as all the slots after 8 pm were shown as unavailable on Zomato.

Inside section of restaurant where we sat was beautiful. Decorated with bright colors and lamps, it immediately lifts up your mood.

They serve complimentary basket of rice frymes with tangy sauce and red chilli 'thecha' once you settle.

Now coming to food, we ordered:

1. Street Style Spicy Dumplings: These were good but not great. Stuffing was tasty. However we didn't find dumplings juicy enough which can be worked on.

2. Fiery Thai Shrimp Fried Rice with Asian Green Chilli Chicken Ribbon: The combination of flavors of sea food, chicken, fried egg was perfect. We liked this dish. Covering of chicken strips was very tasty and crispy. Also rice had good flavor of sea food. However, it was not fiery in taste at all.

Service was good. Staff was attentive and aware of menu.

Restaurant levies default 10% service charge. I don't think it is right to levy a service charge by default on the bill. It should be at customers' discretion. However we felt that already pricing was on higher side, adding service charge makes restaurant too expensive. If price of a rice bowl is almost Rs. 600, you have already charged enough to cover service charges.

Overall, it's a decent option if you are in vicinity and craving for some East Asian food.

reviews.author: Swapna Jog
reviews.description: This is my all time favourite place for lunch. This time I tried buffet it was amazing. Starters were fab but option for main course was not that diverse. It was just about rice and gravies. Dessert options were not that great. Had chocolate pastry which was not that good either. I feel you must go for ala carte rather than buffet.

pageno_249.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_249.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ashwin Panemangalore
reviews.description: Considering my guests, we opted for a run of the mill selection of hot and sour and sweet corn chicken soups both shared Chicken in black bean sauce, schezwan vegetables,Hakka noodles and a veggie fried rice The hot and sour soup put my tongue on fire and the black bean chicken and the schezwan veggie looked like they came out of the same spicy bowl The other two offerings didn’t make up Maybe it was a bad day or the chef was on leave or whatever but the meal was plain disappointing A street food guy would have done far better Nope we didn’t go to the wrong restaurant

reviews.author: Amit.kunjir85
reviews.description:
Visited the Sb road outlet @ pavillion mall, One of the finest places for one to njoi awesome thai/ chinese/ japanese food. We tried Tom yum soup and chinese sour n pepper soup out of which tom yum was by far the best and yes authentic. followed by dumpling platter which consisted of chkn prawns and lamb each of them fairly outstanding. Then in maincourse we tried thai red curry and one of the rice (preferable to those who like the associated sweeteness).Also tried thepan fried noodles which were good to.
Service was good but the restaurant is bit pricey hence the 4 *

reviews.author: Miriam
reviews.description:
Almost a 5* rate.
Excellent Thai restaurant.
Love their papaya salad is delicious and so well balanced between sweet, sour and spicy.
For sure a place to keep visit, the food is absolutely delicious, fresh ingredients and prepared with love.
Just hope they keep it up.
Is a pity that is to far other wise would become a regular.

reviews.author: Rohit Navalpure
reviews.description:
If you want to try authentic Thai, Japaneas, Chineas food you must try this restaurant.

The food was awesome. The quality & taste was also best. Staff service & ambience is very best.

You must try this restaurant.

reviews.author: Kashi
reviews.description:
Kya Khana tha Matlab Kya Khana tha maza aagya 😋
Looking at photos I got reminded of the crunchiness of these frozen lettuce leaves and the filling Masha Allah.
Price- 4 high
Food quantity-4 good enough for 2 ppl( medium to less appetite)
Food Quality-5 mast ekdum
Service-4 maybe they were busy so couldn't pay much attention. I went on Valentine's Eve n they failed to impress. Forget impress even attend properly 😑 no complains but you didn't help in creating the experience for the money you charge.
Ambience-4.

pageno_250.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_250.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ketan Patwardhan
reviews.description: If anyone is responsible for my alliance between Ramen and me it's this place 😆 please blame them for spoilig me with fabulous food. If you ever want to go eat Asian please close your eyes and go here.

reviews.author: Sneha Tolani
reviews.description:
I visited this place yesterday for lunch with a friend. Never have been a fan of Asian food n restaurants but this place impressed us a lot.
Interiors were quite good, giving vibes of Asian place.
Now coming to food, we got some fryums ( don't know the real name) to munch on while waiting for food n got 2 mocktails ( pudina flavour) also complimentary.
We didn't enjoy fryums that much but mocktail was really full of taste.
We ordered: crispy wontons with chilli tofu - 5/5. I have never had tofu so soft n tasty , It just like melted in my mouth. Really enjoyed it.
Teriyaki meal in a bowl(veg) - 5/5. Quantity was good enough for two people. Enjoyed this as well.
Mamagoto goreng chicken- 5/5 . Which according to my frnd was also perfect.

We were already full that's why didn't order any dessert.
Ambience, service, food -5/5 👌

Will definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Abhilash Patil
reviews.description:
when went there to try some authentic Chinese/Thai food and we end up with little bit disappointment
we tried almost everything right from sushi,momos,fried rice etc however feels like food is overpriced and nothing great but definitely impressed with ambiance and interiors

reviews.author: Samruddha Kulkarni
reviews.description:
Goods
▶️ coolest ambiance
▶️ interesting menu
▶️no issues of parking
▶️good quantity of serving
▶️friendly and helpful staff
▶️taste is moderately good

Bads
◀️some dishes are not completely authentic but the fusions, so some of them don't taste like what you expect .

⭕ Food we tried
Aunty's platter
Veg Ramen

reviews.author: Foodie Takes
reviews.description:
Had been to this place on a dry day. Had a waiting, we were asked to wait for 10mins & we gotta place in half in hour. After seating we were informed it's last order so cdnt order starters. We ordered 2 classic Thai dishes & 2 of their specialities, the person talking the order dint have any suggestions as to which gravy will match which rice & how much of qty will enuf for 5. So v ended up wasting food n combinations that dint go well. It's necessary for the person talking order in these speciality restaurant 2 educate their customers so they have good experience.Anyways Thai food was not authentic, I guess they had their take on the dish which was bad n ended up wasting. Their specials were descent...
Overall experience ok.

Decor & Ambience - 5
Food - 3
Service - 2
Value for money - 3

pageno_251.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_251.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Rhea De Souza
reviews.description: Went for brunch. Was very impressed with food quality and service. Plus ambience was superb . will recommend the cheese cake and platter. Taste is 5 points.

reviews.author: Sanchita Ratnaparkhi
reviews.description: Exceptional food, authentic taste and the ambiance makes the experience better. The service is also great and quick. Will definitely be visiting again and again to try everything else on the menu

reviews.author: Anup Heblikar
reviews.description:
Visited this place for the first time yesterday. The staff was welcoming and we got a good place to sit.
We ordered:
Chinese sour and pepper soup
Bite sized corn and fritter balls
Veg hakka noodles
Street style spicy dumplings

We liked the soup and noodles the most.
Overall taste was above average.

Food - 3
Ambience - 3.5
Value for money - 3

They made a mistake in my bill as they added a dish which we had never ordered. They corrected the bill after i pointed out the issue.

reviews.author: Rikhil Bahadur
reviews.description:
The food was at par with any other mamagoto that I've been to. I do quite enjoy going to this chain. The staff and management was very friendly and polite which always adds to the dining experience.

Food arrived promptly and the one thing I appreciate the most is the fact that the food came all together and they waited for everyone to finish eating before cleaning up. I particularly love the laksa tribute here which is essentially a khaosuey. We ordered both the veg and the non veg one. Highly recommended it. Also ordered a noodles with chicken, the quantities are quite sufficient for one person, in fact most people would even happily be able to share between 2, though both me and my partner love our portions!

reviews.author: Uru Boudh
reviews.description:
A great place to have delicious Asian bowls,small plates, Sushi and much more. Interiors were so colourful and gives you vibes of asian cities.

We were welcomed with a complimentary snack with few exceptional sauces till the time our order arrived.

Had Crispy Wonton with chilly Chicken from small plates section. Wonton was perfectly done while chicken was well cooked. So small plates were quite small for its price.

Later had Fiery Thai Shrimp bowl with chicken and egg. On first glimpse i thought it won't be enough but damn the bowl was never ending. It was under spicy category so choose wisely but was delicious. Chicken were fried and slices while egg was served as omelette on top. Shrimps were diced and mixed with the rice so it was barely noticeable.

What i loved the most was 'American Style Chunky caramel Sponge Cake'. The Sponge cake was too soft served with icecream on side and hot caramel sauce to top it. This is a must try who want something in desserts other than chocolate.

Service was quick. So without drinks this place will cost you about 1600 bucks for 2 people which is on higher side.

pageno_252.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_252.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Neha M
reviews.description: Had heard alot about this place and was long pending in my list. Finally went there. They have this perky colourful ambience, which peps up instantly. Nicely done oriental decor. Food is good as well. We ordered this crispy lotus stems, which were average. But the wok bowl was yumm, we ordered vegetables with hoison sauce, with fried rice, they were yummilicious. Could click all pics, as they looked too tempting to wait, with amazing aroma of perfectly blended spices. One of the Very few places serving good oriental food, with good decor n a very good hospitality. I glad they kept upto my expectations. Coming soon again, to try more woks n rice bowls

reviews.author: Shefali
reviews.description:
Loved everything about the place- the decor, food, service-everything!

The service was attentive & fast with some lovely complimentary mocktails & the 'papad' accompanied with tangy, spicy dips.

We had the following items-
1. Cheesy tacos
2. Spicy Bangkok bowls - both veg & non veg
3. Lemon & mint lemonade
4. Chicken dumplings

One of the best Asian food spots in Pune, it's definitely worth coming back to, again & again. We left with a big smile on our faces.

reviews.author: Snehal Lokhande
reviews.description:
Ambience *****
Food*****
Service *****

Worth it. I have visited this on a Saturday afternoon and the food was really good.
Next time yes I will visit this place

reviews.author: Bhagyendrasinh Chudasama (Baggy)
reviews.description:
This beautiful place successfully pulled me in to enjoy its finger licking food. The place is done up amazingly well with alot of art work used all around. The service is fabulous and the food is too good.

What I had?
I had the.....
Crispy Lotus Stem
Traditional Crispy Lamb
Rock Shrimp Tempura
Street Style Dumplings

Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Ambience: 4/5

Overall a very pleasent experience.
A 4/5 from me.

reviews.author: Aliya
reviews.description:
Love this place!

A couple of visits and never a dull one. The portion sizes and taste have consistently been upto the mark. Truly impressive.

My TOP Favorites -

1. Crispy lotus Stem - The serving is huge, go for it only of you are more in number orelse you may have to simply Fast Forward to desserts.

2. Chicken Wings - A fantastic platter of wings you won’t forget! Take my word for this.

3. Thai Curries - Red or Green, equally delish.

4. Sticky Jasmin Rice - paired with some prawns, this one makes way straight to the heart.

5. Dimsums - one of the finest !

Also, while everything else is just about excellent, you could do well by skipping the Sushis here. Not the best and definitely not recommended for first timers (who maybe put off for life)!

P.S Their Melon Mocktail used to be my favourite, apparently off the menu for reasons best known to them! Earnest request - get it back please!

pageno_253.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_253.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Meenal Girdonia Tripathi
reviews.description: Ambience is ok but food was not very tasty. Phad thai noodles were soggy. Chilli dumplings were good. No one asked if they should serve water. I do understand that it was laye as we went in 11. But still, the restaurent was open. Not worth 1400 rupees for 2 people. Too costly for the quality served.

reviews.author: Tutu
reviews.description:
Love this place, the ambience! The service and the quality, everything is just great.
We had dimsums platter, soups, noodles, spicy fried prawns, Tacos, Prawns wrapped in bacon and sticky rice.
Love them all!

reviews.author: Dev Nim
reviews.description:
Fifth time in 20 days. Enough said? Phenomenal food, pleasantly large portions, super efficient service and a very interesting space!

While I’ve tried different items through my visits, my absolute favourite here is the Java Grilled Fish and my go to non-alcoholic drink is the Lemon Grass Iced Tea both of which are soooo good.

Finally a restaurant that ensures every aspect that contributes to the overall experience is well thought out and perfect! 👌🏼

reviews.author: Bhagyashri Paste
reviews.description: Best place to have Ramen noodles. The kiwi mint drink was also great and refreshing. The interior of the restruant is spectacular and the staff is very cordial.

reviews.author: Richa Pherwani
reviews.description: Food is utterly delicious! The portions are good and the service is outstanding! The ambience is good and the lighting is interesting! A good place for a family meal!

pageno_254.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_254.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: MANDAR GHANEKAR
reviews.description:
Food - Ordered the Oriental Clear Soup (Veg), Java Grilled Tofu, Bamie Noodles and Banoffee. Delicious preparation, right balance of flavors.
Ambience - Loved the Chinese and South Asian inspired interiors.
Staff & Service - Attentive staff, genuinely courteous.
Value for Money

The only complaints I have are as follows
1) They should stop selling Bottled water whose MRP is 110 - seems like a total ripoff. A simple 20/- Bisleri, Aquafina etc would also do.
2) The portion of the Banoffee dessert could be larger

reviews.author: Vishwas Vaze
reviews.description:
I wish Zomato had the 1/2 star option like earlier coz it’s rare for me to rate any place a 5. So the 4 rating but it’s more like 4.5

Went here for my wife’s birthday with my in-laws and our 4 month old.

The place is located in Pavillion mall along with a couple of other restaurants. The food and service is great and this place was a pleasant change over our frequented diner Mainland China in the neighborhood.

Surya was great and attended to us to make sure we got what we wanted.

reviews.author: Shruti M
reviews.description:
Mamagoto needs no introduction, it is well known in Mumbai & Delhi. My family & I have been visiting the one in Mumbai. So when it came up in Pune, it was 1st on my list.
It is in Pavilion mall and it being slightly distant from my place I have not visited many times, however I plan to do so.

Anyway ambience is standard Mamagoto style, with creative wall paintings & ceilings, low lights, comfortable seating arrangement and well endowed bar.

We ordered Crispy thai veggies, hakka noodles & veggies in black bean sauce. Everything was well cooked, well balanced in flavour and tasty.

I would rate;

Ambience- 4/5
Food- 4/5
Service- 3.5/5

reviews.author: Bahar Dhairyawan
reviews.description: By far one of the best places for Pan Asian cuisine in Pune...To begin, the atmosphere is casual and relaxed and the friendly staff let’s you be at ease...We were visiting this place on a weekday afternoon so didn’t have to wait for a table...Their cocktail menu has a good variety and the food right from the small plates to the maki rolls and the rice bowls was scrumptious, tasty and kept us wanting more, so much so that there was absolutely no space for dessert...Saving it for our next visit that I am already looking forward to

reviews.author: Rohini Roundale
reviews.description:
It's located in the Pavilion Mall 2nd floor, such a pretty ambiance the walls even celling is decorated Nicely.
About the food they gave us some complimentary starter it was very tasty after that we ordered fried wonton Chicken it was so good.
For main course we ordered The pad Thai egg noodles and Thai chicken dish with all of that we also ordered Peach Ice Tea and they gave us complimentary Virgin Mojito. Overall very good experience.

pageno_255.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_255.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Rohit Kulkarni
reviews.description:
I am writing this review cause I feel this place has the potential, and can certainly do better, we went to mamas on Christmas eve, the place was jam packed with hungry Christmas revelers, we ordered for a cranberry kafir lime Mocktail, which was really great next on we ordered Prawn and celery dumplings, description read it as made of prawn and celery mince, but it was just a blob of prawn and no traces of celery, reheating again and again had made the dumpling rubbery white, next was the prawns dry red chilly a very very very dry dish,which should probably served with some kind of a sauce, last we ordered for a rice bowl,Soggy Thai basil rice bowl though good on flavour it had nothing that was mentioned in the description, no vegetables no jasmine rice just minced chicken with soggy rice, I called the service staff and enquiried but they kept on insisting it was jasmine rice when clearly it was not, so a soggy fried rice for 500+

Service: 5
Ambience:5
Food:2
Value for Money: 1

reviews.author: Rajendra Karle
reviews.description:
The best pan Asian cuisine in town.
Let me get started with the courteous staff who was quick in all our orders. We got a complementary dish don’t know it’s name but it was tasty. It was this small fried papas along with a chili dip. Then we orders fried wonton chicken which was cooked in correct amount of Thai sauce. After the starters we ordered peach ice tea but as it was taking time for them to prepare it, they gave us complimentary virgin mojito which was very refreshing and minty. After this we ordered main course. It consisted of pad thai egg noodles and Thai chicken dish. This was the perfect combo. After eating so much we had no place for the desert😂
Overall a good experience with tasty food. This place is a must visit.

reviews.author: Ajay Kolambekar
reviews.description: Delicious authentic Asian food, the prices look high but compensated by bigger portion size. Highly recommended for people who want to try authentic Asian cuisin. Will visit again for sure.

reviews.author: Payal Dalwani
reviews.description:
Mamagoto - One of the best place in Pune serving Asian Cuisine.
Right from Dumplings to Sushi to their Signature Rice Bowls everything is soo good.
.
Asian Food is something which includes ingredients like Rice, Ginger, Garlic ,Sesame Seeds ,Chillies Soy , Tofu etc which are either Stir fried or Deep fried common cooking methods.
.
Here are some Hits and Misses from MamaGoto which i tried-

Mocktails-
1. KIWI AND MINT COLLINS -
2. CRANBERRY AND KAFFIR LIME PUNCH-
Mamagoto has got some really good options in Mocktails. I rate it- 4/5.

Food -
1. Oriental Clear Soup- Simple Clear Soup with Veggies and Prawns , tastes really Good. Perfect season to have it.
2. Thai Puchka bite- Puchka with coconut crush and Thai sauce.. Personally didnt like it as it was too sour and spicy .
3. Spiced Asian Bbq Breast - #highlyrecommended . Totally worth having this .. The bbq dip they serve with it totally compliments the dish.
4. Prawns wrapped with Bacon - Perfectly cooked Prawns and Bacon . Treat for someone who loves bacon. But the quantity served is quit less.
5. Fiery Thai Shrimp fried rice with Asian Green Chilli Chicken Sibbons - The sixer dish at Mamagoto , So filling and tasty rice bowl ever had . Totally in love with this bowl.. #musttry.
.

Quality- 5/5
Qualntity - 3.5/5
Taste - 4/5
Overall 4/5
Cheers Mamgoto!!

reviews.author: Pratyush
reviews.description: Amazing experience with this food outlet . Asian cuisine with array of best fun dishes to try it out . Full stars for the great colourful ambience and service .

pageno_256.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_256.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Akshay Gadkari
reviews.description:
The following is what I will rate the place
Ambience : 8/10 a bit conjusted for the two seaters
But all in all the place is really funky . Love the whole downtown China vibe going around in the place
Food : 9/10 I would’ve rated it a ten on ten but some of the momos were really bad . Please try the sushi it is amazing . I really hope they make their own wasabi some day , cause they really take effort in making the sushi .. so ask for the sushi platter and also the momo platter . A noodle bow would be sufficient as entree mains .
Drinks : amazing a 10/10 please try there passion fruit shots that they have amazing and if you are a non drinker go for a lemon grass iced tea... it is out of this world just ask them to go little low on the sugar though .
Desserts : didn’t have any will review it next time for sure
Price : fairly high but the quality served is really really good !

reviews.author: Ashima Chauhan
reviews.description:
*Food*
The food here is delicious and authentic. Some of my favourite dishes are: noodles in black bean sauce, street style dumpling, chang mai train station noodles, fried rice, and chocolate cake.
*Drinks*
We had Virgini mohito and loved it.
*Service* 👌
Special thanks to *Boi Thang* (apologies if I miss spelt the name) for the amazing service and the complimentary dessert. He took care of everything, made us feel comfortable and at home. Best evening ever! ☺️

reviews.author: Manasi Oswal
reviews.description:
I've never been a die hard fan of Asian food, I've always been very picky and I enjoy very limited items when it comes to this cuisine and those few need to hit the mark just right for me to love an Asian food restaurant.

Located in pavilion mall, this place has the most gorgeous interiors, it's so colorful and fun at the same time! Perfect for your wine and sushi dates or even a relaxed family dinner.

I absolutely love dumplings so I couldn't stop myself from ordering two variants, the Crystal Veg Dumplings which is filled with shiitake mushrooms, carrots, water chestnuts and lotus roots. The other one I tried is the Old School Gyoza which is a pan fried dumpling stuffed with veggies served with a spicy sauce. I thoroughly enjoyed both these dumplings and highly recommend you'll to try it out too!

Being an ardent mushroom lover, I tried out their Crispy Mushroom Sushi, and I absolutely loved it! This is probably the only time I enjoyed sushi, otherwise I've never been a sushi fan! If you're a vegetarian and new to sushi, this one is a must try! Do not miss this, it is slightly made suitable for our Indian palate so trying something like this out won't throw you off!

For mains we tried the Chiang Mai Train Station Noodles, which is essentially a bowl full of Khow Suey. This was a slight miss, it was way too spicy and I couldn't taste any other flavors.

Overall I quite enjoyed the food and will definitely visit for the sushi again!

reviews.author: Sid
reviews.description:
MAMAGOTO....A-PLACE-YOU-MUST-GO-TO

Japanese artwork greets you soon as you enter with colourful wall and an equally colorful ceiling. The overall ambiance is comforting, enough privacy I would say for every table.

The servers are polite and can suggest well.

We started with chinese pepper and sour soup and tom yum soup. Pepper and sour was thick with good peppery feel. The Tom Yum soup was tasty; true explosion of south asian flavours.
Later on, we went for the dumpling platter. Unfortunately, they were out of lamb and they served us prawns instead. The dumplings were done beautifully, nice and thin skin; not too sticky; good amount of filling (more than just a mouthful). What could be improved is the sauces. All of the sauces served were of the same flavour family.
Also, the dumplings are expected piping hot. They were luke-warmish. But the quality was impeccable.

We ended this with pan fried chicken noodles in black bean sauce. Good quantity and texture to the sauce. A little too much beans made it a little off-target with the taste. Nevertheless, next time we will try the cantonese sauce.

Definitely worth a visit if you like South-East Asian cuisine.

reviews.author: Rucha Kalekar
reviews.description: Loved the Wan Chai Midnight Chicken and the American style sponge cake as well. The basil cup chicken and the dumplings are fresh and delicious.

pageno_257.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_257.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Khan Labika
reviews.description:
The ambience is amazing, the Japanese theme restaurant has Awed me!

I had lunch menu which was like a fresh prepared buffet kind of lunch..

The tofu was nice, so was almost everything served on the table.

A good change !!

reviews.author: Deepti Yadav
reviews.description:
Awesome restaurant with beautiful ambience and amazing food located at The pavilion mall.It has become my personal favourite since i visited this place.
Service is too fast and upto mark.Staff is courteous and polite and food is so yummy.You will love it

reviews.author: Jerlyn
reviews.description:
What does Mamagoto mean? It literally means "to play with food". Mamagoto is a fusion Pan Asian café with a relaxed and casual atmosphere where affordable Asian cuisine & drinks combine with quirky décor.
Mamagoto's food is a blend of inspiration from Asian street hawkers. A lot of travel and research has gone in to dish out that perfect dish for you. Their portion size is huge and is made only for sharing (unless you can eat it all ;P)

They've also won quite a lot of awards for the food they serve and tbh honest when i visited this place it gave me a feel of as if i am dining in at a restaurant in Mumbai. Yes! The staff, the ambience, the service and the food everything was top notch!

So talking about food ( you all know I am a sucker for good Asian food). Let's see what all I had at Mamagoto:

1. Thai Chicken and Water Chestnut Salad - What a lovely salad! This salad is loaded with lots of cashew nuts along with water chestnuts and Thai spiced chicken. I kid you not the chicken is so super yummy and the hint of those Thai spices is out of this world. The nuts and the water chestnut gave the salad the required crunch and hey not to forget that the water chestnut made the salad even more refreshing!

2. Chinese Soup Pepper - Apparently this soup has 22 different types of ingredients to it. I don't know about the 22 ingredients but the soup was fabulous! To me it tasted more like the Chindian manchow soup. I would call it comfort food.

3. Spicy Chicken Dumplings - These are your normal chicken dumplings with a slight hint of spiciness to it. The spice level is really mild, you can barely feel it. The dumpling was perfectly done and another one goes into my comfort food list!

4. Rock Shrimp Tempura - First off, their portion size is HUGE. Trust me when I say HUGE, I mean it's really huge. Their tempura batter is to die for and the combination of prawns with tempura is just out of this world. Be it your sushi or your deep fried shrimps, it tastes super yummy. And as far as this dish is concerned, it has my heart!

5. Thai Puchka Bite - Desi ladki aur puchka sunn ke khush na ho, ho hi nahi sakta! The desi chhori in me said let's try this one. I called for this one and this one is basically your puchka filled with a sweet and spicy sauce along with betel leafs with peanuts, onion and lime. The sauce had a hint of ginger and red chilli. Trust me on this, the moment you eat it, there is a blast of flavours in your mouth. Different flavours at one time. Ahh... That feeling I tell you!

6. Crispy Lotus Stem - I really like the way they presented the dish. The Lotus stem is deep fried and served separately along with the sauce. So you can have it as you like it. Have it with the sauce or just eat it with your chakhna. The idea behind this was to keep your Lotus steam crispy for long. I absolutely loved it! A must try at Mamagoto.

7. Ebi Tempura Prawn Sushi - Ebi Tempura sushi is my favourite. There's just something about it (I guess I know it, I think it's the tempura and prawns). I really like sushi and this combination especially is very close to my heart. This one is basically crispy fried tempura sushi with katsu mayonnaise and spring onion. All the sushi lovers in the house, head to Mamagoto today!

8. Assorted Rice - By the time I reached this one I was so super full but as a ritual I had to order atleast one main dish and I called for this assorted rice which was loaded with fried eggs, chicken, lamb and prawns. The reason I called for this was that I wanted to skip ordering a gravy. Thus I had the rice all by itself and I feel this is just no non sense comfort food.

9. Coconut Ice Cream with Palm Sugar - What a lovely ice cream! I mean this one is healthy as it is made from palm sugar and coconut in any ice cream just takes the ice cream to the next level. This one is a must try at Mamagoto because no one does it better than them!

10. Banoffee Pie - Their banoffee pie was pretty decent. Tbh I have had better ones but no harm in trying it once.

Overall, Mamagoto is Asian food at its best as it is comfort with their own little twist. And i feel these guys are doing a fab job with the food and service. Also they have a special tasting menu which is quite interesting where you can try a 3 course meal at a very low price (refer menu). If you are hesitant about ordering stuff which you aren't sure about then go for the tasting menu and you won't be disappointed.

A big thank you to team Mamagoto for inviting me and hosting me.

#jerlynfoodfanatic

reviews.author: Neal Phulsundar
reviews.description:
# Nice ambience.
# Tasty Tossed Fish.
# Bad Crispy Wonton with Chill Tofu - Suggested to work on it.
# OMG - 30 Rs Pespi-Can you need to pay INR 150 + 10% service charge + 5% GST.. this was really disgusting.

reviews.author: Anoop Krishnakumar
reviews.description: A fantastic Asian fusion restaurant with a twist of its own! The moment you enter into the restaurant it feels like you are in the sets of an Asian movie in the 90s! The low hanging lights giving a orange hue over the entire warm colored art to a wall filled with the Feng Shui waving cats, it's an ambience you can't miss. Coming to the food, it was really delicious. We had ordered honey chicken and fiery Thai shrimp fried rice with Asian green chilli chicken ribbons. Both were marvelous with well cooked chicken and the seafood as fresh as they come! Though the mocktail we ordered was a bit too sweet for our taste, but the fiery fried rice kind of helped tone it down. A bit on the expensive side but a complete value for money! Highly recommended!

pageno_258.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_258.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Achal Aggarwal
reviews.description:
This place is perfect for a chinese buffet. You must go only when you’re a diehard fan of chinese. They serve you starters, platter and then main course. Must note: Drink here is not complimentary.
This place serves authentic chinese food.

reviews.author: Kavita
reviews.description:
‘Mamagoto’ a place which has brought a completely different experience to the Asian food culture of Pune. The name itself speaks a lot about this place. This place has various chains in Delhi, Gurgaon, Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai. And finally when it’s launched in Pune, we got to experience their food culture. In Pune, it is located in Pavilion Mall (SB Road).

Mamagoto, in literal meaning is an interactive, context aware Japanese dining system which encourage people to 'play' with their food to sense its texture and shape. Even their interiors speak for itself. I was literally taken aback by such swankiest and crazy interiors. Every corner of this place is filled with arts which reflects culture of various Asian places. I loved this idea that even though the place is completely filled with such swanky paintings and pictures but it doesn’t come off as a clustered place. And that also adds a charm to this place. I went crazy for their ambiance henceforth.

So, as I have mentioned that this place serves a variety of Asian cuisine. Their menu is quite extensive. Even their house cocktails are something that you don’t want to miss. Also, their hospitality is really good. 

I have heard a lot about this place since it has opened in Pune. And I was literally eager to try out this place and then finally one day I decided to visit this place with so many expectations and keeping my hopes high and trust me this place didn’t disappoint me at all. Do you want to know why? So, the answer was pretty much in their food which I am sharing with you now-

01. SHRIMP WITH RED DRY CHILLI: Golden fried shrimps which were so crispy, cooked with dry chili and tossed with Chinese flavours and burnt garlic. The flavours of Chinese spices come off really nice and I wish instead of Chicken Popcorn or Classic Popcorn, I can eat this while watching movies or Netflix. This one was a perfect snack.

02. RAINBOW CHICKEN DUMPLINGS: So why the name rainbow? Was it in multi-color? Or the stuffing was of rainbow colors? These all thoughts popped up in my head when I heard the name. So yes, it did look like a rainbow. Dumplings which were stuffed with chicken and garlic and later garnished with red, green and yellow bell pepper which somehow looked like a rainbow. Hot-steamed dumplings tasted really good with Kimchi sauce.

03. EBI TEMPURA: When it comes to Sushi, you don’t keep your expectations high from most of the places as it is really hard to find good Sushi. But this is one of that place which serves amazing Sushi.
So a little introduction about Sushi before I describe this one. So, Sushi is a Japanese Dish made of specially prepared vinegared rice, usually with some sugar and salt and combined with different ingredients like seafood, vegetables and occasionally tropical fruits. But Sushi is widely known to be made from seafood.
This ‘Ebi Tempura Sushi’ had Tempura fried crispy prawn, katsuo mayonnaise, cucumber, and spring onion. Really loved the taste of this Sushi.

04. FIERY THAI SHRIMP FRIED RICE: This is one of the exotic Thai dishes. Shrimp cooked with spicy Thai rice along with fried chicken ribbons and garnished with fried egg and served with salad. This tasted really good. Spicy flavor with fried eggs and chicken felt delicious.

05. CHICKEN BASIL CUPS: Here cups referring to Crispy lettuce leaves which you have to fill with perfectly cooked finely chopped chicken along with basil, bird’s eye chili, and crushed pepper and that makes chicken basil cups. The chicken was cooked in a Thai style which I totally loved it.

06. CARAMEL SPONGE CAKE: Highly recommended dessert. Well, it was basically homemade ‘American Style’ chunky caramel sponge cake. Gooey sponge cake topped with caramel and served along with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce. So, to make it a complete dessert, I poured caramel sauce on it which made it heavenly.

So, this place has totally lived up to my expectations. From food to service and even ambiance, nothing went wrong here. There was not a single point where I felt this place an average one. Totally loved this place. Though their prices are on a little expensive side yet worth to give it a shot.

Ratings-

FOOD: 5/5
AMBIANCE: 5/5
SERVICE: 5/5

A must place to try. Thank you Mamagoto :)

reviews.author: Amruta
reviews.description: I had tried this restaurant at Khan Market in New Delhi way back in 2013 and never missed going there on a trip to the Capital or in Bandra. Finally, so glad it’s in Poona now. I absolutely love the food here and highly recommend you try it. Love the basil chicken rice ! Very good options for vegetarians too.

reviews.author: Shikha Mallya
reviews.description:
First Impression - Interiors and Ambience

In the age of chucking the stereotype and embracing the unconventional, Mamagoto has done a fine job merging traditional and contemporary elements when it comes to interior décor.

When I entered the restaurant finally, after having eyed it from afar for a while, I felt like I was transported to a chic eatery in Japan (although, I've never been to Japan 🤭).

The numerous neo-Japanese elements like the Japanese poster-collage walls, picture frames suspended from the ceiling and the section near the bar made entirely out of tiny 'Lucky Cat' figurines were a treat to look at.

There were abundant tables and the place wasn't packed on a Sunday evening either.
________________________________________________________
Pricing

When we were handed the menu, we sort of skipped a beat looking at the prices. Food is expensive here! The average price being 450-500 rupees for vegetarian items. 50-100 rupees more for non-vegetarian items.
________________________________________________________
Our Order

Melon Mocktail Pitcher

We do not usually order drink pitchers for the sole reason that they're too much to finish. However, we took a chance with this one. They had a special Mocktail Pitcher menu; each pitcher was priced 499/-. This one was made out of melon juice, carrot juice, pineapple juice(maybe), lime juice and sugar syrup. It was hands down one of the best Mocktails I've ever had. It had a nice fresh and sweet-tangy predominantly melon taste; and the Lord bless the person who made it, as she/he hadn't put those huge brain-freeze inducing ice chunks and instead had used shaved ice. The drink was consistent in taste, start to finish, and hadn't got diluted thanks to the shaved ice.

NB: One pitcher equals 3 almost full glasses; around a litre.

Assorted Veg Maki Platter

This was one of the most expensive food items I've ordered in my life. Priced at a whopping 699/-, the platter consisted of 12 pieces(4 pieces each) of asparagus tempura, spicy cucumber and cream cheese and crispy mushroom Maki. Maki is the most common and well-known type of Sushi.

Though I have no expertise in judging sushi as I've just had it once before, that too in India; I judged it solely on taste.

The sushi pieces were accompanied by a pretty salty soy dipping sauce, sliced pickled ginger and a tiny portion of wasabi.

The spicy cucumber and cream sushi was good in taste; mildly seasoned and creamy-ish. Nothing was spicy about it though. Although, I feel, the combination of cucumber and cream cheese in sushi is not unheard of. The seaweed or 'Nori' covering, however, wasn't melt in mouth and after having chewed it for a couple seconds I had to swallow the remains as is. I don't know if seaweed is supposed to be textured like that.

The asparagus tempura roll was also along the same lines in terms of taste. Didn't taste much asparagus in it. However, it looked beautiful and was interesting to eat for a novice sushi-eater like myself.

The spicy mushrooms roll was the most flavourful of the lot. It was mildly spicy and tasted good even without any of the accompaniments.

NB: Ensure you do not dunk your roll entirely in the dipping sauce as it is too overpowering in taste and will take away the roll's original flavours. Be extremely careful with wasabi; it's super pungent and will knock you unconscious if you have too much.
The sliced ginger tasted the best out of all the accompaniments.

Stir Fried Veg Udon Noodles

This noodle dish comprised well-cooked Udon noodles stir-fried in a thick gravy that consisted of cabbage/pakchoy, babycorn, mushroom, capsicum and zucchini. When I ordered this item, I presumed the noodles would be dry and maybe a bit spicy as well. However, this dish was quite sweet and I felt a kind of peanut-y flavour in it. The dish felt more south-east Asian than Japanese. I wasn't wholly impressed by it. This too was priced 499/- rupees.

Fried Rice Crispies with Ground Red Chilli Dip (Complimentary for everyone)

This was a standard 'in-your-face' complimentary dish.
Consisted of rice crispies, which, ironically, weren't much crispy. The ground red chilli dip was absolutely lip-smacking but fiery. However, I did not like the way it was served; dipping long crispies in the dip that was provided in a tiny bowl was extremely inconvenient.
_______________________________________________________
The Damage

We ended up paying around 1900/- rupees for the entire meal.

The restaurant levies 10% service charge exclusive of the standard 5% GST.
_______________________________________________________
Service

Service was good. All the items, except the Mocktail, were served within 20 minutes of ordering. The place seemed well staffed too; or it seemed so because there weren't many diners when we went.
________________________________________________________
Final Thought

I liked the food here, especially the Mocktail, and was pleasantly surprised by the nice sushi as well but I was more impressed by the decor.

I would like to try more items from their menu but the prices would make me think twice before dining here again.

reviews.author: Mrunali Humane
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is well known for its specific Pan-Asian Fusion and is for the crowd who looks for different flavors of Asian cuisines along with an attractive ambiance. Mamagoto aims at making your experience experiential and social by serving affordable Pan-Asian fusion cuisine plus drinks that combine with quirky décor. Their designs are Manga inspired.

The 80 seaters new restaurant includes an outside seating area consisting of vibrant and diverse graphics that see a continuance of the quirky design language associated with Mamagoto along with some fresh elements. The new space designed by Atul Anand & Rahul Khanna is divided into two zones. The patio area embodies a colonial vibe adorned with antique Asian elements. The doors open into the inside area, which is true Mamagoto spirit, is cozy as well as bright with quirky paintings and contrasting furniture. The new outlet will see various traditional Asian objects usually found in the street shops of Hong Kong like the Maneki Neko, also known as the Fortune Cat, waving in good fortune for its owners along with some oriental street art.

Let's get into the foodstuff - 

Prawns wrapped in Bacon - We started with a bang dish. They use tiger prawns here and its wrapped in a huge strip of bacon. The prawns were soaked in a mixture of bbq+soy sauce which tasted good. However, the bacon was bit chewy which disappointed me a bit. Overall I loved the concept and as a bacon lover if the bacon was crispy it could've been my favorite dish for the night.

Shrimp with dry red chili - Fried juicy shrimps tossed in burnt garlic, red chili and different Chinese ingredients. The mixture was pretty dry and the taste of garlic and red chili was mild on flavor. even the shrimp without the mixture tasted bland. It was given with chili mayo sauce to balance out the taste which did the work. The garlic and red chili flavor enhancement could do the work.

Spiced Asian bbq chicken breast - Small pieces of chicken breast marinated in Asian bbq sauce was a great combination. However, the chicken was overcooked which made it dry. The sauce, on the other hand, was perfect and had a balanced flavor of spices and bbq sauce.

Old school gyoza dumplings - The coating of this dumplings were bit thicker than I expected which more than enough filling of minced juicy chicken meat. The dumplings were pan fried a bit to give that slight crisp edges. The coating overshadowed the filling which I think can be avoided. It was given with momo sauce which had a dominating flavor of soy sauce.

Cheese and truffle oil dumplings - These dumpling had a nice thin coating with cottage cheese filling. It was given with smoky mix cheese which went well with the combination.

Spicy Ramen - One of the best ramen bowl I had. The portion was pretty huge and more than enough for two. It was topped with classic ramen elements like sprouts, eggs, seaweed, noodles. The broth was perfect and had that spicy punch in every sip. It wasn't a spicy water, it had the flavors of spices too. I loved it.

Pork Belly Rice - If you love pork then you must have this at Mamagoto. It was given with sticky rice topped with fried egg. The pork belly chunks were given on skewer. It was nicely marinated with bbq and soy sauce and finished in the grill. It had that nice smoky flavor with tangy, sweet taste. The rice also complimented the pork. The pork was cooked perfectly.

Overall Verdict - I enjoyed my time at Mamagoto. Except for some minor tweaks everything was perfect.

pageno_259.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_259.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Nitin Bind
reviews.description:
Beautiful ambience and every corner of this restaurant was picture perfect
The lighting is so apt that all the pictures you click here will look awesome.
Menu is definitely worked upon and serves vast range of dishes.
Prep and flavour were too authentic and good.
We order dumplings platter which served mixture of dumpling which tasted beautiful
Whereas mocktail too were nice..overall it would be the place I would like to visit again for sure.
4.5 stars would be apt and well deserved 😂

reviews.author: Abhishek Karambelkar
reviews.description:
Food - 4.5
Service - 4.5
Ambience - 4.5
Value For Money - 4.0

What we tried - Crispy Lotus Stem, Non-Veg Dumpling Platter

Highs:
- You must be wondering that we only had starters. Honestly, the quantity was insane and it filled us to the brim!
- Checks everything a fine-dine restaurant needs.
- Special mention for the ambience! Just what we need after getting bored of the typical oriental restaurants.
- Continuing my praise about the ambience, a pleasant waft of oriental preparations multiply your appetite as you enter the restaurant. Didn't expect smell to be a part of the ambience.
- Free kurdai LOL. They serve you these munchies before you get your order. Looks like kurdai is one strange common thing between Maharashtrian and oriental cuisines. It's served with tasty spicy dips!

Lows:
- Some tables are too closely arranged. Your privacy might get compromised. Minor downside, but a significant one.

reviews.author: Gargi
reviews.description:
Foods good like the pork belly with rice 🍛 and porky tacos 🌮
The soups are amazing loaded with veggies and chicken n also tofu
The best soup on the menu is Tom yum 🍲
It’s just if u don’t like your food sweet you will not like this place

reviews.author: Thewanderersmenu
reviews.description:
We wanted to try some authentic Japanese food and looked up for some and found this with a good rating, but it did not live up to our expectations in the matters of food. The interiors were really nice and colorful. Very Asian to be specific. This place serves moderate variety of Asian food and we tried mostly the Japanese ones.

Street Style Spicy Dumplings (Chicken)
The seasonings used on top of the dumpling was something very deep fried and felt like the chillies which are generally used while making something schezwan, the dumplings had a good filling of minced chicken and flavour was very Indian, like any other momo joint. There was soy sauce drizzled on it which was very thin but had the right amount of saltiness. The name says it spicy but it wasn't spicy at all. But nevertheless, this was better than the Gyoza 😊

Old School Gyoza (Veg)
These were some green coloured dumplings with some spring onions seasonings and the same soy sauce which were a bit shallow fried, The vegetables used in the stuffing was mostly carrot and cabbage and the pieces of carrot were big and not grated or finely cut. I guess there were some bits of ginger which gave the pungent taste. The taste was nothing extraordinary though, but it is definitely different from your usual momo joint. 😐

Sukiyaki Rice Noodles (Chicken)
These noodles were fairly good. They were made by using the well known flat noodles, the noodles had the right flavours and were not chewy. The chicken was really tender and well cooked. This dish looks a bit dry but didn't feel as such, the crispy carrot and radish served like the garnish gave the noodles a whole balance, which all in all tasted good. 😃

Mama's Spicy Ramen Bowl (Veg)
This was a disappointment, the noodles used in this can be compared to Maggi, the tofu used was very soft but had no flavour at all. The broth was red and a bit thick for ramen, the spinach they had put was practically tasteless and did not lend any flavour to the ramen. They literally had put legumes (Matki) which came out of nowhere. They barely used any other veggies. Overall this dish was somewhat like where a Misal wanted to become a Ramen, but got stuck in between instead. ☹️

Hakka Noodles (Veg)
We couldn't eat the Ramen, so went for a safer option, the veggies used were really fresh and crisp, the noodles were a bit oily and lacked a bit of salt, but still edible, the taste was neither bland nor flavourful,. This was a so so. 😐

Margarita Pitcher🍸
This was really good. The drink was chilled and the sweet and sour taste of a good tequila and mixed juices really helped us have a good time. 😊

Service
The service was not that impressive, like the food took atleast 15-20 mins to arrive but this was told by the polite servers beforehand. The servers were really polite and helpful. The prices were very high we almost paid 3k for everything and they do levy service charges which you can choose to not pay according to govt norms.

Overall, we had a good time but the food was so so. 😶

reviews.author: Gandhar Deshpande
reviews.description:
Cosy place located in Pavillion mall. Once you enter the restaurant, refreshing aroma of typical Asian fragrances makes you hungry. Modern Oriental style colourful interior enhances the food experience. Staff is cooperative and helping. All the suggested food items were delicious and had Asian Oriental touch. We started with Chinese sour and pepper chicken soup, similar to general hot and sour soup, tasty and full of complex aromas of spices. Then tried chicken basil cups, oriental version of chicken Kheema, juicy finely chopped chicken with basil, crushed pepper, coriander and served along with crunchy letuce. Just fell in love with this preparation. Finally we tried a beautiful looking dish called Garlic chicken with star aniseed aroma and Crunchy spinach leaves, spinach leaves were giving all together unique taste to this oriental style chicken gravy, we combined this with chicken fried rice.
Still many more visits to be done to experience the entire menu. Cheers. Another good asian oriental restaurant which stands out along with Mainland China, Spring onion.

pageno_260.name: Mamagoto

address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_260.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ananya Shah
reviews.description:
Visited Mamagoto on a Thursday night with my friend
Food - 7/10
Taste - 7.5/10
Quality - 8/10
Hygiene - 8/10
Serving size - average
Ambience - mind blowing
Staff on duty - very helpful and polite (especially Mr Pritam)
Service - quick
Cost - expensive
What to order ➡️
Street Style Spicy Dumplings
Chiang Mai Train Station Noodles
Soggy Thai Basil Fried Rice
Mama’s Calamari
Water Chestnut Spring Roll
Crispy Chilli Potato
Overall worth visiting
And also got a complimentary chocolate cake from Mr Pritam 😎
For more photos and videos follow me on Instagram @ananyashah28 and please do check my highlights 🤘

reviews.author: Nakul Agrawal
reviews.description: I like this place , comfortable sitting, good service and excellent food. Price little expensive overall a good experience. A worth visit place.

reviews.author: Abha Bhosekar
reviews.description: The ambience is awesome and so is the food. Super courteous and helpful staff. This place is expensive but we absolutely loved the place lot

reviews.author: Jai Sakhalkar
reviews.description:
Since the time Mamagoto opened its doors in Pune, I wanted to visit this restaurant and indulge into their exquisite food experience. I noticed that it is one of the finest restaurants in Pune.

Location : 5/5
It’s located at the Pavilion mall on Senapati Bapat Road, one of the prime locations in Pune.

Ambience : 5/5
The restaurant is decorated with amazing art that catches your eye as soon as you enter. The ceiling has amazing chandeliers which lit up the space, and the seating arrangement is unique too!

Food : 5/5
The chefs at this restaurant specialise in adding and Indian twist to Japanese, Chinese, Thaï cuisines. The food that is prepares is super delicious and the chef have invented many interesting dishes and sauces over the period of last few years, as confirmed by our very helpful host for the night.

We had ordered oriental clear soup, which was pretty good in taste.

The crispy lotus stem is a MUST-TRY starter. It is actually made up of lotus stem, cut diagonally or horizontally, and fried in olive oil. It is served with some tangy sauce which instantly awakens the tastebuds with its amazing taste.

We also tried the Hua-him highway rolls which are filled with cheese and are super good.

We ended our exquisite dinner with Mama’s home-made chocolate cake. This is again a MUST-TRY and I assure you that you won’t ever regret ordering this dessert. It is super gooey and chocolaty, yet it’s not over-sweet. The chefs make it sweet in the perfect amount, making you literally gobble the whole cake up.

If you plan to visit this place, I assure you, you’ll have an amazing time for you can enjoy excellent quality food!

I’m super delighted with my experience and I’ll hop in again soon enough to try some new dishes!
Cheers!

reviews.author: Sujata Thaker
reviews.description: I had great expectations from this place but was sorely disappointed. The ambience was great and I simply loved the bright and somewhat kitschy wall pappering all around. Also loved the ceiling decor!! The service staff too were polite and courteous. But the food was way below par. The wantons were substandard and the noodles were just about ok. Didn't feel like ordering anything else.

pageno_261.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_261.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ayush Aman Singh
reviews.description:
Nice decor and ambiance. Loved the paintings and the decorations.
Good food and friendly staff.
Ambiance : 4/5
Food : 4/5
Service : 3.5/5
Overall an amazing place.

reviews.author: Amit Pai
reviews.description: Had an absolutely delightful panasian culinary experience with the mamagoto menu offerings. To begin with the choices are mind boggling and everything looks to be delicious based on menu write ups..we had a course from each offering and tried both vegetarian and non vegetarian options..their crispy thai veggies is a must and dumpling platters make it hard to decide which one to go at first..its all so yumm..finish off with one of their sumptious rice or noodle bowls.. we tried spicy ramen and the broth was beautifully balanced with right notes of lime n chili..the staff is very attentive and make it a delightful experience..we had Hulji to assist us through selections and he did a fantastic job..must try and will definetly visit again

reviews.author: Saurav Gupta
reviews.description: We had a lovely dinner experience yesterday, to celebrate a family occasion. This is truly a fun place, with comfortable seating and prompt service. There were 5 of us, and we ordered quite a few dishes - pork belly, nv dim sum platter, noodles, fried rice & a simple dry chicken chicken dish, with accompanying coolers. All of the documents she's are recommended....very well prepared dishes with good promotions. Compliments to the chef & staff to make this a joyful outing. The only thing that pinched me was the 10% service charge. Maybe this can be resolved at. But yesterday was celebration time, and I won't let the last bit dampen the spirits

reviews.author: Pushkar Deshpande
reviews.description: One of the premium eat out choices at the Pavilion Mall. Our cocktails, mock tails and soups were all delicious. We ordered the Maki platter and the Dimsum platter and both met our expectations fully. Each type of roll and dimsum had a distinct taste due to the careful selection of ingredients. I am eager to go in again!

reviews.author: Nitin Bhartia
reviews.description:
I would rate 3.5
4 starts for decor and ambience. The decor is very nice, mostly oriental colours but the still quite distinct.
4 starts to service and staff; they are polite and patient.
3.5 starts for food, there’s scope for improvement in starters and dumplings. Main course (spicy ramen bowl and Bangkok bowl of rice) and desserts (would highly recommend the chunky caramel sponge cake) were good. Even the soup and Tom yam papaya salad was good.

pageno_262.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_262.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Anjula Mandal
reviews.description:
Mamagoto has it’s craze in Kolkata, so when it opened it’s branch in pune we were all excited. I have been waiting a long time for this restaurant to open. It definitely did not disappoint me. The best part is their anti buffet concept which is served on weekdays only. It’s more like buffet but not a buffet type spread. There is a set menu and the piping hot food is served on table. I really like the concept because it minimises wastage of food. It’s like a 5 course meal where dimsum and khaosuey is served everyday while altering their menu in starters and main course.
The anti buffet menu looks like this:
1 salad
4 veg/non veg starters
Dimsum
Khaosuey (veg/non veg) - it’s a heavenly meal in itself
4 veg/non veg main course
Rice and noodles
Desserts
All these for Rs 599 only.

Non veg items include chicken, prawns, fish, lamb.


The quality of the food is awesome but the service tends to get a little slow at times.
Many times they will serve quite less quantity of food compared to the people eating. So we need to keep repeating. But that helps in minimising wastage. So i must say that’s a good practice.

Recently they have started serving cocktails and I had red wine sangria and white wine sangria. Both were amazing.

The ambience is very vibrant and colourful too. I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch there.

Kudos to the team.
Will definitely visit again but this time for a la carte....

reviews.author: Amit J. Bhide
reviews.description:
Quality of food is good. However, portions are smaller. Service is not upto the mark. They charge extra service charge which compared to the quality of service was not justified.
One of the item we ordered was not available when we visited.

reviews.author: P Saha
reviews.description: I had been waiting forever to go to this place. This is on the pricey side of things so to say. The place is quite small but very well decorated. Service is on point and fast. You have to try out the non veg dimsum platter. They make some amazing dimsums for sure. The pork belly tacos were so good too if not the best. We also had ebi tempura which was just how a tempura should taste. Coming to main course i had udon stir fried : not a big fan maybe cause the appetizers built my expectation way too high. Yangchow champions fried was definately good and fish in chilli bean sauce was basic. Good portions for main course.

reviews.author: Darshika Singh
reviews.description:
So this is the place we went to have Asian food. The service was pretty good. As it's in the mall so area wise not so big. Staffs are very courteous. Try their Ramen as it's too good. A little pricey which I didn't like about this place but overall good experience. The dumplings and it's price was not worth.
Food-4.5/5
Ambiance-3.5/5
Service-4/5

reviews.author: Kiarah K
reviews.description:
4.7*
Coming here was in my mind from a long time, finally made it a visit here with family.
For Drinks we ordered a passion fruit white wine Sangria, and an apple and cinnamon red wine sangria.
I couldn’t get the taste of passionfruit, so was a little let down, but the apple one was really good.
Coming to the Food:-
KATSU CHICKEN :- (MUST TRY)
The sushi’s are tiny compared to many restaurants, but the katsu chicken is a must try. It’s crunchy and delicious .
Have it with soy sauce+ togarashi.
EBI TEMPURA:-
This was also good
STREET STYLE SPICY CHICKEN DUMPLING:- (MUST HAVE)
Simply Awsome
SPICY PRAWN DUMPLING:-
Good
PRAWN WRAPPED IN BACON:-
Good size of prawn, (that’s imp) It was really good
HONEY CHICKEN:-
This starter I did not like that much.
MAMA’s CALAMARI:- (DO TRY)
Loved the light battered calamari
SHRIMP WITH DRY RED CHILLI:- (DO TRY)
Good quantity of 🍤 and delicious.
COCONUT ICECREAM WITH PALM SUGAR:-
2 scoops of delight 😊

pageno_263.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_263.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Radhika Adakil
reviews.description:
Finally managed to visit this place and i wasn't too happy with the experience. Other than the decor there wasn't anything exciting to have.

I tried the tempura fried prawns which was a big bowl of cut up prawns in tempura batter, there was no other flavour other than "salty" . It was served with what i think was a cheese dip and that didn't really go together for me.

Next i wanted to have the dumplings so i tried the non veg dumpling platter which had 5 varieties 2 each. It was okay again with a generous amount of salt. There was no dip or sauce given with it.

Overall i would say it's an overpriced place which does not deliver in terms of flavour.

reviews.author: Vagisha Sinha
reviews.description:
The interior was really pretty. The service was great. We had the spicy ramen bowl and tom yum soup.I loved both.
Spicy Ramen bowl(veg): It had tofu and vegetables. Its broth had a warm feel. It was not that spicy.

Tom yum soup: It has that lemon grass flavour. Its taste may not appeal to everyone. But once you develop the taste. Its really good.

We were given a complementary sponge cake and it was off the charts. It is a must try!!

reviews.author: Vikram Jayapal
reviews.description:
A really wholesome Asian cuisine experience. Nicely fused flavors, perfect for all palates. Decor is nice, bright, lively yet quite pleasantly calm. Nothing to complain about, a tad expensive though.
Tom Yum soup, Rainbow Chicken dumplings, Asparagus Tempura sushi, Three Pepper Bomb Prawn wok, Mama’s Spicy Chicken Ramen bowl - all amazing.
Definitely would recommend.

reviews.author: Rajesh Kumar Singh
reviews.description:
If you love chinese food, must visit this place. Service staff are very polite, service is quick. Must try dumpling in ur starter. I liked this place.
Food 4/5
Service 4/5
Ambience 3.5/5
Price 3.5/5

reviews.author: Twinkle Patodiya
reviews.description:
Hello People!

Hope your search of good places is going cool😉
So during my last trip to Pune as usual I was hungry for Chinese Food 😅😅 and I was looking for some new options this time. Thanks to zomato I decide to visit this amazing place. MAMAGOTO

Ambiance 3.5/5
it is good, painted wall with different characters is quite creative.
Food - 4
Service - 3.5
Overall value for money: 4/5

They have lost big variety of innovated recipes. Do visit if you like experimenting with new dishes.
Overall it’s a nice place to spend evening😊

pageno_264.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_264.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Gauri Mehta
reviews.description:
First time I ate at Mamagoto was atleast 8-9 yrs ago in Delhi...have been to their restaurant in Mumbai too...and when I saw a banner of it coming up at the Pavilion Mall in Pune, I got really excited. And now it is finally in Pune! Yippee..

The food is awesome... Oriental cuisine/Pan Asian food at its best. The variety is great even for a vegetarian like me.

Visited last week - The dumplings are yumm...we also tried the Laksa and the Penang Curry bowl (both veg) - really good. Helpings are good for 2 people...generous servings. The taste was great - not too spicy, smooth gravies, full of flavours and very satisfying!

Great place...can vouch for its consistency over the years and across the country...nothing has changed! It's the best!

Happy Fooding! 😊

reviews.author: Vishal Kabadi
reviews.description: A nice place quirky ambience .. same chain as Delhi and a good addition to oriental/asian cuisine.. Crispy Lamb and Chicken Gyoza are great to start with.. the chicken satay/spring rolls and rock shrimps tempura were ok.. not gr8 but not so bad either..will visit again to have more stuff on the menu and make a firm opinion.. staff is courteous and yes the caramel sponge cake with Vanilla Ice Cream is mind blowing..

reviews.author: Utkarsha Saxena
reviews.description:
I visited this place recently and found the ambience quite nice and staff quite friendly.I ordered 4 things..
1) Chinese Sour and Pepper soup..which was oki-ish ..not a fan..
2)lemon ice tea..it was nice ..
3)street-style dumplings which were the only dish I liked honestly
4) Spicy Ramen noodle bowl - I have to say this is the worst Asian dish I have ever tried. Dont know what sauces and veggies were used..it was horrible and I felt uneasy for a day after eating it. *Not Recommended*

However I would mention the staff's hospitality earned some brownie points as they were concerned all the time if we liked the food. After I returned the bowl unfinished,they even did not include it in the bill which I was glad about.

Overall it was a good experience (minus Ramen Noodle bowl)

reviews.author: Adhithiya Tavorath
reviews.description: Very professional and polite staff. Ordered Red Thai Lamb with pad Thai which was unbelievable!! Right blend of spices and cooked to perfection and the pad Thai wasn’t too sweet! Definitely recommend this place. Had visited Mamagoto in Mumbai and the one in Pune has live up far beyond my expectations. Even the Chilli guava mock tail pitcher option was worth it!

reviews.author: Fazal Khan
reviews.description:
This place is very well popular its food and it has got some excellent asian food in their menu we enjoyed a lot
Food 5/5
Service was at the top of the world we felt like home server Sunil was excellent he was friendly and very humble thanks Sunil
Service 5/5

pageno_265.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_265.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Chandrahans Dawkare
reviews.description: One of the best Asian restaurant in India the food here is out of the world but truth is suggestion of the server should matter aloot a special thanks to Mr Sunil he his doing a great job he made sure every thing was right on our table. Ask for Sunil when you are dinning at mamagot pune he is excellent. Thanks team for your best hospitality..

reviews.author: Jumana Parkar
reviews.description: A vibrant place with amazing food. Loved the Chicken Ramen the most. The have some amazing sauces and a must try is the red chilli preparation like “thecha” that they serve with the rice flakes! Prices are high but totally worth the taste and ambience. Great staff! A feel good place!

reviews.author: Roshni
reviews.description: Visited this place on a sunday evening with Dyuti Mittal .The ambience and the decot of this place is so hatke and classy at the same time.We were really excited when we entered, reminded us of dining back in mumbai. Staff was extremely courteous ,attentive  and well versed with the menu. We were giving rice crackers as munchies till the food arrived.We ordered the crystal dumplings which were well made.We ordered the sushi platter which was okay..Could be improved on! We ordered the Ramen which was spicy but very wholesome! The drink which was passion fruit one was soo refreshing. Good experience, will come back to try more stuff!

reviews.author: Gaurav Joshi
reviews.description:
There are places with a formal, sophisticated ambiance, and then there are places with a quirky, vibrant ambience. Mamagoto falls under the latter category. This place is fantastically done with a super vibrant Asian theme all over. The interiors, the inner and outer sit-outs compliment the overall decor. Very inviting, very pleasing, and very comfortable.

This is one of the finest restaurants in the city for Asian cuisine. The finely curated dishes tickle your taste buds for sure. This review is based on the Vegetarian spread which we relished upon.

Mr. Sunil, deserves a special mention here. He was the one who served us last evening.

Soups & Starters:
Chinese Sour & Pepper Soup:
Perfectly done soup with juliennes of carrot & cabbage, spring onion, garlic and a tangy sauce. Worth a try.

Hua Hin Highway Rolls:
Crispy rolls cooked with a Galangal Lemongrass, Asparagus, & Cheese filling and served with a tangy dip. Take a bite and feel the flavours explode on your tongue. Lovely preparation.

Spiced Asian BBQ Chicken Breast: 
Grilled chicken breast marinated in a BBQ sauce with Thai Spices & Herbs. My wife had ordered this dish but she didn't like it as the bird breast was under cooked. Flavours and all were Okaish though. 

Mains:
Spicy Bangkok Bowl:
This spicy Jasmine rice cooked with minced vegetables in a Thai Spice & Herb mix 'Conquers' your palette and you are one a ride full of flavours. A must try at Mamagoto. 

Stir Fried Udon Noodles:
Flat noodles cooked in traditional sauce with mixed vegetables. I personally found the noodles to be slippery/soggy. You have to taste it to experience what I mean to say. Either the noodles were over cooked or the sauce was in excess. A nice dish but could have been better. This is a personal experience.

Deserts:
Homemade Coconut & Palm Sugar Ice Cream:
It is a Vanilla ice cream done with desiccated coconut. For those who like the coconut flavour, this is good to try. 

Darjeeling Tea & Coffee:
The way they serve, reminds me of 70's - 90' Hindi movies where the character is sitting in a lawn reading a newspaper and the staff carries a tray with a milk jar, a kettle, a cup & a saucer. Mixes everything and ask "Shakkar Kitni Loge Sahab?" Experience it guys. You shall agree with me. 

They have a superb Crockery for serving dishes. Loved it.

Overall it was a fantastic dining experience at Mamagoto. Surely going to visit again to try out the Non Vegetarian plethora.

reviews.author: Omkar Kadam
reviews.description: I have had a recommendation of this place from couple of friends. Truly appreciating it's worth a try. The actual taste of china in Pune. I have visited china midway this year and the food here actually reminded me the taste. We tried the dumpling platter and soups. Those were perfectly made. The main course was rice and noodles. I should say the Ramen I tried here was even better than that in China.....

pageno_266.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_266.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Nikita Punjabi
reviews.description: Great ambience. Makes you feel like you’re in a restaurant in Japan. The food was delicious. The staff was very hospitable. Should definitely visit to try sensational flavours.

reviews.author: Harsh Punjabi
reviews.description:
