Loved the food at Mamagoto. Proper Asian food with authentic flavours. Sushi is particularly tasty and so are the dumplings. It's a must try from my side.
Also Mr.Kuldeep was very helpful and served us well.

reviews.author: Pooja Shetty
reviews.description:
So what does mamagoto means it literally means "playing with the food" so they not only play with their food but they take it seriously as well they have to serve you the best asian food in town.
And I absolutely love their food.
So it's not a serious place it's fun and vibrant. The decor brings in the vibe pretty strong and the service is pretty attentive and cheerful.
'can't wait to be here again' Saif Shaikh Devika Tavade

reviews.author: Tanya
reviews.description:
Beautifully done up place with super courteous staff!! They really care about their customers! You can begin with tom yum if youre a soup person and try out the tossed grilled fish its beautifull!
The deserts are heavenly specially the mamas homemade chocolate cake!

reviews.author: Nuzhat Mirajkar
reviews.description:
Lovely ambience with delightful interiors and spacious seating arrangement.

Food:
California roll sushi was delicious
Spicy Bangkok bowl with minced chicken and Thai herbs /spices and sticky rice was good
Mocktail pitcher with orange, carrot and lime was perfect

Service was good.

pageno_267.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_267.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: The Hungry Blogger
reviews.description:
After a long time having good Asian food in Pune. The quality & quantity is just wow. Even we can't finish one portion of noodle, the size of main course just jambo.
Only thing is now the don't serve alcohol, but according to management they will serve it very soon. All above very polite and friendly service by BOITHAN . We will come back soon ,,when you guys are serving alcohol.☺️☺️👍👍

reviews.author: Varun Vazhapully
reviews.description:
Beautiful experience.
Situated in a mall. Easy to find and access.
Food was brilliant. The presentation to taste, everything was perfect.
The ambience was like any other mamagoto which is amazing.
The staff was courteous and very helpful.
Do try the pork.
Dumpling platter was decent.
A must try place.

reviews.author: Pranav Kulkarni
reviews.description: Ever since my first visit to Mamagoto a few months ago, this place has been serving some amazing Asian cuisine. On this Independence day, after watching a movie, we headed to Mamagoto for some Soup & Starters. We had Tom yum soup that was as fresh as the ocean. It was so earthy and packed with flavour. After that, we ordered the crispy fried chicken wontons, served on a layer of fried spinach leaves. The chicken stuffing was generous and every bite of the wontons after dipping in the sweetish-spicy sauce gave an explosion of flavours. In my earlier visits, tried Khowsuey, Ramen noodles and other Asian delicacies. Overall, the food is amazing!

reviews.author: Ashish Kulkarni
reviews.description: Not the most authentic food you'll ever have, and therefore not truly representative of South East Asia. But if you want a decent ambience, friendly service and the comfort of dining in a mall, not a bad choice. Not bad, but definitely not great.

reviews.author: Vrunda Bapat
reviews.description: Loved the ambience, it’s very colourful and feels welcoming. We ordered the chicken basil cups to start with followed by Mekong boat curry chicken. Both were delicious. The portion sizes were just right. We washed it down with the lemongrass mojito pitcher. Refreshing. Rounded the meal off with coconut and palm sugar ice cream (I wasn’t very keen on it - but our server suggested we give it try) and was a wonderful end to a very scrumptious meal!

pageno_268.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_268.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Manasi Nikam
reviews.description: The place is decorated very well. The staff was courteous. We ordered the waterchestnut spring roll, chicken dumplings, crispy prawns, lamb bao and grilled fish. Except for the lamb bao, we liked all the starters. The meat in the bao was a little tough and the preparation lacked salt. The Melony mocktail was good but it carried a strong taste of carrot. The guava mocktail is a safer bet though, if you don't mind a little bit of spice. The food is excellent, but overall, I felt it was over priced.

reviews.author: Govind Chef
reviews.description: I had visited this place a long back very nice food suggestion by your staff Mr Sunil he has an excellent knowledge about mamagoto menu. Enjoyed the food and service at mamagoto pune!!!!

reviews.author: Mridul Deepanshu
reviews.description:
One of the best asian restaurant in the town. Personally my favourite along with Shizusan.
Perfect blend of flavours and amazing sushis.
The ambience is really cool and quirky. Overall a very nice place for asian cuisine. 10/10!

reviews.author: Shibani Suryawanshi
reviews.description:
It’s jus such a breezy interior and restaurant.initially we had a bit of a trouble with our server who refused to serve the mocktail with less ice but the mgmt assigned someone else quickly.
Mint lemonade
On the hse crackers(average
Auntys platter non veg(average)
Spring roll veg
Pad thai(big let down was squishy)
Chicken dunpling(yum yum)
Tom kha soup(was gd)
Overall I love the feel of the plc and the smiling servers

reviews.author: Sonali Tribhuvan
reviews.description:
Aahhh... What good food. I have been the one in Mumbai and I loved it. So now that mamagoto is in my city I was so excited to visit this place. Finally made it happen on a Saturday afternoon.
The ambience I was say was stunning I could spend all day n now get bored.
They serve you with complimentary snacks and who doesn't like complimentary food. ☺️
We ordered dumpling non veg platter which was absolutely worth a try as it gave you a taste of every exotic dumplings the place serves.
Beverages: pop rocks lichi was a blend of ice and Lichi syrup which tasted really good.
Peach ice tea great as well. Next time would try more new mocktails here.
In main course we got to order :- fish in Chinese pickle chilli sauce again 5/5
Veg fried rice blended well with the curry. The portions are filling. By the end of our lunch we didn't want to move a bit.

They serve their bills in a really cool wooden boxes.

Keep up the great work and the service is very polite. Would keep visititing.
This place makes your tummy happy.

pageno_269.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_269.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ira
reviews.description:
The food was heavenly. It’s rare to come across a place in Pune that cooks and seasons it’s fish so delectably.
The decor brings in the vibe pretty strong, and the service is very attentive and cheerful.
My only regret is not having tasted everything on the menu. If you’re considering this place, it’s on par with all the others in other cities- and a place I would close my eyes and trust!

reviews.author: Soniya Dharmadhikari
reviews.description:
I wish I would have taken more pictures for this review, because it was one of the most memorable meals I’ve had in a long long time.

1. The spicy chicken dumplings were everything we expected them to be. Every bite was a melt in your mouth, delicate, flavourful experience which was a combination of the texture of the dumplings and the spicy topping which I think was a combination of caramelised onion and chilly. I did wish they would have served it with soy or some other kind of dip, but I honestly didn’t miss it that much.

2. The prawns wrapped in bacon was the highlight of my night. The buttery, salty goodness of the bacon was balanced with the slight sweetness of the sauce. This is the kind of dish you will keep ordering or go back for. One of the best food decisions I have made.

3. The fiery prawns rice with chicken ribbons took longer than expected, but it was worth the wait. I would have liked the chicken strips to be crispier, but flavour-wise it was bang on. The garlic sauce that came with it was an absolute winner.

4. We ordered the Banoffee pie for dessert which didn’t look very attractive, presentation wise. But it was easily one of the best banoffee pies I’ve had in the city. Creamy, not too sweet and a good balance of caramel, banana and cream.

Side note: The staff was extremely courteous and attentive. They didn’t bill us for the dessert since the rice took longer than expected to make it to our table. Mamagoto is easily one of the best places in Pune for oriental food. 10/10 would recommend!

reviews.author: Debolina Chakrabarti
reviews.description: quirky decor with warm vibes. extremely courteous and polite staff. about the food- we opted for buffet. first and foremost they serve all the food on the table. secondly, the quality and tasts of the food is outstanding, just loved it. the spread is also amazing. will definitely visit here again. cheers!

reviews.author: L
reviews.description:
Oh God what food
I think the first line describes
Now the food was good
You are served with Tom yum soup-
And chicken basil mince salad very refreshing salad good 👍👍👍👍

reviews.author: Durba Chakraborty
reviews.description: I went to this place with my gang..... It is beautifully decorated cosy place.. We decided to go with the buffet... The buffet is slightly different from other places.. They have a set menu and they bring you everything you want from that menu in whatever quantity you want... This infact reduces the food wastage.. The chicken corriander soup tasted good , there were four non veg starters including fish wrapped and fried in banana leaf... and four veg starters, along with both veg and non veg dimsums. All of them tasted really good.... For the main course we had shrimps, fish , lamb and chicken. The chicken cooked in Thai sauce was yum.. but the other dishes were not as good as compared to the starters.. The lamb could have been better... It tasted flat.... We had a dish that was a mixture of noodles in a coconut based gravy that tasted good.. The desert consisted of chocolate brownie and a strawberry cake and also chocolate and coconut ice cream which was normal.... Altogether it was a good experience but I feel there are a lot of areas for improvement ...

pageno_270.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_270.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Vishakha M
reviews.description: I visited this place with my friend today. The ambience is very colorful and enjoyable. We ordered Passion fruit and orange drink, Katsu chicken sushi and chicken spicy Ramen bowl. The drink was nice but too much of crushed ice. I loved the sushi. They served 8 pieces of sushi but dont worry as the pieces are small so you will not be full. They serve it with soy sauce. The sushi soy sauce combination tastes very nice. Unfortunately we forgot about the green dallop of wasabi which they served with sushi. The combination would have tasted even better. Next time we will definitely try that. The chicken in ramen was not much enjoyable as it was minced. I don't like much spicy food but because the ramen was medium spicy it tasted better. But I would advice to try some other meal instead of ramen. The staff was courteous. NOTE: if you don't know about wasabi please be careful before having it. Don't eat the entire wasabi dallop nor take a bite into it as wasabi has a very strong taste so you may freak out the first time. The wasabi should be placed very little in quantity on the piece of sushi and then dipped in soy sauce and eaten. But do try it. Also the menu card does not have sushi written anywhere, it was only at the time of order we were informed that the katsu chicken is going to be sushi. So check with them for sushi so that you don't miss it.

reviews.author: Ajay Baheti
reviews.description:
The first thing which catches your eye is the interior of the Mamagoto. It is very classy, lights, best artistically painted walls.

We had :-
1) Hua Hin Highway Rolls :-
Ohhh god what food!!!
Crispy rolls stuffed with deep cheese in it.
I'll recomend this for cheese lovers.

2) Teriyaki Rice :-
Its a Thai food...
Fried sticky rice with vegetable and tossed tofu, it was good but ya you can try it.

Food :- 5/5
Service:- 4.5/5
Ambience :- 5/5

reviews.author: Priya Sridhar
reviews.description: We ordered soup, starters and noodles here and it were decent enough & something different in taste so giving 3.5 stars for it.. Also, the decor is cute & cozy..  However, I must say that you may not find many options for vegetarians

reviews.author: Arnav Kele
reviews.description:
Its a great place where unexplored cuisines are being served! The interiors are fascinating having its own active, happy mood. Although I felt that the lighting could be better!

The food was great! We started with the Non-veg Dumpling Platter and the Wasabi Mary. The mocktail had a unique taste, not too sweet, not too sour, not too spicy, but a bit of everything! The platter had 5 types of dumplings with 2 pieces each. It had lamb, pork, chicken and prawns!
Along with this, we had Fish Fingers with the Black Jam. The fish was soft with a delicate fried lining and the black bean jam was great!

Then we went on to have Stir Fried Udon Noodles and Panang Curry Rice. Overall, the food was amazing although I did felt that the cost is too much for the quantity of food! The service is courteous and experienced!

reviews.author: Harry
reviews.description:
The first thing which catches your eye when you enter this restaurant is the interiors. Classy, quirky, colourful and very artistically painted walls.

We had -
1. Tom yum soup 🍜
Perfect balance of Thai flavours which burst in your mouth. A bit of tangy and a bit of spicy 🌶. It was perfect.

2. Som tam salad
The classic raw papaya salad 🥗, it was little on the sweeter side.

3. Crispy lotus stem
This was a good starter of lotus stem thinly sliced and sautéed with spring onions, garlic and Thai spices. Another amazing dish.

4. Khao suey
A wholesome Burmese dish made of rice noodles and coconut 🥥 gravy . It had the perfect blend of flavours and consistency. Very filling and great taste.

This place situated in the Pavilion Mall stands out from rest of the restaurants due to its courteous staff and aesthetically done interiors.

Taste- 4
Ambience-4.5
Service-4
Value for money-4
Overall experience-4

pageno_271.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_271.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Manish Mohanan
reviews.description: Nice place with interesting wall decorations. Food is okay with traditional oriental food menu. Hosts are bit lost and couldn’t understand our menu choices. Non-vegetarian items are tasty, however veggies are average.

reviews.author: Niharika Sharma
reviews.description:
Interesting dishes in menu. Ambience is quiet good & unique. Food was yummy. Food was very nicely plated. Service was fine. Staff courteous.
Little expensive on pocket.

reviews.author: Aparna Singh
reviews.description: Beautifully done interiors. Loved the place. Food was ok...will definitely visit again for the ambience but not sure about the food though..it didn't had the wow factor.

reviews.author: Anirudha Padalkar
reviews.description:
One of the best places to have authentic Asian food. The ambiance is amazing and the staff always make sure you're doing good and you get exactly the type of food you like.
We had Chinese sour and pepper chicken soup, traditional crispy lamb and mama's spicy ramen bowl (I wish I could also try their dumplings but we were already full😅... Definitely next time 🤗) and everything was as good as it can get.

reviews.author: Sofia Subhani Tamboli
reviews.description:
So what does Mamagoto mean , it literally means “playing with food “ and they not only play with their food but they take it seriously as well that dey have to serve you the best Asian food in town . So it’s not a serious place ,it’s fun and vibrant . They take their Inspiration from Asian street hawkers so they can fuse their favors to suite our taste buds .
So what did I have

1)Kiwi mint cooler - perfect acidity and sweetness
2)Rice cracker - this was something complimentary , just to tickle your stomach before the real deal . Like rice papad but a lil bland .
3)Chinese sour and pepper soup - tasted like manchow soup but their own version of mixed flavor.
4)Tom yum soup - it was a bit spicy but nothing like you can’t handle spicy , it was tangy and jus opens your taste buds .
5)Bbq chicken - chicken served in tower style , it was soft and the flavours were that of the street food that you would have in Bangkok .
5)Won ton chilly chk- chilly chicken with a twist , you could taste the over powering soya sauce however the spice then overruled that Taste .
6)Chk fried rice - by far the most authentic fried rice I have ever had .
7)Pan fried noodles with black bean sauce - the sauce is the key to this dish , not too spicy nor sweet just the natural flavor of the beans make magic .
8) Homemade chocolate cake - now this was the only thing that was disappointing, was it like they got the recipe wrong or the flour in the cake was cooked , something did not look right , we mentioned it to the manger who politely offered us to not pay for the cake , but we chose otherwise .

pageno_272.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_272.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: TheFoodiePai ILA
reviews.description:
Oh God what food !! Yummm ..
I think the first line describes my experience in mamagoto but scroll down to check the details ...
We opted for their lunch buffet option. You are given a menu card and we can choose between veg/non veg. This is not a typical set buffet with counters instead you order what you want from their buffet card and they serve you good portions according to number of people dining and ofcourse you can reorder if you need more, A great concept to decrease food wastage.
Now the food -
You are served with Tom yum soup- a spicy soup with cleanses your palate.
Veg/chicken - dumplings : steaming hot dumplings with the perfect stuffing and very thin shell/covering with perfect sweet sour sauce.
Bean noodle salad- a very refreshing salad , very light to palate.
Chicken satay- perfectly cooked chicken with Satay marinate and sauce.
Chicken basil cup- Chiken mince served in cups. The taste was very different but super yum.
Java grill fish- I guess it was basa fish, the taste was good.
Chicken spring roll- in comparison to all the starters this was the least liked of all.
Stuff mushrooms- couldn't get enough of these. Perfect batter coating and super crispy outside.
Thai crispy veg- very similar to tempura, when dipped with its sweet chilly sauce it tasted yum.
Fried wonton - not very much to my liking, did not like the taste of the stuffing.
Kung pao potato - all time favourite.
After a heavy course of starters we had very less from the main course:
Finally main course:
Know suey- usually the ingredients are separate and we need to mix and eat according to our liking but here they give you premixed in a bowl which was not recommended but the taste was good.
Pan fried greens- ordered this just as a palate cleanser.. perfect flavour of burnt garlic.
Soy chilli lamb- cooked to perfection.
Dessert:
Homemade coconut ice cream - this is the best coconut ice cream I have ever had..
Overall we all were super full, very happy and content with food and service.
The orders were flying through and very smooth service given throughout.
Obviously we couldn't try it all so will definitely visit again soon.
This restaurant has become my most favourite in terms for food, quality , ambience and service.
Highly recommend :)
Keep a good appetite guys.

reviews.author: Monish Koppa
reviews.description:
Bangalore Delhi n now Pune, i go to them if i find them in the city.

Lovely setup, great food and amazing service. These are synonymous with mamgoto in all the cities. And I loved it.

reviews.author: Anuradha Eswaran
reviews.description:
Service time: 25-30 minutes
Service quality: Excellent
What to order: Vegetarian Maki and Momo platter
Ideal time to visit: Brunch time as well as evenings
Best suited for: Very well suited for groups of 2-3 as the quantities are mostly suited for a small group and the food is best enjoyed as an intimate group setting

reviews.author: Ruturaj Bhide
reviews.description: You sort of know that it's going to be a good experience as soon as you enter this place! The place has interestingly Asian ambiance with inviting lemon grass aroma. The menu is particularly has a wide range. Food is absolutely amazing.  We loved everything that we tried here. Will be visiting multiple times for sure!

reviews.author: Amrita Raj
reviews.description:
PRETTY PRETTY PLACE 😍
It is a place which can give you fun asian eating experience on your table. This was my first time trying Asian food and I just loved each and every thing that I had here. Apart from there food, the colorful pretty ambience will surely enhance your experience here. I tried three things.
1. Rainbow Chicken Dumplings : Being in an Asian resto I had to try dumplings and I can say that without any doubt it was the BEST. It was so simple looking but the flavour of the chicken was BOMB. I can have infinite number of these dumplings.
2. Chicken Basil Cups : It is minced chicken served with fresh Basil leaves. You have to fill the chicken inside the basil cup and have it like a taco. I was really impressed with this dish as it was so good.
3. Mama's Spicy Ramen Bowl : Ramen with spicy asian broth with beautifully cooked chicken along with Asian style hard boiled egg. I am literally drooling while writing the description of this dish. You must try this at Mamagoto for sure.
Special Mention : The chicken quality here is so good and the way they are cooked perfectly in all the above mentioned dishes just made my evening. I was in chicken heaven(if that is a thing😋).
P.S. Please book table beforehand as it is way too crowdy on weekends.
Happy eating!!

pageno_273.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_273.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Sudhir Divecha
reviews.description:
Mamagoto

The word literally means ‘fun with food’. Well don’t race those hormonal horses, they just offer culinary experiences for your tastebuds.

The street side spicy momo’s - well dumplings as we were in slightly sophisticate aura, served with some yummy sauces lived up to its name - just costed a bit too much. It was worth the pricing for freshness of ingredients and little attention to details the chef put into it. Perfectly steamed - is not an easy task to achieve.

They offer a range of dumplings and I almost wished they had a platter to taste all!

Shrimp with dry chilly - recommended for seafood lovers. Fresh salt water shrimps cooked in chilly and minimal spices making sure natural yumminess of Shrimps stays with it. Not spicy, just yummy.

The Thai curry was what got most appreciation - I guess the closeness to Indian palette gives it brownie points! But yes surely the perfect mix of spices.

Tossed fish in hot sauce, crispy lotus stem, the menu is diverse, south east and as the name goes - is fun.

Pan Asian culinary fun, experiential, creative, with a casual atmosphere.

Authentic food and drinks are combined with some quirky decor!
The interiors get full marks and are done quiet tastefully, a good lunch option at Pavilion Mall SB road.

Instagram me - Tandoori_delight

reviews.author: Chandrashekhar Khapre
reviews.description: tasty food!

reviews.author: Anant Pandey
reviews.description:
Just one word.. Ahhh-mazinggg!
This place is the right destination for Asian cuisine lovers. You will find authentic Asian delicacies that will leave you drooling. (Yes, the food is delicious)

I loved the ambience, specially the wall paintings (you have so many of'em 😍) which make the place look bright and live.

It's a place worth trying. 🙂

reviews.author: Deepak Salwan
reviews.description:
Great #buffet on the table at #Mamagoto
#Crackers Fantastic Hot Spicy #Sambal Sauce #VegClearSoup #GreenBeanSalad
#VegDumplings #CheesyWonton
#FriedCorn #KungPaoPotatoes
#TossedBeanswithGarlic
#LemonGrassNoodles
#ChocolateIcecream i chose. Other was coconut ice cream.

Fantastic decor, some pics here of the interiors at the restaurnt and the yummy food. The only thing I did not fancy much was the Green Bean Salad. Rest was all fantastic. Specially the Dumplings, Cheesy Wonton and the perfect Sambal Sauce. In the main course, loved the Kung Pao Potatoes!

reviews.author: Apurva Bharatia
reviews.description: First of all the ambiance is really nice! I liked it a lot because I like chirpy places! The street style spicy dumplings were really great! Pad thai noodles were really good too! Portion sizes are just right. Staff was really friendly. Pleasant experience!

pageno_274.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_274.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ashish Peshave
reviews.description: As the name suggests, we had a ‘fun’ asian dining experience. Mamagoto came across as a fantastic asian bistro that served authentic flavours in a modernly designed menu. We wanted a light meal and hence stuck to healthy choices of soup, appetizers and mains. Everything served was superb and the ingredients were fresh. Coming soon again to explore more

reviews.author: Tasneem
reviews.description:
I was thinking of trying out some new place in The Pavillion mall... Mamagoto immediately caught my eyes coz of it's different decor. It had an x-factor that tempted me to try this place. Had a great time overall right from quirky ambience, authentic Asian cuisine, music could have been better...staff was friendly and courteous...food presentation was pretty good...we ordered
Lemongrass iced tea - very refreshing
Street style chicken dumplings - delicious, juicy, filling
Mamagoto Goreng - a good portion of sticky rice, chicken satay with peanut sauce and fried egg. A perfect meal with a variety of taste.
Will certainly visit them soon for their renewed menu of dumplings and also coconut and palm jaggery ice cream.
Service - 5/5
Taste - 5/5
Presentation - 4.5/5
A must visit places in Pune for all food lovers.

reviews.author: Nikita Deshpande
reviews.description: Loved the lunch experience here last week. We ordered Crispy wonton with chilli tofu which was sautéed tofu with jalapeños served on a crisp wonton wafer which was great! Along with that, we ordered chicken basil cups which was minced chicken served with lettuce leaves. The chicken was to be put in those leaves, folded and eaten which was interesting. For mains, we ordered stir fried veggies with burnt garlic and Hakka noodles. The quantity of the mains was much better than the small plates. The noodles were PERFECT. Really enjoyed them! Service was a little slow but the ambience and the taste made up for it. Good time, overall!

reviews.author: Tanmaya Pisal Savant
reviews.description: Loved it!! Comparable to malaka spice and shizusan. Lovely hospitality and service. A must visit for Asian food lovers. The ambience in particular is very classy and makes mamagoto unique.

reviews.author: Niranjan Rode
reviews.description:
Nice place for Asian and continental cuisine. Lives upto the hype and the food tastes good...!!! The ambiance is fine, staff is courteous and the place is well maintained. Only disappointment was that quiet a few items from the buffet menu were out of stock. We were not even ae to taste these items. If your charging full price then please ensure that you have sufficient quantity of the items. This is just miss management...!!!

However, since the food wahtever we had was good, we Might visit here again pretty soon...!! :)

pageno_275.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_275.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Modhura Roy
reviews.description: Our visit to Mamagoto wasn't planned, we had planned to visit the newly opened Dhaba but due to a long waiting time, we ended up going to Mamagoto. There are two sections to the restaurant, the front section which opens up to the mall and the converted interior section which is like a separate room. We were seated outside suck has interesting portraits hung up around, but the inside section has a very interesting ceiling, which is made up of layered framed paintings hanging off the top! Everything is very colourful and pleasing to the eye. We ordered the Rock Shrimp tempura, Bangkok rice bowl and the Spicy Ramen bowl. The helping of shrimp in the starter was very generous and was good for the three of us. The rice bowls and the ramen was also large in quantity, very filling and good to taste. Was hairy and satisfied with my meal. Really wanted to try the dumplings, but heard that they were small, and not worth the price. Loved the shrimps the most! Needless to say it was a good visit, and I will go again when I can!

reviews.author: Priyanka Mangale
reviews.description:
Value for money place. Fatte food I have ever tasted.. these guys are doing justice to the asian food. The place for asian food lovers. A must visit.

And the most important is that the staff is super courteous.

Be fabulous always!!

reviews.author: Shraddha Dhawade
reviews.description:
One of the best place to eat pan Asian cuisine in Pune. The food taste and quality is upto the mark. Must try Veg Basil Cups, Pad Thai noodles, Aspire tempura, London‘s China town with fried rice 🍚.
You can skip desserts! 😆

reviews.author: Shalaka Ranade
reviews.description:
Mama goto is good pick for the asian food lovers. Expensive though giving a Variety in cuisine.
Good theme of the restaurant makes it immediately stand out from the others. We loved all the starters.
Khowsey was a bit on a sweeter note. Dumplings could have been a little better.
Pak choi dumplings very good. Chicken on lettuce leaf was the standout.
A Korean dish of nice and veggies was extremely good, sorry cant recollect the name.

Service was perfect.
Quite a good place to visit but not that often asnit pinches your pocket a bit.

reviews.author: Yogesh
reviews.description: We had a very good experience at Mamagoto Pune I have visited Mamagoto for the first time enjoyed a lot, good food and excellent service. I would surely visit this place again. Thanks team Mamagoto

pageno_276.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_276.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Anuja Parelkar
reviews.description:
Was excited about my visit to the first Mamagoto of Pune being a fan of the food from Bombay. Love the Thai chicken and water chestnut salad.

Walked into the restaurant which looks too overtly done, absolutely jazzy and OTT. However it's the food that I was there for. As usual food was good. Absolutely rekindled my Bombay memories. Looking forward to the lunch buffets now.

Service is tad bit slow but good nevertheless

reviews.author: Sandesh Dhoble
reviews.description:
The national flower of India lotus was always beautiful but taste’s excellent , I realised when I actually ate it .Crispy lotus stem ( vegetarian) is a must try for carnivores and herbivores. The tofu ( London China town was outstanding with ginger sauce ) even better was the tofu in Thai chilli basil sauce .
The Hakka noodles were very attractive and were cooked to perfection . The chicken fried rice was a disappointment because it was full of eggs eggs and more eggs had to literally dig out the chicken .
Guys if you love oriental food Mamamgota is the place you should visit more often .

reviews.author: Amruta
reviews.description: Love it! Cute ambiance, great service and delicious food ! Glad that Mamagoto started in Pune as I’ve been searching for a good Pan- Asian restaurant for a very long time ! Also, Tom Yum soup is a must try!

reviews.author: Dr. Rama Moondra
reviews.description:
I have always liked Mamagoto Mumbai..so it was an easy choice. Swanky outlet at The Pavilion here. Food and service both are really good. We ordered crispy lotus stem. One of the best I have eaten. Good part of it is they are not drizzled with honey but instead served with honey laced soy. Tom yum soup was perfect for the rainy evening. Though I would have preferred less kafir lime leaves. Sticky fried rice and tofu in chilli paste were our main course.
If these all were rocking, why 3 stars? Well, my opinion, steward should be trained to talk about food. If we said, we don't want Thai then suggestion was Thai curry. " I don't want Thai.". Sure, how about yellow Thai curry?. We gave up on steward that minute.

Desserts had absolutely no attraction. Pretty run of the mill. Didn't bother.

reviews.author: Vibha Kunzru Atal
reviews.description: Maybe we ordered wrong but the maki platter and the Momo platter let us down a bit. The sushi was dry and too plain. No accompanying sauce...only wasabi and soy. No bowl to mix it. The pok choy dumpling was the best of the lot..followed by the prawn dumpling. The lamb dumpling was just too overwhelmingly meaty!! Next time we shall stick to the tradition bowl meals...

pageno_277.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_277.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Tee
reviews.description:
The decor is pretty cool, with fancy art work all over the walls and ceiling. The food is good. However, the Sushi was average.
The service is quick and the staff is friendly and warm.
Try the sticky rice and stir vegetables in garlic sauce.

reviews.author: Vipul Goel
reviews.description:
We went to Mamagoto on a Saturday. After a quick check in we were happy to be seated as it gives a good feel of any urban Thai or Vietnamese eatery.
We ordered a Chinese sour & pepper soup & The Laksa Tribute. The soup came after a bit of wait but the start was good. However the mains were not up to expectation. We asked the waiter about the dish who told us it is a mains including noodles with thick sauces & texture. When the dish came it was a soup that too not as what was detailed in the menu 'almost no lemongrass & galangal' in it & missing those essential Asian ingredients we came for.
At end after paying by card, manager gave is some other table's bill & cash which we returned. I guess they wanted to give our money back for the bad mains. :(

reviews.author: Mithilesh Nichkaode
reviews.description:
🛵Go to this place for - Unique spread of Asian Food.
👨🏽‍🍳 Must try - Cheese and Truffle Oil Dumplings, Stir Fried Udon Noodles
❗️Read through the review for a trivia❗️

Ambience is cozy inside and buzzing outside. I prefer the inside to get some time away from the bustle of the mall.

Food is very tasty and they have some healthy options for the health conscious folks. Cheese and Truffle Oil Dumplings are stuffed with cheese and coconut filling. Truly OUT OF THE WORLD!! Crispy wonton with Chilly Tofu is the asian version of Chilli Paneer. Stir Fried Udon Noodles are wheat noodles with lots of veggies...almost melt in the mouth!! Trivia: They serve complimentary rice crisps. The red chutney with it is truly amazing!!

Service was courteous. The staff knew the menu well and came up with good recommendations.

reviews.author: Jigar Shah
reviews.description: Ok food, good service. Only annoying bit, they moved me in middle of my lunch to accommodate a larger party, shows poor planning. Overall neat concept but taste is not authentic nor is it fusion food. A khichdi that doesn't serve the purpose.

reviews.author: A T
reviews.description:
I was super happy to hear that mamagoto was finally opening in Pune ! I have been a fan of the place and have had very appetising memories from Delhi and Bombay outlets (especially the brunches)

This place is located in excellent location! At pavilion mall, very easy to locate and has a very authentic ambience. Asian! Although I wish it had opened in koregaon park /kalyani nagar.. but I won’t mind driving down for the food to be honest.

I ll start with the best, prawns wrapped in bacon! I must say this was indeed my fav dish of them all. (See pic) it’s just as delicious as it looks! The portion may not do justice to ur appetite so make sure u r ordering more than just that. They have very limited options for sushi yet I tried them all and I was pleasantly surprised. These were some seriously delicious rolls, Ebi maki, California roll and asparagus roll, all three brilliantly prepared and presented. I also had the spicy dumplings, and it lived up to my expectations. It was served hot, steamy and definitely spicy!

I am not wholly content with the option for beverages, service is pretty decent, could be better! But it’s certainly a great place to visit! If u plan to go shopping and want to grab a quick lunch .. this place is ur destination!

pageno_278.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_278.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Aanchal Aggarwal
reviews.description: We dropped by for the Dimsum lunch in May! The lunch spread was delicious and quality was good too! However the service was extremely slow and poor which made us cut short our lunch and leave soon.

reviews.author: Neeraj
reviews.description:
*Negative Review Alert*

We were about 10 of us for dinner here. The table was Pre reserved and was kept ready for us.
The ambience and service is good.
However, the food was really not up to the mark and most of us had a very bad tummy the next day.
Id suggest to give this place a skip!

reviews.author: Sarika
reviews.description:
I went into this place with some expectations as I had heard only great stuff about it. The interiors were very cool with posters from South East Asia that had me very curious and added to the overall experience.

The food lived up to the mark. The small plates were supremely delicious. The goat cheese and truffle oil dumplings were incredible and very unique in taste. The prawn and celery dumplings were just as yummy and so was the honey chicken. The drinks served were refreshing. The one dish that stood out was the fried lotus stem. It was WAY TOO YUMMY!

We thought we were served raw chicken in the rice dish, but the waiter assured us it was well done. Not sure if he was right, but the cooked pieces we ate seemed tasty. That’s the only reason why my rating went down one star. And the potatoes could have been better; they were just frozen fries.

Overall, however, this modern Asian fusion restaurant is funky, fancy and the food is packed with flavour. Not sure if I’ll visit again, but I know for sure that there are tons of dishes to try if I were to step back in.

reviews.author: Tanmay Sinha
reviews.description:
Food was so good and filling. The best part about big bowl for hungry soul was that it kinda felt healthy as well. Good one.
Would love to go back. Four stars because they didn’t serve alcohol yet. But a lovely place.

reviews.author: Sameer Joshi
reviews.description:
Perfect taste and a must visit..We ordered Thai puchka, old gyoza dumplings and sticky rice with pork belly

A must visit and will surely come back soon

pageno_279.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_279.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Mansi Mehta
reviews.description:
I visited this place yesterday. It's quirky, oriental and truly asian ambience almost immediately grabs your attention while walking in the mall. While the outside seating area gives a little sophisticated feel, the interiors give you a true feel of being in an authentic joint typically cramped with art in some busy streets of Japan or China.

The food is amazing! I have never tried some many options of sauces in oriental cuisine. Each dish had an authentic sauce to go with it. We tried #TomYumSoup which was great. The #HuaHinHighwayRolls was an experimental try and they are great! A rare combination of asparagus and other vegetables rolled in cheese served with garlic sauce. Do give it a try. The portion size is great, good enough for two. We also tried the #VegFriedRice and #MixedVegetablesInBlackBeanSauce. All the servings were a happy delight for us.

Food: Great
Ambience: Very good
Service: Great

reviews.author: Gautam Shetty
reviews.description: Located in the Uber uber Pavillion Mall, Mamagoto is one of the premier South Asian inspired restaurants in this part of town. One step inside and the decor screams of quirky Oriental themes which provide silly entertainment if you're in thereby yourself. Coming to the food, to get an array of items without breaking the bank we tried the multitudes of Platters available which was a wise choice. The Maki's platter as well as the Aunty's platter offered a great selection of appetizers out of which the Chicken Spring Rolls, Chicken Gyoza and the Chicken Satay are all worth the money spent. The Maki platter which had an array of Sushi was also outstanding with the Prawn Sushi being the highlight. Another recommendation would be the Crispy Lotus Stem which is prepared with a Tempura batter and tastes divine. Overall the service is a little slow albeit they were catering to a large crowd in the afternoon. Pricing is premium which is expected of the location and the food offered but it's definitely a nice place to be...

reviews.author: Isha Renavikar
reviews.description:
I had heard a lot about mamagoto from my friends and it was on my list to visit this place.
This place has some great Asian food.

We ordered street style spicy dumplings, crispy lotus stem and Thai crispy vegetables , out of which I loved the lotus stems!
They were served with a honey chilli sauce and were very delicious.

For drinks we ordered iced tea and mint lemonade.
They gave us a mint lemonade complimentary, yay .
Mint lemonade was different than what you get usually , and I loved it.

For main course we had chicken spicy ramen bowl and mamagoto's chicken broth for the hungry soul.
Spicy chicken ramen bowl was very flavorful and it had the right amount of spices.
It had chicken, veggies, egg and noodles with spicy ramen curry,just perfect for this rainy season to soothe your soul.

For deserts we ordered Mama's home-made chocolate cake and omg, it was heavenly.
And guess what they gave us one more chocolate cake complimentary, double yayyyy !! :)

I loved this place and if you're planning to experiment and experience asian cuisine, then you should right away visit this place.

reviews.author: The Finicky Eater
reviews.description: Visited this restaurant for a late lunch ,had the dimsum platter non veg , which was extremely satisfying,plump and well made , nice dipping sauces too , the cheese rolls were nice , the one dish that stood out was the Chiang Mai Khao soi,lovely flavor and nice crisp veggies in a coconut broth with noodles and toppings , for dessert we e got the toffee sponge cake , the service was good , this place is slightly higher on the pricing but the portions are generous and quality outstanding! Definitely would like to visit again

reviews.author: Neha Joshi
reviews.description:
The first thing you notice when you walk into Mamagoto is the fantastic ambience, absolutely gorgeous! Our spirits were lifted right up just by the feel of the restaurant.

A well courteous and friendly staff greeted us and we placed our order for some mocktails, which were soooo refreshing and delicious! Cheese and truffle oil dumplings were a novelty for us, but we got used to the taste and actually enjoyed the dumplings. Lastly, the caramel sponge cake was even better than we thought it would be. Such warmth in every bite, a must try!

If you are in the vicinity and enjoy pan-asian food then do give this place a try! You will love it!

pageno_280.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_280.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Prashant Patil
reviews.description:
Best Food .... authentic, tasty food.
Must try:
Smoky chicken tacos
Chicken cups
Spicy street style dumplings.

Ambience and service is 10/10

reviews.author: Hari Nair
reviews.description: Good food. The prawns wrapped in bacon was exceptionally good, perhaps their signature dish. Khow suey did not live up to expextations. No alcohol served, understand their license is being processed.

reviews.author: Samuel Chase
reviews.description:
Ever since we realised that Mamagoto was soon to arrive in Pune we were excited as we had a wonderful meal in Mamagoto, Bandra. It wasn't long after, that the social media personae of cool kids in Pune started broadcasting pictures of good times being had in Mamagoto, that we felt the immediate need to make the trip.

The interiors were quirky with prints from Asian culture. An entire section of wall had a lot of lucky cats, which I felt to be a bit excessive, but that's not the point of this review.

Our server greeted us and introduced himself, which added a refined, personal touch to the experience. I had the same experience in the other Mamagoto as well, so it must be common protocol.

We ordered the Sushi Platter, which is an assortment of twelve sushi pieces served with a small ball of wasabi, horseradish and soy sauce. The sushi was good. There was a sushi which was covered in fish eggs. Having never tasted fish eggs in sushi before, it is like little tiny balls of liquid, about the size of mustard seeds that burst in your mouth. (The sushi is comparable in quality to what Shizusan offers.)

As they didn't have any cold coffee items on the menu, I decided to have a lemongrass iced tea which was thankfully made by someone who knows that an iced tea does not have to be as sweet as milkshake or "fruit juice".

The Mamagoto Goreng was served with two chicken satay sticks and a wonderful peanut sauce that we just had to get an extra serving of. The rice was dark in colour and had a nice texture.

Mamagoto presents itself well and can certainly compete with the household names of Asian dining in Pune. I look forward to to my next visit here.

reviews.author: Nisha K. Madhyani
reviews.description: Ordered 2 fish dishes and they both were awesome. Hope they get their liquor license soon. The interior is interesting esp the false ceiling.

reviews.author: Vivek Debnath
reviews.description: This place is on a pricey side, hence should you visit do order fiery thai shrimp fried rice with green chilli chicken ribbons, good for two person. In case you wonder what it is, it has prawn chips, chicken slices, and prawns. Really something different and yummy. We had litchi pop and lemon with mint in beverages which were nice too. The service is nice, ambience is good for which you a pay little more.

pageno_281.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_281.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Anuja Rananaware
reviews.description:
This place has a very vibrant ambience. The menu is adequately precise for a good meal. The food is extremely yummy. I loved the dumpling platter which had 10 dumplings in 5 varieties , especially the prawn dumplings were amazing ! They do not serve alcohol yet, but the mocktails we ordered were good as well. The plating and overall presentation is appealing. The portion size is pretty filling as well.
Service isn't the fastest, but given the taste it is something I won't complain about. The staff is helpful and attentive, maybe because they are new in town right now.
I would suggest adding more options in dessert.
I'm definitely going to visit the place again to trying more things from the menu, excited about their sushi !

reviews.author: Priyanka Vitekar
reviews.description: Drooolicious is all i can say about Mamagoto Pune... Mamagoto is one of my favorite restaurant in Bangalore... Was a bit skeptical about the Pune one...but it turned out to be amaazing! The food was to die for but apart from that the service was mind blowing.... Thanks to the manager who quickly responded to our request! Highly recommended restaurant :)

reviews.author: Vinayak Katamble
reviews.description: Food was meh. Average. Delivery took twice as long as Zomato said!

reviews.author: Sarandha Kumar
reviews.description: The ambience is great.I liked the dumplings, they have interesting flavours available.Do also try cheese taco that was my favorite of the lot ordered.Service was pretty impressive and fast.

reviews.author: Pooja Patil
reviews.description: This was one of our favourite restaurant in Bangalore!! And so have to visit place in Pune!! As always the food was awesome ! Everything we ordered, we enjoyed the flavour, quality and quantity!! Ambiance is quirky with Chinese paintings and decors! Momos are a cut above the rest , looking forward to more and more visits to this amazing place !

pageno_282.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_282.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Maya Michelle
reviews.description:
The decor attracts you in a special way-- it's very kitsch with quirky walls and an even quirkier ceiling. Service staff is prompt and this eatery usually sees a fair amount of the Pavillion mall shopping crowd.
If at all you're kept waiting, you can take to counting the golden cats on one wall. They're a sight to behold and by far the most thought provoking side of the restaurant.
You will not be disappointed by the food or the drinks, they're all exotic.
Chicken basil cups are great food for thought, there's prawn wrapped in bacon for the pork lovers, dumplings with assorted sauces are true to form as are the platters. Of course, with fat Mama looking down at you, you need to wipe that plate very clean. But it's not a tough job at all.
Visit on an empty stomach!!

The flipside to a place like this is it's difficult to become a regular coz you need to be in a shopping frame of mind to visit. I'm sceptical of people coming here JUST to dine in. It will always be part of a shopping spree. And this cuisine has sooo much competition now.

reviews.author: Tina Ahluwalia
reviews.description:
Being a Delhihite, I have been wanting to visit this place since it has quite a few branches in Delhi NCR. But somehow never got the chance. So when I came to know that it has opened up in Pavilion mall, I had to pay a visit. Convinced my husband to drive the distance for a wonderful meal and some shopping.
So we asked for a seating inside but there was waiting as it was a weekend. After about half an hour, we got a table and ordered quickly as we both were very hungry. So we ordered a grilled fish with South East Asian dressing and smoky BBQ pork belly bowl. The service was slow and food took a long time to come. Was not too happy with the starter as it had only small 3 slices. And it was not grilled. It was more like steamed. I wish the restaurant gave an option of fish other than basa. Not a big fan of this fish. I know it comes cheap that's why I guess it's the first choice for most of the restaurant these days. Anyways, the pork belly bowl was a cracker of a dish. Loved the amazing flavor of the meat, rice and the veggies. That's what I call comfort food. Only wish it had 4 sticks of the belly. The food here is definitely priced on the higher side but then the flavors are also unique. They can improve on the portion size though.
We loved the quirky and the vibrant ambience. The restaurant manager did come and check with us on the food and apologized for the slow service. He has promised us a free dessert on our next visit so definitely going back for that :-)

reviews.author: Imroz Adeeb Naqvi
reviews.description: My favourite pan-asian restaurant from Delhi, Mamagoto, is finally in Pune. I was lucky enough to be invited for a tasting and I had an awesome time. The swanky interiors are a fusion between neoclassical and funk designs. The same goes for the furniture. It’s a great blend between a restaurant and lounge and captures the essence of both. I loved the vibe and overall the place looks absolutely smashing. I am sure the good people of Pune will love it!

reviews.author: Meet_the_foodie
reviews.description:
This place is done up tastefully with a lot of elements in an around. Loved the vibes here..! The seating was cozy!
They have different seating sections and we were given a table of two (benches).
Coming to Food, we have a soup, a dimsum and Pad Thai noodles for the mains.
The soup was a regular affair but the dim sums were perfect. Thin outer layer, cooked to perfection. The flavour were just right! However the noodles was a disappointment. I def have had much better Pad Thai.
The server was always around for help and served us with a smile. Only thing disappointed us was that soup took a long time and we were served dim sums first. And even before we could finish both our dishes, noodles were brought to the table. Other than that it was a good experience!

reviews.author: Sayali Ashtekar
reviews.description:
Frankly.... I am a bit disappointed I went with an expectation of what I ate in Mumbai. We ordered Thai puchkas; truffle oil and street spicy and sweet dim sums; banana wrapped fish; Shezwan and brunt garlic rice; and veg sushi platter.
Food- 3/5
Ambience- 4/5
This place is not what I have been to other mamagotos so far. Need some improvement in service and taste.

pageno_283.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_283.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Arunabh Awasthi
reviews.description:
I went to this place with lots of expectations but found my overall experience to be less than amazing.

Today, me and my friend visited this place and ordered 2 noodle bowls: Chiang mai train station noodles and laksa tribute.

The overall taste was decent and presentation was catchy. What spoiled it for us is that meat portions were paltry. 4-5 small chunks of chicken, 2-3 tofu cuts, very tiny broccoli here and there and noodles equivalent to what you get in 5 Rs maggi packet. Rest all bowl was filled with curry which wasn’t very filling. All this was WORTH RS 600 EACH. EXCLUDING TAXES.

Cummon guys, are you kidding me !! This amount of money can fetch someone more than decent unlimited buffet on any given day at pretty decent places. And moreover, the taste or quality of food is not something that is in any way better than most oriental cuisine serving restaurants.

Long story short, make your place and food worth the money you charge.

reviews.author: Manasi N
reviews.description: Amazing place awesome ambience...lovely pan asian menu and flavours are as authentic as one can get...we ordered tom yum soup, a veg and nonveg dimsum platter and coconut and cane sugar icecream...the dimsums were truly flavourful and each with a difference...and the icecream was really creative and tasted lovely..good food and experience overall...must visit for authentic taste and flavors..

reviews.author: June Biswas
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is a Delhi based Pan Asian chain which pioneered Asian experiential restaurants in the country. After expanding to six cities and sixteen locations, they have finally opened in Pune at the Pavilion mall. Mamagoto is a fusion Pan Asian café with a relaxed and casual atmosphere where affordable Asian cuisine & drinks combine with quirky décor. And if you're wondering what Mamagoto means, it translates " to play with food".

Mamagoto's food is a blend of inspiration from Asian street hawkers, the founder's extensive travels and endless experimentation in their secret kitchens. Thus, you can expect a lot of fusion dishes which are inspired by Asian cuisine.  

I had dined at one of their Delhi outlets a few years ago and was delighted that they are finally open in Pune. I paid them a visit recently with my mom and the moment I entered, the funky, colorful and quirky decor instantly caught my eye!  

The restaurant has a wide array of dishes like soups, appetizers, dumplings, sushi, rice and noodle bowls, woks, main courses and desserts leaving you spoilt for choice!  

 I've been put off by Chicken for a while so my entire meal consisted of prawns and lamb.

I started my meal with Crispy lamb (not pictured) which is consisted to crunchy lamb bits tossed with bell peppers, spring onions and Chinese spices. This is a good dish to munch on if you love Indian Chinese food! I sure do!

I also had the shrimp with dry red chilli which again is tossed with Chinese flavors and burnt garlic. This consisted of flavorful fried prawns with just the right amount of batter! Don't miss this! Their portions are pretty big and two starters itself were making me and my mom feel pretty full so keep that in mind while ordering.  

Moving on to the main course, I ordered A Thai Lost in Hunan which consists of  spicy Thai lamb with red curry flavor served on pad Thai noodles. If you love Thai food, you MUST try this! It was bursting with flavors and had a delicious twang of lemongrass and red curry and I absolutely loved it!  

I also tried the Three Pepper bomb prawns which was made of wok tossed prawns with green, white and schezwan peppercorns mixed with Chinese wine and sesame. This dish wasn't very spicy or peppery but was flavorful nevertheless and was very different from conventional oriental dishes they normally serve in restaurants here.

Being avid Chinese lovers, we also tried the Pan fried noodles in Cantonese and this dish gets a 10/10 for tasting as authentic as it gets. We totally loved it.

Though I usually skip dessert, for a change I was in the mood and decided to try their Banoffee pie which was a decadent dessert pie made from bananas, cream and caramel. This was just the perfect amount of sweet ( I can't deal with too much sugar as I don't have much of a sweet tooth) and the perfect way to end our meal.

The service is fast and the restaurant manager Mr Amal did a wonderful job with his hospitality. I really enjoyed dining at Mamagoto Pune and totally recommend this place if you love South East Asian food!

reviews.author: Hanan Malik
reviews.description:
Being from Delhi , this was one of favorite places to eat and I couldn’t be happier that it’s now in pune.

It was quite a drive from Koregaon Park to SB Road but it was worth it !!
Let’s start with the ambience, I was transported to a serene, vibrant and lively street of of Hongkong or China. The staff was extremely courteous and ever so smiling which just adds on to the whole experience .

We ordered a array of food ( not that I am complaining) starting with the Tom yum soup which had just the right amount of heat to get this dinner started , Thai chicken and water chestnut salad which was all so fresh and yum, crispy lotus stem with the most amazing sweet and tangy sauce, chicken basil cups and crispy wonton with chili chicken which I must add is one of the best I have eaten in pune.
All this was followed by the most scrumptious, HEART WARMING bowl of Khow suey so beautifully called CHING MAI TRAIN STATION NOODLES, it was yummy, filling and just plain TASTY !!
This was the adult’s verdict but I have to add what my 2 year old daughter thought of the the ever humble Hakka noodle and chicken dim sums “mumma it’s so nummy, can we come again tomorrow”
Overall an excellent evening well spent !!

reviews.author: Niharika J
reviews.description:
We chose the unlimited dimsum meal.

The choice and variety was amazing. We started off with soup. The Tom yum soup was delicious, flavourful and not that spicy as we requested.

In starters we had the prawn toast and spring rolls. Prawn toast was decent but spring roll was delicious as the covering was thin and crispy and well paired with the sweet chili sauce.

The dimsums were the stars. The lamb roll, chicken dumplings and choice of veg dumplings were the favourites.

The service was great. Servers were very friendly and helpful.

Would definitely visit again and recommend to friends and family.

pageno_284.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_284.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Ishwari Bhide
reviews.description:
Awesome place, awesome ambience, good food and great service.
I would recommend this place for getting varied menu and asian taste.
The ambience is lovely, the service is fast and food delicious. I will rate it 4 on 5
The mango chutney which they serve is awesome.

reviews.author: Karishma Poonekar
reviews.description:
This place is an absolute delight to the eye (for those who love street art and oriental art). I was in awe from the moment I saw the entrance till I bid adieu! 

I felt like i was in mini Asia when I entered the place. The captain is completely fun, and knows how to make you trip on your taste buds. His recommendations were lovely and to the point.

My personal favorites were:
Maki Platter - For all sushi non-lovers, you will fall in love!
Prawn and celery dumplings - An absolute amalgamation of flavors!
Laksa Tribute - An absolute Thai experience!

The fried rice, prawns wrapped in bacon, the pork belly, fiery shrimp fried rice, fish in black bean sauce, veg basil cups will surely give you a pan-asian experience.

reviews.author: Piyush Bhalgat
reviews.description: Horrible Deliver time! But Brilliant Good!

reviews.author: Isha Varma
reviews.description:
Still can’t over my ravishing dinner sesh at Mamagoto, Pune.

The ambiance is vibrant and inspired by Manga.
The best part about this place is how they keep surprising your taste-buds with every course! Their cuisine revolves around experimental-oriental street-food! Their desserts are a marvellous show-stopper!

Honestly, I haven’t been much of a sushi person but this is the first restaurant where I tried and enjoyed it to bits! We ordered for a Maki’s platter which covered all their entire sushi collection. If I must pick one, their California roll is a must-gorge!

For starters:-

I really enjoyed their ‘Prawn wrapped in bacon’ which is incredibly juicy, sweet and smoky!
Their prawns and celery dumplings are irresistibly creamy!
I tried ‘Veg basil cups’ served with sambal sauce for the first time and absolutely loved it!

For main course:-
The Laksa Tribute is one hell of a mind-blower if you’re looking for a noodle bowl.
For rice bowl, ‘Fiery Thai Shrimp fried rice with Asian green chilli chicken ribbons’ is one dish for which you will visit this place again! The chicken is so crunchy and gels lusciously with the shrimp rice, you would wish you had a bigger tummy! (I sure as hell did)

For dessert :-
Home-made sponge cake and Banoffee pie (eggless) are mouth-wateringly sensational!

Summing it up, if you still haven’t, you really gotta Mamagoto! 🐼

reviews.author: Satish Upganlawar
reviews.description: Good ambience, good food . Appreciate if they can have live station. If they can improve on presentation, also provide info on food and preparation.

pageno_285.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_285.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Meghana Paranjape
reviews.description:
Staff is very welcoming. Interior/ambience is very thoughtful as well as it gives the glimpse of the Asian atmosphere.Food is simply delicious and flavourful.My love for dumplings has increased even more.Had great time and worth the money spent. The quantity of bowl is good for 3 people.
At one point of time I kept staring at the kittens placed would like to know if it resembles anything.

reviews.author: Gauri Upganlawar
reviews.description:
I'm a big big fan of asian food so very surprised I had missed reviewing this restaurant until now. The last visit was different from the usual experience so here goes. We started of with our mocktails which were good and refreshing after a tiring day at work.

I really loved this place because I'm not a sushi person( I just don't like it) but last night I had assorted Maki platter and I loved it like anything (I actually had six of them out of 12 and it's a very big thing for me) . Thanks To Mamagoto for serving such great Maki that I loved it so much.

So we started of with prawns wrapped in bacon (I loved everything about this), cheese and truffle oil dumplings and vegetable basil cups (small lettuce cups filled with veggies, soya and mushroom.This was little spicy for me). My favorite was prawns wrapped in bacon , Oh that taste,aroma and bacon it's a bliss.

Maincourse:

Oh this was lot for 6 of us but it was aa-mazz-ing! We had Assorted maki platter( Katsu Chicken, Ebi tempura,California roll), Smoky BBq pork belly bowl( this was so good,the pork was tender and the sticky rice was just amazing,Fiery Thai shrimp fried rice, The Laksa Tribute( oh the coconut base,lemon grass was completely on point) an lastly Fish with chilly bean sauce.

Desserts

We had Banoffee Pie and Homemade American style chunky caramel sponge cake(Honestly this is my favourite sponge cake i have ever tried.

To complete the whole it would have taken the night because this was lot for 6 of us. we were there beyond the closing hours and the staff was so polite and courteous. That's what a great hospitality is!

Kudos to the team for such great work,service and everything. Highly recommended for Asian food lovers. This has become my new personal favourite Asian restaurant in Pune.

reviews.author: Aishwarya
reviews.description: I am not exactly a Thai lover but still wanted to try this place. The place has really nice with beautiful interiors and lighting. When you look at it from afar it’s quite attractive. The staff is really cooperative and friendly. We ordered the dumpling platter, sushi and stir fried noodles. Not exactly a sushi person but still liked it like the taste was better than what I expected and the dumplings were really nice specially the chicken and shrimps, the sauces they served with were really amazing. I loved the noodles. What I loved about the place was that they do charge charge extra service charge when we actually asked why we were being charged they were kind enough to tell us that they charge it because they feel it’s right but they would remove it if we wanted and it’s completely our choice whether we want to pay it or no and not like other restaurants where they are all argumentative about it and think it’s their right. If you have never tried Thai food and want to try I must say you should visit this place really liked it.

reviews.author: Poonam
reviews.description: We tried the veg Tom yum soup ,lettuce wrap , dumpling platter and spring rolls. Finished our meal with their sinful caramel cake dessert with Icecream. Still drooling over the dessert. Loved everything the ambience , service & food . Looking forward to trying different things from their vast menu. Loved it !!!

reviews.author: Avani Gade
reviews.description: Wow, Mamagoto is the most unique restaurant I have seen in Pune. The decor is amazing- the place kind of resembles a Japanese izakaya and a cool cafe put together. We went there for the unlimited dimsum lunch  and it was amazing! Each person gets a basket of assorted dimsum each, along with a soup and spring rolls and fried wantons. You can ask for unlimited refills of your favorite dimsums and they come with a huge range of dipping sauces. The dimsum are perfectly cooked, with succulent meats and super thin covers. We definitely plan to go there again to try the dinner menu.

pageno_286.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_286.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Chaitanyah
reviews.description: Find it incredibly overpriced for the taste!!! Ordered one more chicken dish i dont remember wt it was bt it wasn't tht good to either so yaa kinda boring place

reviews.author: Kaveri Kashyap Chiring
reviews.description: Awesome food, love the ambience. Good hospitality in terms of food, soup was good could have been little better. the fish was so perfect. Highly Recommended.

reviews.author: Ph H
reviews.description:
Awasome interior and good menu looked inviting but the saff was impolite ....
.
we walked out!!
.
had come with lot of expectations but floor manager was fussy and adamant to allocate seat —only of his choice....
....while the resurant was “completely empty” , at 12.30 in the afternoon.
.
A good food has to be complemented with equally good service..... we found service quotient missing.
.
Walked out !!

reviews.author: Abhishek Soni
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Their food is outstanding as it is in Mumbai. I wanna specially thank the manager Amal working here, he got us food on priority just because we were getting late. I’m overwhelmed by their hospitality. Order anything, the food tastes awesome.

reviews.author: Siddhi Singhi
reviews.description:
My 2nd time at mamagoto , but 1st time in Pune. The 1st time itself I really liked the food here, was not disappointed the 2nd time also. This time tried all vegetarian food. Ordered veg Laksa which was very yumm and a definite try. For people who want fun Asian food as the tag line says , do try their Thai puchka, it’s a Thai twist in Kolkata puckhas.
Bomb blast in your mouth for sure!!!!

pageno_287.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_287.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Akshay Bhagwat
reviews.description: Superb experience food was very tasty bacon wrapped prawns sushi wer amazing dimsu wer superb and sponge cake was out of the word it's a bit expensive but definitely worth it

reviews.author: Kainaaz Writer Bokdawalla (Kenzy)
reviews.description:
An Afternoon with Mama at Mamagoto

Mum and I decided to go out for lunch a couple of weeks back. After much deliberation we landed up at Mamagoto, a swanky new joint at The Pavillion (the mall adjacent JW Marriott - SB Road). Well, as it was moms treat it was only fair to 'katao' mama at Mamagoto. *evil grin*

reviews.author: Anushka Gupta
reviews.description: The Mama Madness continues ! With some of our fav dishes of the tasting! 😍1.) CHEESE & TRUFFLE OIL DUMPLINGS 2.) BACON WRAPPED PRAWNS 3.) CRANBERRY & PASSIONFRUIT MOCKTAILS 😍⭐ And a few pictures of the Quirky decor 👌🏻☺ Make sure you visit this new restaurant At Pavilion Mall SB road Pune ! 📍 💥✨ @casual_foodies @mamagotofunasian #followforfollow #instagood #friyay #weekendvibes #blogger #instalike #pune #love #foodporn #likeforlikes #india #panasian #chinese #thai #southeastasia #foodblogger #wow #yummy #new

reviews.author: Viraj Talim
reviews.description:
Having visited their Mumbai branch and left satisfied, I was very happy to learn that Mamagoto has finally arrived in Pune. I had some pretty good food back then, but this time it absolutely blew my mind. Mind you, this is the first time (of my two years on zomato) I have rated a restaurant a perfect 5. They do deserve it because all the dishes were perfect.

We started with the Momos platter (5.0/5.0). The coating was thin and not too doughy, the filling was hearty, and the condiments gave a kick that complemented the dish. If you visit, do try their momos, they are simply fantastic.

The Chicken Katsu (5.0/5.0) was the highlight for me. I absolutely love chicken and I love sushi. This dish combined the two into a heavenly combination. I just couldn’t get enough of it. The crispy chicken, the sticky rice, the soy dipping sauce, the sweet ginger, and the pungent wasabi; all these culminated to give a surreal experience for my taste buds.

Moving onto the mains, we had Mama’s spicy ramen (5.0/5.0). The name is a bit deceptive as the dish is nothing like traditional ramen. However, it was a superb dish. I had the vegetarian option since the chicken was served minced, I personally think that they should have served the chicken in bite sized pieces which would have added texture to the dish.

The Spicy Bangkok bowl (5.0/5.0) was a burst of flavours: sweet, spicy and salty. The small red chillies gave a nice heat to the dish. The basil counteracted the chillies balancing out the spiciness.

Overall, I’d say that if you want a really good Asian dining experience, this is the place for you. It is a tad pricey, but it’s well worth your money.

Peace \/

reviews.author: Gayatri Patil
reviews.description:
The first thing that you notice about this place is the perfect &  thought out Interiors, the place is so pretty that you may not want to know what they serve but just be a part of this absolutely authentic and funky ambiance.

Mamagoto a much awaited restaurant by many punekar has lived up to what they had us all expecting.

The food here was a culinary delight in so many ways but I have a few favorites that I have picked out for you to choose from.

Drinks - The Wasabi Mary

The drinks were interesting as they all had some or the other Asian aspect incorporated into them but the one that stood out was the Wasabi Mary - nonalcolholic. A Bloody Mary with an unusual kick with the addition of the wasabi , I've had a wasabi martini before but the Wasabi Mary was a level up. Loved the freshness of the drink and that spicy wasabi was just what an afternoon of binge eating needed.

Small Plates in the order of the ones I liked best ...

Smokey Chicken Tacos - Ohhhhh ! yes this was such a well rounded dish and the tacos were soft tacos and not the hard ones so it was really easy to eat them . The smokey chicken , salsa and the goats cheese were a great combination but I really wish they added a lot more of that cheese in there.

Crispy Lotus Stem- The best bite to go with your drinks, the crispness on the lotus stem was perfect and went so well with my Wasabi Mary.

Bacon wrapped prawns - This was my top favorite dish of the whole menu, bacon was smokey and yumm the prawns were well cooked and huge in size and the culmination of both into one was a match made in heaven

Street style spicy dumplings - This dish went well with the moto that Mamagoto has on the ceiling wall when u enter " You Dim sum you lose some .. But either way  mama's  always got your back". the dumplings were really yumm but missed on the spice a bit would have loved to have some more of the spiciness that described the dish

Mama's Calamari - I am a big fan of calamari hence this dish was a must one for me , the crispy and tasty calamari was great but a bit too oily for me.

Chicken Katsu Maki - Well again being a die hard sushi fan this one was a bit of a downer for me as the sushi was a little dry and so was the wasabi. 

Large Plates 

Bangkok Rice Bowl (chicken) - This was a one in all dish .. the tastes the chicken the boiled eggs on top perfect , tasty and absolutely asian. 
I loved the spice on this one it balanced out the one missing in the dumplings .

Deserts - Well you cannot finish you meal untill you have some desert and this one was an epic end . We ordered the Mams's Banana Split - Panko crusted banana fritters with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream. AN absolute delight on the taste buds and so nostalgic .. what  a great desert.

We loved everything that we ate and recommend that u should definitely try the above dishes.

Sameer Yummylicious Pune
