reviews.author: Vaishali Sontakke
reviews.description:
Very colorful ambience with chill vibes  :) :) 

I was looking for some Korean dishes and thought about this new place in the town.  Its located in pavilion mall, Easy to find straight on the second floor.

Very welcoming ppl here ! Celebrated a Friends birthday on the same day here :)

We were served with crackers and some tangy sweet sauce, Which surely excited the tastebuds, could not wait for the food more.

My order:   

Hua hin highway rolls : Was confused first, But this one is tastiest cousin of our very well known spring rolls.  Cheese is not too much.  Must try
Mama's Spicy Ramen noodles:  This a Korean style meal in a bowl, Steaming hot and spicy !
Though as said spicy , it was not overloaded with spice or chillies.
spicy corn and spicy soup broth.
I wish it was steaming hot, I think they served a bit late for us. Must try

reviews.author: Shravani Shekhar
reviews.description:
To be honest , this was my first time I laid my hands on Sushi ( Katsu Chicken) and I got to say it seemed authentic palatable dish. Another one was Prawns Wrapped in Bacon which was delicious and rightly cooked. The last dish was Stir Fried Udon Noodles which was tasteful.
This place is pretty expensive but if you wanna have the feels of Japan , you have to pay for it.

reviews.author: Sameer
reviews.description: Imagine a Pan Asian restaurant that has gone so overboard with their ambiance that you might as well start speaking Japanese by soaking in all the positive vibes and the Asian street art. A cool golden shinning wall made up of Maneki-neko that will attract good luck and fortune by just looking at it. When Six Cities, Sixteen locations, and Six hundred Ninjas have the One Dream then all this is possible and Mamagoto has all that and more.

reviews.author: Anushree Pradhan
reviews.description:
Since this was a date long overdue and me and my husband were having cravings for Asian cuisine, we decided to try out the highly-advertised Mamagoto (there’s a billboard right after Lonavala exit). ‘Your tummy is not a temple, it’s an amusement park’. It certainly must have enjoyed the ride of delicious dumplings and Java grilled fish we devoured.

Sometimes restaurants are quite stingy with dumpling fillings and you are left quite unsatisfied with minimalistic proportion. But Mamagoto’s non-veg dumpling platter is amazingly delicious with generous fillings of lamb, prawn and chicken. I was quite partial towards chicken and pok-choi dumpling.

Java grilled fish is basa (I think) marinated in spicy, tangy, sweet Indonesian Sambal, wrapped in banana leaf and grilled to perfection. The server offered me some honey as I was getting red from the heat of sambal. But I went on gorging the same..alternating on bite of fish and a sip of iced-tea. Love for food triumphed over any other discomfort.

We were left with almost no appetite after starters, as they are quite filling. But to end the date on sweeter note, we ordered Coconut and Palm Sugar Ice-cream. Two scoops of nice and crumbly coconut ice-cream with unique sweetness of palm sugar. This dessert is heaven! 

I am not saying anything about the drinks. Orange iced-tea is okayish and I didn’t try their Bloody Mary. 

Loved the attentive service and loved the food. Would love to visit again for that much-recommended ramen bowl!

reviews.author: Samuel Joy
reviews.description:
I happen to visit this place sometime back. The one thing that strikes you once you enter is the superb Ambience inside and a wall full of Maneko Neko cat on the right side of the bar. Greeted by the courteous staff, we immediately started off with Mocktails which was refreshing and a good respite from the heat. Below were the dishes we had:

Old School Gyoza Dumplings: I liked it personally as it was nicely presented and it was fried on one side as well. My veg friends didn't like it so much as it contained Baingan and tasted very different from the Momos which we get on the roadside stalls. My suggestion would be to skip on the baingan in that.

Prawns Wrapped in Bacon: If you are a hardcore nonvegetarian like myself do not miss this. Full of flavors, perfectly spiced and the sauce which it is made in is soo good that I almost licked it off the plate. One of my favorite dishes.

Mushroom Sushi: Couldn't recall the right name but was ok. it was mushroom wrapped in sticky rice and seaweed paper I guess. We didn't like it so much.

Mama's Spicy Ramen Bowl (Veg): This was the surprise. Quantity was enough for 3 people and it was very tasty and flavourful. Similar to Thukpa which I had in Leh but a much better version. One of the best comfort food you can have and healthy as well. 

Mama's Home Made Chocolate Cake: This was one of the best chocolate cakes I have ever had over a long time. Melts in the mouth not overly sweet and chocolaty, perfectly balanced piece of cake.

Being a fine dine the prices are reasonable for the quantity and quality you get and you should definitely give this place a shot if you are bored of the usual Asian food outlets. I will be definitely visiting this place again to try more from the vast & interesting menu..:)

Cheers,
Sam

pageno_289.name: Mamagoto

reviews.author: Mohit Date
reviews.description: Been to Mamagoto a couple of times in April. Loved the decor, seating is nice and comfy too. Their yom yum, and oriental soups are great. We also had the sticky rice, tofu in plum sauce, chiang mai noodles and mamagoto goreng. The goreng was the best among our choices. We loved the entire experience and will surely drop in again once they have their bar license !

reviews.author: Rini Diwan
reviews.description:
A much awaited restaurant for me, had heard so much about Mamagoto Mumbai! And well, it lives upto my expectations and all the hype. Situated inside pavilion mall, I absolutely loved their interiors. I have been to HK, and this reminds me everything about South east Asia! Their hospitality is superb with staff taking utmost care of their customers. Very polite and courteous which I loved!
Coming to drinks, we ordered orange iced tea which was very orangey and another one with watermelon(can't remember the name) which was super refreshing! Perfect for summers and we ended up ordering a second glass of it.
For food, we ordered street style spicy veg dumplings, spiced Asian bbq chicken breast and soggy Thai basil sticky fried rice. The dumpling were out of the world and the spice in it hits your palette just right. Chicken was very Indian which was a let down as I did not expect anything there to have Indian touch! But the sticky rice just made my world much happier and heavenly! It's a must try! I absolutely fell in love with the rice and it was delicious beyond imagination, may be the best Thai sticky rice I have had. Their portions are quite big(rice bowl) so just think before you order.
Overall I loved this place and Asian cuisine is slowly becoming my fav so I look forward to visit here again.

reviews.author: Rutuja
reviews.description:
This is a new restaurant opened in the Pavillion mall on SB road. We were just strolling on the third floor and looking for a new place to try food. We came to this place with trendy interiors and found the menu very interesting. We took table and started ordering.
SOUP: We ordered a vegetable oriental clear soup. The soup had good flavours but wasn’t that extra ordinary
DIMSUMS: We ordered for Veg. Street Style Spicy dimsums. The covering of the dimsum was thin and the filling was super yum.
MAINS: Veg. Pad Thai Noodles. The taste was good but could have been better.
Ambience: 10/10
Service: 10/10
Food: 7/10

reviews.author: Varun Rajasekaran
reviews.description: Elegant decor with Chinese painting and pictures of Chinese leaders. We ordered oriental clear soup and a chicken broth. The soup was the best clear soup I have ever had - so light, refreshing and healthy! The broth was also stumptous. Service was slightly on the slower side, but friendly. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.author: Saif Sayed
reviews.description: Great hospitality, loved the food and the ambiance. The service was very quick and the staff was very courteous. Would definitely recommend. Worth a visit!

pageno_290.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_290.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Yummylicious Pune
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is a very well known restaurant,which has recently opened it's doors in Pune,the place is located in the second floor of the pavillion mall.

As soon as you enter this place,your eyes will be stunned by looking at the beautiful art done on the walls and the ceiling,the suspended yellow lamps have given a more adorable look to the entire restaurant,once your order the food here you will definitely get entertained by the artistic walls which are enough to bring a smile on your face

Now,coming on to the food which i tried here:

1)MAMA'S CALAMARI:Crispy fried squid served with a mayo dip,the dish had a nice crispy texture and was just a perfect start.

2)SMOKEY CHICKEN TACOS:The presentation of the tacos was done in a unique way,the plate was full of papads,tacos stuffed with lots of chicken with green chilli mayo,asian sauce and topped with goat cheese,the smoky flavor of the chicken was coming really good and the dish turned out to be a good one.

3)PRAWN WRAPPED IN BACON:Prawns marinated in seaseme and japanese spices,wrapped in bacon giving it a smoky aroma,the prawns were perfectly marinated,the bacon had a nice crisp and the presentation was done really well.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

4)STREET STYLE DUMPLINGS:The dumplings had a lovely green colour stuffed with chopped vegetables,served with a red chilli and chinese vinegar sauce,they were bit oily for me and the flavors didn't came that good,otherwise the dish was good.

5)CHICKEN KATSU:Bbq marinated panko crushed chicken,cucumber and seaseme seeds,wrapped in nori(sticky rice),this dish turned out to be a really good one.

6)TRADTIONAL CRISPY LAMB:Crispy fried lamb,with bell peppers and spring onions,tossed in chinese spices,the lamb was full of flavors with nice crispy texture.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

7)SPICY BANGKOK RICE BOWL: Chicken minced in thai spices and herbs,served with a sticky fried rice,the rice had a perfect spice balance and really tingled the tastebuds.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

8)Banana split:This was really a unique dessert,banana covered with crispy coconut crumbs,topped with ice-cream and lots of peanuts,the ice-cream was creamy and came came really good with the bananas.

Overall a perfect place to spend quality time with your loved ones with good food and ambiance

reviews.author: Yash Dabhole
reviews.description:
❗Introduction❗

On the search for Pan Asian food and fearful of trying out any new random place?!
Well, we highly suggest you must try, Mamagoto, At Pavilion Mall, Pune!

It was the first Pan Asian Restaurant started in India with the idea of making Pan Asian food exciting for the people and to bring to them the true and authentic flavours of Asia!

With that being said, there have been changes in the "Mama"s experience as they call themselves, and the yellow doors which they had once opened for their customers have changed I've there years and are now red doors which welcome the customers warmly.

It has been their Moto, to serve delicious and authentic Pan Asian Food to the Indians.

This branch of MamaGoto, is the first branch of Pune. And has been started very recently.

⛩ Ambience ⛩

Trendy; Funky and cool!

That's the mantra they work on.

Being located in the Mall, on the second floor, this restaurant is spread out and has a simple decor. It has variety of pictures of Japaneese scriptures and characters on the walls.

There's a wall by the bar which beholds only the Japanese Cats. Numerous cats all lined up in multiple rows.

It's a fine dine with casual dining, it has a bar to one side, and the seating to the other.

The inside of the cafe has complete yellow lighting, whereas the outside of the cafe, has white light and is more brightly lit.

There's soft music playing in the background and a lovely positive Vibe which you get from the surrounding.

👨‍🍳 Service 👨‍🍳

The service was extremely quick.

Infact the staff too was very efficient. They all knew to speak fluent English and were extremely well mannered.

🍽 Food 🍽

The starters we had:-

1) Cheesy Tacos (veg)
- They were beautifully served tacos, two for a share!
They had a stuffing cheese with Mango sauce and a few mango pieces, mint leaves and Micro greens. With fryums by the side and also baked banana chips, this dish was accompanied with two sauces being the mustard and the tomatoe ketchup.

2) Chicken Basil Cups
- It is basically freshly and finely Chopped Chicken in a bowl with Basil and Crushed Pepper, and also, Chillies as small as the bird's eye!
Served along with sauce and Freshly set Lettuce leaves which are crunchy to bite into.
This dish is had, by wrapping the chicken in the bowl in the lettuce leaves, believing it to be the cup, along with the basil Flavour which is added onto the chicken.
Trust me, it's absolutely delicious.

3) Prawn wrapped in Bacon
- Tiger prawns are marinated in Japaneese Sauces and given a spicy flavour. This spice is the neutralised by the Smokey Bacom which is then Wrapped around it.
Together, these two taste like fir and ice... Going together like a magnet.

4) Java Grilled Fish in Banana Leaf
- It's served along with Sticky Brown rice, this fish is wrapped in Banana Leaf initially.
The fish is marinated and grilled in the Malaysian Sambal flavour and extremely spicy even though absolutely delicious.

The dumplings we had:-

1) Chsese and Truffle Oil Dumplings (veg)
2) Traditional Peaking Dumplings (non-veg)

Dumplings here are their speciality. A must try. Lovely and delicious dumplings. Be it veg or nonveg, their cooking and enhancement of tastes is that to perfection.
Served in a cane basket, served on banana leaves, steaming hot with the aroma of lipsmacking hunger coming right out of it.

The Mains we tried:-

1) Spicy Bangkok Bowl (veg)
- Vegetables mixed with Spices and Herbs, served with brown sticky rice.
There is a Nonvegetarian variant to this as well wherein they toss boiled and shredded chicken pieces into the rice.

2) Fiery Thai Shrimp Fried Rice with Asian Green Chillies Chicken Ribbon (nonveg)
- Its a rare delicacy wherein they serve Sticky rice with prawns and different flavours of various spices and other seafood as well.
Along with seafood, there are shredded pieces of chicken and garnished with an egg half-fry on the top.

In Desserts we had:-

1) Sticky rice with Mango
- Sticky Coconut Milk rice, of which the top half is soaked in beetroot water so as to get the pinkish colour.
With Mango pieces on the top along with a Tulsi leaf, this dessert was given along with extra coconut milk to pour on top of it.

2) Mama's home made chocolate Cake!
- Just like the Homemade chocolate cake, this one was topped with molten chocolate and sugar.

3) Home-made American style, Chunky Caramel Sponge Cake.
- This was the best dessert of the day! It's surely a must try.
The Caramel- Toffee Sponge cake was absolutely delicious. When biting into it, there was syrup oozing out of the sides and the cake, which suggested the softness of the cake. In combination with vanilla Ice cream, it tasted as if heaven on earth.
The hot and cold combination was amazing and much required after a full course meal.

🛑 Havrat Jodi Says 🛑

Lovely place to be with family and friends!
Amazing food and extremely positive vibes from this place which plays soft music in the background so that you can have conversations over dinner, is really a place you would love to be at.

Our highly recommended place for Pan Asian Food, not just in Pune but Mumbai as well.

Especially try out their momos, all of them are absolutely delicious.

reviews.author: Amogh Bhandarkar
reviews.description:
Could be your next go-to option whenever you feel like having asian food or Could be your next hangout place. This place is a perfect blend of both. Serving a wide range of food stuffs which will satisfy your cravings if you want food close to the authentic oriental cuisine. Ambience is cozy, the place is partitioned in two sections with beautiful wall paintings and Japanese art all over. Lights to make your mood. The service overall was prompt, with polite and suggestive staff helping you make your experience the best one here.

Positives: Good taste, Closer to authentic, Good portions of dishes, Good variety, Cozy ambience, Beautiful wall art.

Recommended for: Everything from a Romantic date to a Family outing.
(Suggestion: Reserve your place before hand)

What I had:
Mocktails: All the mocktails I tried were really refreshing and unique in appearance.
They were: 1) Kiwi and Mint collins
2)Cranberry and Kaffir Lime punch
3)Passion fruit and Orange cooler (My personal favourite)
4)Watermelon Beach

Soups:
1) Tom yum Shrimp: This soup had a really amazing with a mildly hot and sour taste, if thats something you look for in your soup, then go for it.

2)Chinese sour and pepper chicken: Perfect for soup enthusiasts! Recommended.

Starters:
1)Rock Shrimp Tempura: Shrimp dipped in batter and fried, served with a unique sauce, definitely a thing you should try. Though looks quite simple, No One Can Eat Just One.

2)Java Grilled Fish in Banana leaf: Fish blended with spices, wrapped in a leaf and steamed to perfection.

3)Chicken Basil cups: Minced Chicken dish, served with empty basil cups. Idea is to place a desired portion in the basil cups and have it. Must try!

Main Course:
1)The Laksa tribute Chicken
2)Mamas spicy Ramen bowl chicken
The above two dishes came in good portions and can be even shared by two people easily.
People who love Ramen are in for a treat.

Desserts:
1)Mamas Banana Split: Vanilla ice cream served with two halves of banana fried in batter, till crispy.

2)Homemade American Style Chunky Caramel Spongecake: Something you should save some space for each time you visit this place, Amazingly soft cake, topped with caramel. Once you dig in, you wont be able to stop.

reviews.author: Tanjug Singh
reviews.description:
Have been to other outlets of mamagoto so went to try it in Pune
Even though space was there they made us wait for about 10 mins to arrange to sit us and it was like a fish market kids running around people talking too loud, firstly it’s a restaurant not a pub this both the management and the people who visit should understand and be courteous to others in the place, then order time the juice machine it seems has not been working for some time so that option was ruled out n no clue when it would be up n running placed veg n non veg sushi, the first one came and the other order was no where in sight had to call the server to ask him to cancel then pronto the order came in.
Even after such an experience I would still give it a plus coz they being from hospitality industry thought of putting the customer first and waived the charge for the second dish and also gave desert on the house.
A request to the management please ensure that the loud talking people and children running around be taken care off, as people come in to have a good time and eat food not ...
Sushi was decent , mocktail was good
The rating could have been definitely a 4 plus had things not been the way it was today

reviews.author: Viraj Patil
reviews.description: Oh man! It was funny. I ordered noodles and asked to serve them, the waiter instead of serving he took the dishes and packed them for parcel😂 I mean seriously man ! Ambiance is good. Food quality is okay okay. Once visit place.

pageno_291.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_291.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Damini
reviews.description:
⏺"Mamagoto" - 'Fun Asian eating' is what the tagline says, and why wouldn't it be fun? With their Manga inspired art and Asian street hawker inspired quality and creativity, it's sure to serve as a feast for your eyes and tongues.

⏺Ambiance -The Japanese themed ambiance lifts up your mood and it feels quite rejuvenating. You can sense the exoticism in every nook and corner of the premises. Right from their trademark 'lucky cats' to their typical cutlery as well as artifacts, everything seems top notch. There's some nice, cozy seating and, overall, the place looks very bright and colorful.
.
What I had there -
⏺Mocktails -
▶Cranberry & Kaffir Lime Punch - A sweet, savory & gorgeous mocktail which is full of colors as well as colors is the perfect drink to have at Mamogoto. A delicious blend of cranberry juice with kaffir lime leaves mixed with lime wedges will make your taste buds tickled. I loved this more as compared to other Mocktails. Recommended!❤
▶Passion Fruit & Orange Cooler - Fruity flavors splashed in your glass with the freshness of passion fruit & a drop of lemonade to add citrus flavor & it is served as an ice cold. A perfect mocktail for summer sipping & I'll suggest you have this if you're passion fruit lover.
▶Watermelon Beach - Watermelon & mint this combo is always been my favorite one & is ideal for summers also. Fresh watermelon juice mixed with mint & lime. Mint & watermelon both are cooled. Sweet, refreshing & its color is a feast for eyes!
.
⏺Soups -
▶Tom Yum Shrimp Soup - Tom Yum is one of the most well known thai recipes. The simple yet satisfying soup which is perfect for busy nights or lazy afternoons. Traditional Thai soup with shrimps in it. Its broth was the soothing, fragrant & just right amount of spice to clear up your sinuses. It was slightly spicy sour savory & loaded with shrimps. Creamier in texture & slightly white in color which is definitely going crave you for more sips.Highly Recommended!❤
▶Chinese Soup & Pepper Chicken - It's best bowl Chinese soup which you've ever tasted! With almost 22 small ingredients. A simple & classic Chinese sour soup with hot peppers & chicken in it. Warm & comforting with a nice taste. An absolutely gorgeous take on hot & sour soup for all chicken lovers.
.
⏺Appetizers/ Small Bites -
▶Rock Shrimp Tempura - Shrimps dipped in simple tempura batter & pan fried served with homemade chili mayo.I loved the flavor of sauce & crispy shrimps. They will taste better if you just dip the shrimps in a sauce & then eat them. Great flavor though & one worth ordering!
▶Java Grilled Fish in a Banana Leaf - What an Asian Temptation! A typical Indonesian side dish. Fish rubbed with spice & marinated with Indonesian sambal then wrapped in an aromatic banana leaf, steamed & served along with a mound of sticky rice. The combo of complete spices blended nicely with banana leaf. Fish was tasty & fish lovers shouldn't miss this.
▶Chicken Basil Cups - An aromatic mix of minced chicken, fresh basil, bird eye chilies, crushed pepper in a crispy lettuce green cups! The rich, savory flavors & tender bites of chicken are addictive.I couldn't stop eating until it's gone.Highly Recommended!❤
.
⏺Main Course -
▶The Laksa Tribute Chicken - The laksa tribute nonveg bowl yellowish in color & topped with wedges is their famous version of Chinese Malay laksa with the classic noodle soup & containing a coconut base with lemongrass, galangal & red chilies with chicken in it. A flavorful broth with chicken & noodles & something which isn't so common. I had this first time & enjoyed it thoroughly. Recommended!❤
▶Mamas Spicy Ramen Bowl - Now this name is more than enough to make me go crazy. Ramen's are love from Asian cuisines.A healthy bowl of ramen is a total flavor bomb, filled with a rich flavorful & spicy broth, minced chicken along with buttered corn kernels & balanced spinach topped with crowning glory if you ask for it - The Ramen Egg! It is everything. Highly Recommended!❤
.
⏺Desserts -
▶Mamas Banana Split - Again something uncommon & which I tried for the first time. An eggless dessert with toasted caramel & panko crusted banana fillceers with salted caramel sauce &topped with the scoop of ice cream, drizzle with the sauce. It was enchanting & taste was good.
▶Caramel Sponge Cake - I ate a lot of it & am not sick of it yet. Homemade American style chunky Caramel sponge cake with truffle sauce served warm with vanilla ice cream. Layers of brown sugar cake filled & topped with caramel frosting & a drizzle of Caramel.A decadent, delicious & sinful dessert with soft caramel & smooth consistency. I was incredibly impressed by this. Highly Recommend!❤
.
All-in-all, Mamogoto is a perfect place for Asian cuisines. They don't serve authentic food instead they always keep on experimenting with it. Their bar will be up very soon.Food was mesmerizing only Mocktails were up to the mark but not best of best otherwise I would have rated 5/5. Other than food I liked the service & no doubt ambiance too. Every member of the staff committee had knowledge about what they are serving & was kind too. Also thanks to PR team for hosting us so sweetly.Mamogoto is definitely going to be outstanding! Cheers!❤

reviews.author: Abhijeet Subhash Murkute
reviews.description: Visited this place few days back. First impression of this place is like wow. Its very well decorated place. The interiors are superb. Plus their staff is super friendly and helpful. The food is good, their seating is very comfortable and quick service. Do visit once.

reviews.author: Sujay Karmakar
reviews.description:
Finally Its here! Mamagoto has finally opened its 17th outlet at the 2nd floor of pavillon mall

here in pune and being a fan of pan Asian cuisine I was super excited to try it.

Ambience: Mamagoto has an inside as well outside seating with an elegant ambience, decorated with different frames, colourful pictures, quotes, They have a complete wall full of Maneki-neko which looks absolutely stunning and not to forget the floral seating that they have.

The service was extremely amazing.The staff was very attentive and we were treated really warm.All of them had the correct knowledge regarding the food and was being served to us.

Coming to the food:

Beverages:

1. Blueberry pop rock: It's our very own infamous GOLA. This is worth a try to just add a fun element. You can choose POP rock in Blueberry or lichi but being a blueberry fan I went with it. It had a sour, sweet taste and very refreshing in this heat.

2. Cheesy Tacos: Panco encrusted goat cheese was served with mango and kimchi sauce. I personally never imagined having mango in tacos but after having this I was a big fan of it. The complete dish was very appetizing.

3. Cheese and Truffle Oil dumpling: Truffle oil originated as a way to add the luxurious flavor of truffles to the dishes. There was a perfect balance of the taste. All the flavors were well balanced.Loved the plating as well, it was minimalistic yet beautiful. This is a highly recommended choice.

4. Spicy Bangkok Rice: The rice was served with a layer of spicy sauce and topped with potato wedges. The flavors were absolutely delectable. The gravy was loaded with various finely chopped veggies and sumptuous spices. The large bowl is more than enough to serve two people easily.

Coming to my favorite part, desserts

1.
Homemade American Style chunky caramel sponge cake:
 Let me tell you, you have to order this dessert before leaving this place. It's heaven. My Words fall less to describe how much I love this dessert. Bang on flavours.Absolutely. The cake was made to perfection. Perfectly baked, right moisture not at all flaky, was served with vanilla ice cream and toffee syrup to be topped. I highly recommend you to try it out. 

2. Sticky rice with mango:
 Being the season of mango we had to order it. If you are someone does not have sweet palate this might be a good option for you. This wasn't much sweet but rich with flavours and topped with mangoes was something that was light on taste.

3.
Mamagoto homemade chocolate cake: 
Two huge slices of chocolate cake topped with chocolate syrup. The taste was really great but It was a bit flaky and dry for me. I wish they could have served it with vanilla ice cream too! 

Mamagoto has to be the by far best place I have visited for Asian cuisine. It’s a must try for all the Asian cuisine fan. Even if you’re not a fan, Mama will not disappoint you.

reviews.author: Priya R Singh
reviews.description:
I went here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch.The Ambience is beautiful and is a mix of both modern and vintage interior.

From the beverage section I ordered cranberry and lime punch with mint which was refreshing

From the food menu I ordered Thai chicken and water chestnut salad which was delicious and was crunchy because of the cashews adding to its taste.

Then I ordered Classic chicken wings and Smoky chicken Tacos which was a take away
Both of the dishes were good chicken was nice and tender.
Classic chicken wings were spicy which I liked a lot and Tacos had goat cheese added which enhanced the taste.

For the dessert I ordered Mango with Sticky rice which was beautifully layered and served with sweet coconut milk.It was delicious with a balanced taste of coconut, cream,and mango.It's a must try.

The staff is courteous and friendly.

reviews.author: Arvind Patil
reviews.description:
The latest entrant in the Sino-Thai cuisine arena in Pune, Mamagoto's is different in the sense that it's a semi-casual joint with an upper price range fare.
Located in The Pavillion, ambiance is just good (4/5) but with a bit too cramped layout and seating for comfort.
Food (4/5) was good but did not match the (high) prices. We had Tom Yum Veg soup (excellent), Street Style Spicy Veg Dumplings (good), Spiced Asian BBQ Chicken Breast (excellent), Stir-fried Udon Veg noodles (good). The quantity of the noodles seemed inadequate as it was supposed to be for sharing between 2.
Service (4/5) was good in that waiting staff was attentive, prompt. Leftovers were packed in a neat way.

Overall a definite 'go to' place and well worth a repeat visit.

pageno_292.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_292.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Manasi Agarwal
reviews.description: Love the way this place is done up. Very bright, colorful and full of positive vibes. I had heard so much about this place that had to visit it and it did not disappoint at all. Everything that we ordered from soups , starters, main course to desserts was good. There was no dish that I had any complaints about. The flavors were so good in all dishes. I had the water chestnut spring rolls which was yummy, the street style dimsum was good, the sweet corn soup was excellent, pan fried veg noodles with black bean sauce which is nice and banoffee pie which was delicious. Love the food and can’t recommend this place enough. Will be going again with family and friends

reviews.author: Rujuta Deshpande
reviews.description:
Had been waiting to try Mamagoto since it opened in Pune and we decided to visit the outlet for a Sunday lunch. Booked a table over the phone and were glad to do so coz the rush was mad! We chose to sit in the outside section amidst some really quirky and typical Mamagoto decor! 

Coming to food, one word - Flavorful! 
We were a party of 5 with decent appetite and ordered the following. Went all veg this time: 

For starters:
Veg dumpling platter - Offers 5 types (2 each) of delicious dumplings! If you love your dumplings, choose this to try maximum variety! They all had a unique taste and we loved them! Made us consider coming back for their unlimited dumpling festival!

Crispy Wonton with chilly tofu - Star dish for most of us! The tofu is simply delicious and pairs well with the wanton. And, the quantity did not disappoint. High recommended!

Soup: 
Tom Yum Soup - Great in quantity and the first thing to hit your taste buds is its fresh lemongrass flavor! Packed with veggies, the soup was quite wholesome

Drinks: 
Lemon Iced team - This was like the usual and pretty standard, nothing extraordinary.

Virgin Mary with a dash of Wasabi -  LOVED it! Comes in a tall glass with a stick of celery and a kick of wasabi! Recommended if you like Bloody Mary

Mains:
Spicy Bangkok Bowl: Sufficient for two, the veg version comes with potato wedges. Great to opt for instead of the typical fried rice and you will not be sorry!

Mama's spicy ramen bowl: My personal favorite from the entire meal, and a dish that would keep taking me back to Mamagoto! This is what real soul food is! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! It's well balanced and can easily be shared between two

Pan fried noodles in black bean sauce: Another great dish that you can try. Opt for this in case bowls / woks aren't your thing   

We are full to the brim by the time we finished our meal and couldn't try the desserts. The bill valued to around Rs.3500 for all the above. 

All in all we would rate Mamagoto as below and surely comeback to try their non-veg options and the dimsum festival! Do plan to visit this place for some good south Asian cuisine!

Food:

4.5/5

Service:
3.5/5

Decor:
4/5

P.S: Just clicked two pictures coz the food smelled great and we couldn't wait to dig in!

reviews.author: Rushad Irani
reviews.description: One of the most finest Asian Restaurants in Pune. Absolutely loved the ambience. The Tom Yum Shrimp soup was amazing. Dumplings, Honey Chicken, Bangkok Rice were a 5 🌟. Overall experience was wonderful with the family. A Beautiful Sunday afternoon lunch. Will definitely become a regular food. Must visit.

reviews.author: Shane Dhunjibhoy
reviews.description:
The opening of Mamagoto in Pune has been much anticipated, and the hype generated by all he paid bloggers & social media posts made it appear to be not what it quite was. Don’t get me wrong, there wasn’t a thing I was disappointed with but it just didn’t live up to the way the food critics and all made it out to be. I get it that you get paid so you write and snap your best but you need to keep it real because making a good restaurant appear to be fabulous only makes people anticipating it to be fantastic feel extremely let down.

The food was good nothing I would “die for” or crave but yet delicious and my choice of food if I were here again. The prices are quite high for the kind of establishment.

Nice meal but I’ll come when I’m here next not coming here for the restaurant.

reviews.author: Sheetal
reviews.description:
I came here after reading reviews and bcoz of my love for South Asian cuisine. As Gandhinagar is my hometown now, it was a pleasant experience to get good service and even better food. The food scene in Ahmedabad is pretty sad if you are a 'food snob' (my husband's words).

We tried Thai, Malay and Japanese dishes and with an exception Nasi Goreng, everything was on spot.

Even that wasn't bad but just different.

Certainly recommend this place to anyone who loves good food, lovely ambiance

pageno_293.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_293.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Neha Joshi
reviews.description: After a very long time I was taken aback after entering a place. Right from the ambiance, to the interiors, to the seating... everything was wow! Coming to the food, you might find it overpriced while ordering. However, once you see the quantity, you'll be (pleasantly) surprised there too. Every dish we ordered was enough for two. The star of the evening was the Homemade American Style Chunky Caramel Sponge Cake with toffee sauce. I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Rachit Dongre
reviews.description: New place in Pune a outlet which is already based in Major cities,the appetizers we had were Hua hin Highway rolls which was their version of spring rolls however the taste was very good and unique with some asian twist, then we had Vegetable basil cups which were very delicious never had something in my eating experience before, this item is a must try for everyone very unique moving on in big plates we had the Pad thai which is a kind of flat noodles, it was not their specialty but still gave a try those were good but I’ll recommend to try something else.

reviews.author: Avneet Sabharwal
reviews.description:
Love the food here. I have visited this place in Delhi many times and couldn't contain my happiness when I saw it opened here. What a nice Ambience and super se upar food. I am a lover of Asian cuisine and their flavours always satisfy my taste buds to the fullest.
Do try their Bangkok mango rice meal bowl.

reviews.author: Leela Narayanan
reviews.description:
Saturday night dinner was at the newly opened Mamagoto at Pune. The ambience here while opulent is not overwhelming and quite inviting. The warm color tones used immediately put you in a comfort zone.

The Menu is also quite beautiful and exhaustive and being a large crowd we were able to sample quite a few dishes. For starters there was an array of dumplings and maki rolls. Rainbow Chicken Dumplings, Prawn and Celery Dumplings and Veg Crystal Dumpling were our choices for the night, my favorite being the Prawn and Celery Dumpling. Although i must mention the delicacy of the dough of the veg dumplings which were crystal clear as the name suggests and the water chestnuts in the filling elevated the taste to a whole new level. The Katsu Chicken Maki roll were quite delicious as well.

For the main course you will be spoilt for choice. The Signature Rice and Noodle bowl portions are quite generous! The Spicy Bangkok Bowl (Chicken) and the Chiang Mai Train Station Noodles (Khao-Suey) tick the right boxes for flavor and taste. Perfect one bowl meals these!

The Chicken with Garlic and Aniseed aroma with Crispy Spinach and the Fish in Chilli Bean Sauce packed a powerful punch perfectly paired with Fried Rice and Noodles.

The Banoffee Pie is quite sinful followed closely by the American Style “Chunky” Caramel Sponge Cake for those Sweet Indulgences. The Restaurant has an array of refreshing Mocktails and Juices to accompany your meal. It warrants mentioning that this elaborate meal does not leave you feeling heavy but happily sated.

The staff at #Mamagoto are warm and hospitable with a good knowledge of their menu and food (quite lacking in many restaurants).

All those Pan Asian Food lovers should head over to Mamagoto at The Pavillion!

reviews.author: Vedashri Nachan
reviews.description:
Been to their Bandra outlet.
In Pune,while hanging out with friends went here to grab a quick bite and was amazed to look at the ambiance.
Mamagoto Asian tradition on four walls and top ! Was too tired still had a walk to click pictures.Ordered Non Veg Auntys platter which consisted of chicken satay,spring rolls,dumplings and chicken baskets all amazing.
The staff was friendly too.
A bit high on pocket but great on experience.
Being their recent launch we had complimentary dessert.

pageno_294.name: Mamagoto

address.streetAddress: 2nd Floor, The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune
address.addressLocality: The Pavillion, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune

pageno_294.servesCuisine: Asian, Sushi, Japanese, Thai, Salad, Desserts, Chinese

reviews.author: Alakta Abhyankar
reviews.description: For starters, the ambience here is so charming, vintage-y and really classy. The staff is very polite and helpful. The options on the menu are enough to confuse the hell out of you. Almost all the dishes looked really exciting and it would be good to come here with a fairly large group to try out the menu. We had the Khou- Suey bowl (main course) which was really filling. The portion size was very generous and it was more than enough for the two of us. I'd definitely go here again.

reviews.author: Anvi Singh
reviews.description:
I had one of the best experience out of all the Pune restaurants I have ever been to yet at Mamagoto in Pune.
Being a regular at the Mamagotos in Delhi I was already assured of the authenticity of the cuisine offered here, as well as the unique ambience.

Ambience:
The colourful oriental decor and the gorgeous lighting alone make this outlet worth a visit.

Service:
The service here is extremely good. We were always well attended to and felt the warm hospitality of the staff throughout our visit. There was some confusion with one of orders, we'd ordered chicken but we got veg but when we informed them they promptly offered to replace it with the correct version, we chose to continue with our existing dish.

Food:
We ordered Tom Yum soup and Mamas Spicy Ramen Bowl. The Tom Yum soup was delicious, I enjoyed the flavour of the lemongrass and the spicy tanginess. The Ramen was also good and I was pleasantly surprised by the the taste of the vegetables, as I'm usually not a fan of vegetables.

Dessert:
Right before we left they gave us a caramel Spongecake on the house! It was a rich delectable dessert, that I would definitely order next time I'm there.

Overall the experience was amazing! Highly recommend anyone in that area to visit Mamagoto!

reviews.author: Saurabh Gupta
reviews.description:
We went for a team lunch at this place..thought of exploring this new restaurant we had heard the reviews about in Bangalore and Delhi.
Food - Taste-wise the food is good..decent variety on the menu. However, it was bit oily for Asian cuisine. Also, they can definitely do with bigger servings.
Service - Slooooooowwwww doesn't even begin to describe it! To top that, major messing up of orders..served us lamb in the name of chicken and veg in the name of chicken (which is a bigger offence!). May be they ran out of chicken. :P
Ambience - Spacious.. Nice decor... very different from elsewhere...seems like a favorite for non-indians.

Recommend it if you are looking for a 'delayed' surprise :)

reviews.author: Rahul Ajmera
reviews.description:
Mamagoto is the Asian restaurant chain with a branch at Bandra, Mumbai. This is their first branch in Pune at a really fine location.

The double height is comforting and the quirky ambiance is typical of the restaurant. Service was really quick and the staff was responsive.

Recommended Dishes:
Vegetable Crystal Dumplings - Excellent mixed veg stuffings of water chestnuts, carrots and shiitake mushrooms.
Cucumber mint mocktail - Refreshing and tangy.

Average Dishes:
Som Tam Salad - Spicy raw papaya salad with peanuts.

A meal for two would cost about Rs. 1500 here, which is expensive but it's worth the experience of having some good Asian food.

reviews.author: Raj Bajaj
reviews.description:
A Beautiful place to Hangout and chill with Friends..Variety of Foods...Service is a Ok, but you know good things take time...Suggested Dishes to have are Prawns Wrapped in Bacon, Spiced Asian BBQ Chicken Breast, Sticky Rice with Mangoes
Ambience - 9/10
Service -7/10
Food - 8/10
